results.description:
Since we had low response? I am moving the time back to 845am.

PLEASE READ: WE have a 9am start time for travel & networking, We will start at 9am with introductions & go till about 10am? More networking from 1015am.

Happy Mother's Day to all the Mothers in our network! 

We understand that MOST of you are busy on Sunday with family and if you do not have plans, here is what we are offering: 3-4 Meetings in the next 24-48 hours.

If any is available for a Meeting Sunday Night? PLEASE LET ME KNOW!

This is my post for Monday Morning! YOUR INPUT PLEASE

or Lunch time? AND

Monday Night! We Posted the Starbucks for now as a Central Location:

We also understand that MOST of you work on Monday & may not be able to attend? Some of you have also told us that you work on evenings or weekends? and could we have something during the day? So here we go!

Hi guys! 

This will be a meetup to enable each of you to present one major obstacle that is making it difficult for you to take the next step in your Real Estate Investing startup goals or if you don't know what your next step should be. We will all brainstorm to come up with a few solutions. Please post your issue/situation in the comments so we can get the wheels turning.  

(I have closed over 250 Deals & done so without a job or using my money, credit or banks. YES, it is possible. I have also investing over $250,000 in my education over the last 25 years & I am making offers every week! IF YOU ARE NOT MAKING OFFERS, You are NOT a real estate investor! We will talk about that too!)

Also,

 I have not chosen a meeting place yet for some of these meetups. I know a few of you mentioned an interest in a dedicated work room. However, I called a couple of libraries and they charge for meeting rooms. If you have a suggestion for a free workspace, please let me know. Otherwise, I will select a restaurant/coffee shop type place. (Just did for Monday night)

The location will be determined by WHO communicates with me?

We can meet in Brooklyn where I am now? or Queens or Manhattan?

I am prepared to go anywhere, since I can. 


More details coming,

TALK TO ME everyone! TEXT me at[masked] or 

Post your comments, suggestions, date, time, location,

offer to HELP with the group!

Thank you,

Marc

results.description:
Event page: sbciotnewyork.eventbrite.com

Event Info:
On May 9th, Startupbootcamp IoT | Connected Devices will make a stop at Fat Cat Fab Lab in New York as part of its international tour to support the area’s best talent in IoT and hardware. Startups within the Consumer or Industrial IoT space will have the chance to meet Startupbootcamp mentors during a series of 20 minute one-on-one sessions to gain valuable product feedback and learn more about the Startupbootcamp IoT | Connected Devices program in London. Attendees will have the chance to meet IoT experts and mentors throughout the day, learning more about the wider IoT ecosystem in Europe and beyond.

This is a rare opportunity to receive feedback from industry experts, and as a result only ten startups will be able to join the event. It is important you register for the event as soon as possible here - sbciotnewyork.eventbrite.com.

Click to tweet:
http://ctt.ec/6b92P

For Facebook / LinkedIn:
For anyone working on a connected device, the global growth accelerator Startupbootcamp is hosting an IoT and hardware meetup on May 9th in New York. You can learn more about what they're offering startups, whilst gaining product feedback from IoT mentors and experts. Sign up here: sbciotnewyork.eventbrite.com.

results.description:
Join other new mamas at these meetings tailored to moms of newborns up to 12 months old. We'll discuss the ups and downs of life with a newborn/baby -- all aspects of breastfeeding (successes and challenges), the realities of caring for a baby, navigating the new world of parenting, sleeping patterns (or lack thereof) for you and your baby, and much more. But most importantly, the hope is that you will meet other Rivertown/Westchester moms of babies who will become treasured new friends. This is a group for all new mamas, including second-timers and formula-feeding mamas. The group size varies from week to week, but it's typically 6-10 moms. Further information is available here:

http://www.rivertownmamas.com/groups.html

The group operates on a pay-what-you-wish model, and payment is made anonymously (unless paid by credit card). Suggested: $20 per meeting.

Greetings Fellow Tennis Players!

It's time to play!!! 

This Meet-up notification serves only as a notification reminder of the 
Spring league registration dates and format. RSVP's only serve as 
notification that you intend to participate in the spring league. To 
officially register visit us http://acestodeuces.teamopolis.com­.  League play starts May 14th. See league details below.

Sessions to come out an play tennis are titled Hitting Sessions and are 
typically held on Monday, Wednesday and Saturday weather permitting.

The league operates as follows; once registered you will receive a roster of whom you're scheduled to play within the 8 week regular spring schedule. The roster will include each members contact information so that you can determine a time and place to play that is suitable for each of you. If a place can not be determined a default midpoint location will be provided.

 Beginners ( Ranking[masked]) -Green group

Men's Intermediate (Ranking[masked]) -Yellow group # 2

Mixed Doubles (Combined Ranking of[masked])- Orange group

Advanced (Ranking[masked])-Red group


There will be a total of 5-7 members per division.

The Winner of each Division will receive a Trophy !!

The Spring season is <a>from </a><a>May 14th to June 25th</a><a>.</a> 

Spring Registration is <a>from April</a><a>1st to May 14t</a><a>h</a>

The cost per participant is 50$. 

To Register go tohttp://acestodeuces.teamopolis.com, Select Division tab on the lower right hand side of Page.

results.description:
Bonjour, les amis!

My two-and-a-half, Oscar, and I so enjoy reading books in French together that we thought what could be better than to read with friends? We would like to invite you to an (in all honesty) experimental Monday afternoon en français on the Upper West Side. Here is the idea: Mondays 3:30-4:30pm I will select say three books in French from Oscar's library. I will read them and then we'll all comment on the story and especially on the images. Warning: there will be a lot of silliness. Those hoping for good ole' French finger wagging should abstain . . . The fee is $10. Ages 0 to 4. I can't wait to be silly in French with you all!

Bisous,

results.description:
This is a walking tour in Central Harlem. Join us and explore the word-class visual vocabulary in the largest neighborhood of Manhattan. We will explore its storied past, interesting present and visualize the promising future of this dynamic community.

Itinerary:
• The Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture
• Harlem Hospital Mural 
• Abyssinian Baptist Church 
• Strivers Row (architectural gem of the community) 
• Harlem's Walk of Fame 
• The Apollo Theater 
• And Much More 

We will explore these and more sights using the visual links immediate to the location.

Reservations:
RSVPs are required. If later you realize you will not be able to attend please change your reservation. If you RSVP and fail to attend without notice you will not be able to make future reservations. 

Where:
Participants meet with the guide (Juan J.) ten minutes before tour begins in front of the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture map here. Walk concludes at the Apollo Theater; map here.

Cost:
$20 per person. Paid on the day of the tour. Cash only. **Special Offer: If this is the first tour you are participating in you get to name the price at the end in the form of a gratuity.**

Some of the Sights we will experience:

I look forward to meeting you and showing you a great time in a great section of New York!
results.how_to_find_us: Participants meet with the guide in front by the entrance of the meeting location.

results.description:
We had so much fun last time that we are doing it again, and we got VIP tix!


We have a block of 20 tickets for our group to see a live taping of the Comedy Central show The Nightly Show with Larry Wilmore. Continuing in Comedy Central’s grand tradition of producing groundbreaking late night formats, “The Nightly Show” highlight's Larry Wilmore’s distinct point of view and comedic take on current events and pop culture. Hosted by Wilmore, the show features a diverse panel of voices, providing a perspective largely missing in the late night television landscape.

PLEASE DO NOT SIGN UP FOR THIS EVENT UNLESS YOU KNOW THAT YOU CAN 100% BE AT THE TAPING AT 4:45PM.

Can I come alone?  Yes 99% of those attending will come on their own. Each person will have the opportunity to invite a guest. If you wish to bring more people (up to 4 you must guarantee that they will all come)

How should I dress? business casual

How long does it last? We will be out of the taping by 7pm.  Following the taping the group may go to a nearby restaurant for dinner.

You can join us for FREE, but again PLEASE DO NOT SIGN UP FOR THIS EVENT UNLESS YOU KNOW THAT YOU CAN 100% BE AT THE TAPING AT 4:45PM
results.name: FREE VIP Tix -LIVE Taping of Comedy Central's The Nightly Show w/Larry Wilmore

results.description:
Weather: Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.

Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.


Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
"To practice Zen means to realize one’s existence moment after moment, rather than letting life unravel in regret of the past or daydreaming of the future.

To “rest in the present” is a state of magical simplicity, although attainment of this state is not as simple as it sounds. At the very least, sitting Zen practice, called zazen, will bring about a strong sense of well-being, as the clutter of ideas & emotions falls away and body & mind return to natural harmony with all creation.  Out of this emptiness can come a true insight into the nature of existence, which is no different from one’s Buddha nature." —Peter Mattheissen

A weekly Meditation Group in the Zen Tradition.

Open to All!

Every Monday

5:30 — Beginning Instruction
(If You are new to Meditation/Zen style or want a refresher, please arrive a few minutes early)

6:00 — Zazen/Seated Meditation (*)

6:25 — Walking Meditation (*)

6:35 — Zazen/Seated Meditation (*)

results.description:
Come for the sheer joy of moving to the music, in a nurturing and supportive setting.

Whether you have never danced before or want to continue, this is a class for you.

The classes are one hour and half in length and provide quality instruction.

Ballet is one of the most healthy and intense forms of dance.
It can provide a complete full-body workout, increasing your flexibility, range of motion and strength.

It’s also a great alternative to aerobics.

The classes are on-going, join in anytime.

PRICES Walk-Ins: $20.
Package: $180 for a card of 10 classes (over a course of 6 months).
Talk to us about multiple class per week discount!

ABOUT THE INSTRUCTOR
Bruce Weitzmon is a choreographer, dancer and teacher. His work has been presented in the U.S.A. and Canada. Bruce was the director of the Theater Dance Center, a non-profit dance education and performance organization in Rockland County, founded in 1981. After many years directing TDC, he returned to New York City to teach. Now after more than 10 years there, he is returning to offer a weekly schedule of classes in Nyack, NY.

VISIT US ON FACEBOOK
For more about the Dancers’ Art class schedule, rates or any additional information please visit and like Dancers’ Art on Facebook at www.facebook.com/DancersArt or call[masked]-1973.
results.name: ADULT BALLET CLASS Level: Elementary

results.description:
I am a Spanish native speaker and suggest we meet at Think Coffee to help you to improve your Spanish!

There is a maximum of 6 students per group and costs $10/person if more than 3 people come to the class and $15/person if 1 to 3 people come to the class.

My phone number is[masked] just in case you cannot find me.

Don´t sign up if you are not sure you can come.

The lesson lasts 1 hour.

Hasta pronto!

Beguinner level means: you are not able to speak without the help of the teacher, you just know really little common expresions. We will go thought the basics.

Intermediate level means: you can explain yourself with the help of the teacher, you can build up sentences but they are basic or you make mistakes on them. You have lacks of vocabulary and grammar.

Advanced level means: you are fluent in Spanish, you can explain yourself without a lof of problems. You know the vocabulary. Advanced students normally make gramatical mistakes when they talk and can forget some words, that is perfectly normal.
results.name: Spanish conversation Advanced. $10/person if more 3people or $15/p if less

results.description:
Come experience the holistic healing modality of Core Energetics for free!

Please note that this Meetup is only open to those who have not attended before as space is limited.

Core Energetics is a body-oriented psychotherapy that works with a person's emotional blocks, often held in the body. Life can be more joyful when old pain is released through energetic movement. We bring consciousness to old patterns to free ourselves and make lasting changes. 

Focusing on a holistic process involving body, emotion, mind and spirit, Core Energetics is a mode of healing that combines bodywork, psychotherapy and spiritual process. Core Energetics is applicable to many problems people face such as depression, anxiety, low self esteem, addiction, childhood and adult trauma, general dissatisfaction or a search for more meaning in their life. This method also works with stress management and chronic physical problems, including sexual dysfunction. 

A typical session consists of a combination of traditional talk therapy to bring consciousness and awareness to issues as well as various body movements to activate held energy in the body. Dr. John Pierrakos founded Core Energetics in 1978 and most forms of body psychotherapy and transpersonal work in the United States are informed by his work.
results.name: Introduction to Core Energetics (Body-Oriented Psychotherapy)

results.description:
Bob walks through provisioning an Azure environment using PowerShell that contains Storage, Service Bus, DocumentDb, IoT Hub, Stream Analytics and API Management and a custom microservices for provisioning devices.


BIO

Bob Familiar is the National Practice Director for Application Services at BlueMetal. As National Director, Bob leads a team of seasoned Principal Architects who are responsible for industry research & development, rapid prototyping and outreach to the technology community. They are responsible for defining BlueMetal's technical direction and offerings and provide strategy and guidance to BlueMetal clients on their most important and challenging projects. Bob is an accomplished software professional, evangelist and author. Bob has been working in the software industry for 30 years, holds a patent in object relational architecture and technology and is author of Microservices, IoT and Azure available from Apress publishing.
results.name: Twist My ARM - Automating Azure Using Powershell

results.description:
On Monday, May 9th, join New York City cigar and scotch enthusiasts for our first ever event at Lexington Bar & Books. Guests will taste new cigars from La Pluma Cigars as well as two scotches from Bunnahabhain and Black Bottle. After the pairing, guests can enjoy more scotches from the extensive Bar & Books rare scotch menu.

Dress code: business casual. Bring a business card for our raffle for free cigars and scotch!

For 24 Hours, a limited number of tickets are on sale for $20!La Pluma Cigars

One of the most exciting new cigar brands to come out of New York in the last decade. Blended by Jonathan Maccia at the world renowned Placencia factory in Esteli, Nicaragua, La Pluma Cigars is one of the newest and most exciting cigar brands to hit the U.S. market. The cigars are produced by the same family behind other releases from Casa Magna, Rocky Patel, Gurkha, and more. 

Bunnahabhain 12 Year Single Malt Scotch

This whisky is the stuff tales are made of and inside the new bottle, the whisky speaks for itself. The nose offering a fresh and aromatic experience with a subtle whiff of smoke floating through the air. The taste starts with a light fruit and nut appeal that leads to a spectacular malty sweetness, finishing into a beautifully rich full-bodied, lingering experience.

Black Bottle Scotch

Master Blender, Gordon Graham, toiled night and day on his new creation. Expect fresh floral scents to the very deepest, oaky notes. All carried on spice-flecked wisps of delicate, peaty smoke.

Lexington Bar & Books

Established in 1990, Lexington Bar and Books was the third of the growing Bar and Books family, located on New York City´s Upper East Side, adjacent to the city´s most exclusive shopping avenues, Madison Avenue, and the expensive residential Park Avenue. Lexington Bar and Books caters primarily to Upper East Side residents, their friends, and visiting guests. The dress code is strictly enfoced; casual yet stylish proper attire is requested.

The Fine Print / FAQ

You must be 21 or older to purchase tickets to this event. Those under 21 will not be allowed entrance into the club.

By signing up for this event, you give FineTobaccoNYC permission to send future cigar event invites via email.

What is your refund policy?

A full refund in the form of credit toward a future Fine Tobacco NYC event is available until 24 hours before an event.

Why do tickets cost a small amount more than advertised?

Eventbrite charges a small fee on each ticket sold which is added to the flat price of the ticket in return for use of the service. 

WHENMonday, May 9, 2016 from 6:00 PM to 9:00 PM (EDT) - 

Add to Calendar

WHEREBar and Books Lexington - 1020 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10021 - 

View Map
results.how_to_find_us: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/a-midsmoking-nights-dram-tickets-25095936622

results.description:
RSVP here: http://beginnerprogrammers.nyc (Mandatory)  


Meteor is a full-stack web development framework that runs on the Node platform. In this class, we’ll introduce key concepts in getting started with full-stack web development with Meteor and React.

We’ll be using the newest versions of Meteor, which introduces numerous significant changes, including native module support and lazy loading (if you’re not familiar with those concepts, don’t worry, you’ll learn all about it in the class.)

React is a ground-breaking new approach to building the view layer (or user interface) of both web apps and native mobile apps.  We’ll be using version 15.x, which includes significant changes compared to previous versions and allows us to build components using the new ES6 syntax.

If you are familiar with previous versions of these tools, this workshop will be a great opportunity to get caught up on the most recent syntax and practices.

Prerequisites

• Basic knowledge of HTML, JavaScript, and use of a command line terminal.

• A laptop with a code editor of your choice installed.  We’ll be using Sublime Text.

• We’ll be using Mac OSX. However, Meteor is available for Windows and Linux as well.

• Please be sure to install Meteor prior to class.

• Having git installed is also highly recommended. (Each step in the course will be a git branch.)
results.name: Intro to Meteor.js and React.js

results.description:
Come enjoy eats at one of NYC's newest veg spots as NYC Vegan EatUP's head herbivore Demetrius Bagley dons his astrologer hat, and reflects on what's happening with the stars above (and thus the Earth below). 

Make your way back to the party room, find a seat, place your order, and start eating around 6:30. Sit back and listen 7 to 8. This month, he'll discuss the energies of Gemini! Note: this session is intentionally geared for astrology beginners. 

Attendees must buy at least $10 worth of food and/or drink from VSpot Organic, this event series' gracious host. Individual checks will be issued. A suggested donation of $5 is requested for the speaker. 

Demetrius Bagley is an award-winning movie producer (Vegucated), and nationally recognized events producer. He’s godfathered projects like Vegan Street Fair, SoCal VegFest, Veggie Conquest, and many others. Since 2004, he’s led NYC Vegan EatUP, one of the world’s largest vegan Meetups. Recently, he wrote about being a 20+ year vegan in “Letters to a New Vegan”.


Demetrius is also an internationally published astrologer who wrote Vibe Magazine's celebrity horoscope column 2010–2011. He published and sold customized annual Personalized AstroDatebooks from 2007–2013. In 2012, he project coordinated the anthology book, “Astrology: The New Generation”. He is the marketing & design dude for the annual State of the Art (SOTA) astrology conference.
results.name: astrology du jour covers Gemini (no prior knowledge necessary)

results.description:
Note: We will start at 6:30 exactly.  

This month we will do a fireside chat with one of New York's tallest (and most talented!) CTOs.  Artsy is one of the hottest New York startups and has a great culture.  They are very committed to open sourcing their code, and do many other fun things.  Daniel somehow finds the time to continue maintaining open source technology, while working with ever-expanding team.  

In addition to his technology, dB is also an artist.  

You can check out his blog and his art at his site, including some of his previous talks about creating slack bots, managing, and open sourcing by default. 

Bio: 

Daniel Doubrovkine (aka dB.) is a seasoned entrepreneur and technologist, CTO at Artsy.net in New York, working on bringing the art world online. He is a maintainer of multiple popular open-source projects, including  Java Native Access,  Ruby Grape, Hashie and the popular Slack Ruby client, bot and server libraries. Daniel graduated from University of Geneva in late 90s and founded and sold Vestris Inc., an early stage technology start-up right after college. He joined Microsoft as Development Lead, was Director at Visible Path, then Architect and Development Manager at Application Security.

As always, a group of us will hang out afterwards at a bar nearby.  


We like to hang out at Rye, which is at 11 W 17th St, New York, NY 10011, between Avenue of Americas and 5th.   They have both drinks and food.   http://ryehousenyc.com/
results.name: Fireside Chat with Daniel Doubrovkine (aka dB), CTO of Artsy

Our weekly Meet Up will take place at Scotty's Steakhouse and Comedy Cove in Springfield, just a bit off of exit 9B on Route 24! The address is 595 Morris Ave, Springfield.


There is a world of gaming outside of the traditional Monopoly, Scrabble, Risk, etc. Whether you're looking for something new and different, or you're a seasoned gamer, you'll find a friendly and welcoming bunch of friends to game with.  Be adventurous , come learn some new games or play your favorites!

We begin gathering around 6:30 pm and are fully underway by 7pm.

Because the event takes place at a restaurant that serves alcohol, there are strict rules against gambling of any form.  Guests under 21 are welcome, as it is a restaurant. Since they are letting us use the space for free, they expect that we will order food and drink, so there are some rules:

1.  No outside food or drink, not even bottled water.

2. Please plan on ordering food and/or drinks.  Support the venue.

3. Tip the waitstaff generously.  15% is standard, but 20% is even better. We want them to love having us there, and in this case, money does buy you love.


4. If you plan on attending regularly, please consider a small contribution to cover The Tipsy Meeple's costs for using Meetup.

We bring some of our games, but feel free to bring your favorites, or learn one of ours! And don't be shy about learning new games, we are more than willing to teach a new player! Can't wait to see you there.

results.description:
Note: Due to the Holiday, we will be covering this 4 hour course over 3 weeks.  On the first two weeks we will cover an hour and a half of material rather than our usual hour.  It would be a good idea to pre-watch as much of this course as possible so that you are familiar with the material before the course.

Angular 2 is one of the fastest, most popular open source web app frameworks today, and knowing how to use it is essential for developers. You'll learn how to create components and user interfaces, data-binding, retrieving data using HTTP, and more.

Whether you are new to Angular or new to Angular 2, if you want to create great web apps and stay up to date on the latest app development technologies, you're going to want to come up to speed quickly with Angular 2's components, templates, and services. This course provides the basics you need to get started building an Angular 2 application. First, you'll learn how to set up your environment, learning about components, templates, and data binding and how they work together. Next, you'll discover how to build clean components with strongly-typed code, as well as building nested components and how to use dependency injection to inject the services you build. Finally, you'll cover how to retrieve data using HTTP, navigation and routing, and you'll revisit the Angular 2 setup process. By the end of this course, you'll be up to date on all the latest Angular 2 knowledge and you'll be able to use Angular 2 to create great apps in the future.

About the Author: Deborah Kurata is an independent consultant with over 15 years of experience in designing and developing successful Microsoft .NET applications as well as mentoring software developers. Her focus is on iterative design and development, and automated unit testing. Deborah has authored several books, including the "Doing Objects" series (Addison-Wesley), "Best Kept Secrets in .NET" (Apress) and "Doing Web Development: Client-Side Techniques" (Apress). Deborah speaks at conferences such as VSLive and TechEd. For her work in support of software development and software developers, she has been recognized with the Microsoft Most Valuable Professional (MVP) award.
results.name: Angular 2: Getting Started - Week 1 of 3

You’ve never seen a fairy tale like this b4! Our friends at FANGORIA are hosting a free NYC screening of THE CURSE OF SLEEPING BEAUTY, director Pearry (NECROMENTIA) Teo’s new horror fantasy. Set in present day, the movie stars Ethan (NOTHING LEFT TO FEAR) Peck, Natalie (TRUE BLOOD) Hall, India (UNDERWORLD: AWAKENING) Eisley and original WILLARD lead Bruce Davison.

Rising indie horror sensation Teo, who also helmed DRACULA: THE DARK PRINCE, THE GENE GENERATION and THE EVIL INSIDE, will attend the show and take part in a Q&A!!


Teo and Josh Nadler co-scripted THE CURSE OF SLEEPING BEAUTY from the Everette Hartsoe comic book. Here’s the official synopsis for the movie…

"THE CURSE OF SLEEPING BEAUTY is an entirely new, dark vision of the classic Brothers Grimm adventure. Thomas Kaiser (Peck) inherits an ancestral mansion that has been in his family for generations—only to learn that he has also inherited an ancient curse stemming back to the Crusades. Forced into his new role as ‘protector’—the guardian appointed to keep the evil demons in the house at bay—Thomas must unravel the mystery of the house, while struggling to awaken the beautiful Briar Rose (Eisley), held captive in a terrifying netherworld seen previously in his dreams."

www.fangoria.com/new/sci-fi-horror-the-curse-of-sleeping-beauty-gets-free-nyc-screening-on-may-9th


This is a free FANGO screaming. To get tickets you must send an email to [masked]. List 'CURSE' as your subject line and send them your full name. Your ticket will be good for you and one guest. Names will be checked at the door. Seats are first come first shat. Seating is Not guaranteed, so arrive early! This exclusive event is presented by our pals at XLrator Media, who release THE CURSE OF SLEEPING BEAUTY to theaters on May 13th and on iTunes and VOD on May 17th.

Prepare yourself for a very grim fairy tale (this ain’t Disney, folks) and see THE CURSE OF SLEEPING BEAUTY on May 9th. FANGO Editor Emeritus Tony Timpone will be hosting the show, plus expect some extra surprises. Watch for an interview with Teo on their site soon, plus stay tuned for future screening announcements.

https://youtu.be/_gDTwBFF_Lc

results.description:
Friends. We all have them, for better or for worse. Some of us have a hard time finding them, some can't stop making them. But in the end, we all need friends in this big, scary city and these are three that we've come to rely upon in New York's mapping and data experiences. 


And to go all totally meta 'n stuff, we are going to make some of our wonderful geo-friends TALK ABOUT FRIENDS. So get ready for a great night of three wonderful women who have each made a massive impact upon their fields in NYC and beyond. Join us and be our friend(s), our BFFs, our arm-buddy, or our conference bestie. 


SPEAKERS
Giorgia Lupi giorgialupi.com [@giorgialupi] is an award-winning information designer and researcher, she is co-founder and design director at Accurata data-driven design firm with offices in Milan and New York. Her work in information visualization frequently crosses the divide between digital and print, exploring visual models and metaphors to represent dense and rich data-driven stories. Giorgia received her M-Arch at FAF in Ferrara and she then earned a PhD in Design at Politecnico di Milano in 2014. Her design work has been featured on the New York Times, Wired, the Guardian, Popular Science, Time Magazine, The Washington Post, Forbes, among all.Her work has been exhibited at: the New York Hall of Science, The Storefront for Art and Architecture in New York, Triennale Design Museum in Milan, Milano Design Week and Somerset House in London. She is currently authoring and designing the Dear Databook, published be Penguin (Uk) and Princeton Architectural Presso (US), in the Fall.

Jessie Braden www.pratt.edu/savi [@jessiebraden] [@prattsavi] is the co-founder and Director of Pratt Institute’s Spatial Analysis & Visualization Initiative (SAVI). SAVI uses GIS and visualization to understand urban communities and collaborates with non-profits and academic partners on projects. Educating mappers to think critically about data and to understand the complexity of spatial information is a current area of focus for SAVI. Jessie also developed and coordinates SAVI’s GIS & Design certificate program and she teaches GIS in Columbia University’s Graduate School of Architecture, Planning and Preservation. 

Wendy Brawer greenmap.org [@greenmap] [@wendybrawer] Designer and ‘climaterian’, Wendy Brawer is best known as the founding director of Green Map System, a nonprofit that engages local communities in 65 countries in mapping sustainability and social change using a shared set of icons and tools. She has published numerous NYC Green Maps and produced public exhibits, tours and workshops. In addition to mapping green sites, Wendy is pitching in on energy, cycling and community green infrastructure projects, all connected to her personal Agenda 21. With exciting changes taking shape at Green Map, this talk will share new ways to get involved in support of our common future.


Caroline Bauer curbyourlitter.org  Director of "Curb Your Litter : Greenpoint"

Caroline Bauer is the Director of Curb Your Litter: Greenpoint, a project she co-designed with Alan Minor and Dana Rachlin to solve the Greenpoint’s litter problem and reduce overall waste produced in the neighborhood. Prior to bringing this project to the Greenpoint Chamber, Caroline was a Project Manager at the Design Trust for Public Space, where she worked on a diverse portfolio of projects to improve NYC’s public realm. Her most notable projects at the Design Trust included developing the first-ever data collection toolkit for urban gardeners and farmers and co-editing the forthcoming Under the Elevated: Reclaiming Space, Connecting Communities book with the NYC Department of Transportation.

OUR SCHEDULE 
6:30PM:    Mingle: doors, beer, pizza, dumplings! and people 
7:00PM:    Presentations & Q&A  
8:30PM+:  The after hours celebrations
results.name: Friends Talking About Friends

results.description:
We will power up the Major Welch, take in the sunset & socialize briefly at Perkins Tower, then descend on the AT.

We will meet in the main parking lot. If you are running late, you are welcome to catch up with the group if we have begun. You may also begin early if you would like extra time.

This is not a beginner hike. You should have some hiking experience and be getting regular exercise. While it is only four miles, there is significant elevation gain on the Major Welch.

Make sure you have a copy of the map, a headlamp, and minimum 2 liter of water. If you fall behind during the hike, you must be prepared to finish on your own. Faster hikers are not obligated to wait for slower hikers. Typically we meet at the parking lot and begin together. As we ascend, the group breaks off. We will do our best to reconvene at the peak and begin our descent together. The amount of time we spend at Perkins will depend upon the weather. You must feel comfortable hiking out on your own should you fall behind. We would love to have everyone join but due the nature of an evening event we can not make accommodations for those who are unable to hike independently. There is no sweep. If you are unsure whether or not this is for you, please email me with any questions.

Heavy rain cancels and would be determined that day if necessary.

Distance: about 4 miles

Gain: about 1200

Hike time: 2 - 3 hours

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED (for both real grass and artificial grass)! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: WE HAVE A PERMIT.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- David T.)

(Co-Leader- Francisco)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is canceled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

Everybody is welcome!  Experienced meditators as well as totally new ones, we all gain with the experience.  We'll explore Deepak Chopra teachings on meditation and mindfulness and will discuss practices to take into our daily life.   

I'll lead a meditation as learnt at the Chopra Center, very easy to follow and yet profound.  Come and share your questions and meet other Mindful Meditators!  Let's build a community of friends one meditator at the time. The meeting is free and $10 anonymous contribution is suggested, only if you are so motivated and if you can.  Nobody is denied entrance.

results.description:
Do you hate Networking as much as most of us do? Are you also bad at it, often wondering why no one returns your calls or follows up with you after a "Networking Event"? Join us in any of our cities for "The Art of Active Networking", and let's change everything you believe about Networking! 

Take a look at our site and what people say about the events here: TheArtofActiveNetworking.com 

Come see why over 12,000 people have attended worldwide!  Tickets are 20$ on-line on our site until 6pm the day of the event and 30$ at the door until 7:00pm. Each event typically ends about 9:30pm! You must purchase a ticket online in advance to get the 20$ pricing. 

At this event you will make some amazing connections and you will learn why Networking is not about what you get, but what you give and what I call my #GIVE4. You really only need to meet one person to make your entire night worthwhile if you know what you are doing. You will have an opportunity to speak to everyone in the room, and you will absolutely meet people you might otherwise never have an opportunity to meet and you will see that's it's not what you are selling or how you sell it that matters, you will instead learn the importance of building 'know, like and trust' relationships! Finally you are then invited to join all of our groups and pages and use our FREE walls to post up what you might be looking for, all of those links are on our homepage near the ticket link.

Everything you need to know about this event is on our site. Join the pages and the groups, spread the word and also take a look at my TEDxFulton Street talk, also on our site.

TheArtofActiveNetworking.com

I, Mark E. Sackett started this in San Francisco over 7 years ago as a way to help others do better in life, love and business. I own 13 companies and live in San Francisco. I hop between Los Angeles, New York, Vancouver BC and my hometown of Kansas City often. I'm a Director, Producer, Designer, Art Director and Public Speaker. Working daily in Branding, Marketing, Film, Television and Music and as an events producer and speaker allows me to talk about and thrive, while living an authentic, powerful and creative life.

My Mantra: "The power of us all working together is so much greater than anything each of us can accomplish on our own." 

See you soon and I hope your year is about beautiful, powerful connections. Connect with me by clicking below to start sharing my massive networks with those you can help to do better each day!

BE WELL, BE CREATIVE, BE GREAT!

Mark E. Sackett

President/Creative Director/Executive Producer/Director/Public Speaker

Mobile:[masked]|

MarkESackett.com

TheArtofActiveNetworking.com

venue.name: Rosicrucian Cultural Center of New York City

results.description:
A young man name Lucius becomes fascinated with witchcraft is transformed into a donkey. Passed from owner to owner his ordeal exposes him to many trials and ordeals until the magic spell is broken by the goddess Isis and Lucius is initiated into her cult. This story of transformation has many mystical implications which are discussed from a Rosicrucian perspective. There will be a discussion period and meditation.

The facilitator,  E. Bernard West serves the Ancient Mystical Order Rosae Crucis (AMORC) and Traditional Martinist Order (TMO) as a lifetime member. During his many years of membership he is known for his expertise in Egyptian, Greek and Roman mythology.  He is a retired Army Officer who currently serves as the TMO Provincial Master in Georgia and  Grand Councilor  for Georgia and Louisiana for AMORC EGL. He also serves various masonic affiliations including Master of a Prince Hall Affiliated Blue Lodge, Patron of an Eastern Star Chapter, a Noble of the Mystic Shrine and Grand Inspector General 33ᵒ United Supreme Council. Bernard has a Master’s of Art in Political Science and a PhD in American Studies and is a published author.

The discussions will take place Monday through Friday from 6:30 pm to 7:30 pm.
results.name: Discuss the Metamorphosis of Apuleius from a Rosicrucian Perspective

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Monday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

Most people arrive at 6:30pm.  We use the first 30 minutes to talk, order food/drinks, and pick out games while we wait for any people that are a little late.  Promptly at 7pm we split into groups and play our games that typically take 2 hours to play.  So, if you arrive after 7pm there is a good chance that you will not be able to get into a game and can watch us play if you'd like.  At the end of the night we play a couple of additional shorter games that you can get into.

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's (We are located 1 room over from the pool tables).  This group meets at the dining tables directly in front of the bowling lanes. There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Kingsburg, Stone Age, Lords of Waterdeep, Istanbul, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Splendor, Pirate's Cove, Five Tribes, Castles of Burgundy, and more.

results.description:
Presented by the New York Academy of Science, this is the 3rd talk in the 6-part 'Physics of Everything' series. Tickets to the series can be purchased at a discount. Tickets do sell out well in advance.

Tickets / details here: http://www.nyas.org/Events/Detail.aspx?cid=858b6ce6-7e6b-4067-b877-aff7245bb8da

Featuring: Kevin Slavin (MIT Media Lab) and Lee Smollin (Perimeter Institute for Theoretical Physics)
Moderator: George Musser (Spooky Action at a Distance)

The advent of sophisticated computer technology has allowed studies of complex systems such as cell colonies, neurons in the brain, the immune system, economic markets, and social groups. In complex systems, simple, nonlinear interactions are iterated over time and give rise to self-organization, evolution, learning, and adaptation—phenomena that eluded explanation until now. This panel, including computer scientist and entrepreneur Kevin Slavin and selected physicists, will explore whether studies of complexity complement traditional physics or may upend science as we know it.
results.name: NYAS..Complexity: A Science of the Future?

results.description:
Men's Pick-up basketball in Hunters Point, Long Island City.

The cost is $10.75 for this session. 

Once you RSVP to a specific session, no refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before committing to that session.

It is a regulation sized court, but we divide it into two games simultaneously with each playing 4x4. We will do our best to break up the teams evenly at the outset, after which it's the luck of the draw based on who's sitting and who shoots in from the losing team. There will be a sign-up list for each court, and players from the losing team must shoot foul shots to play next, not be chosen by those already sitting.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. No fighting, rough playing, or screaming allowed. You will immediately be asked to leave the gym.

No food or alcoholic beverages allowed into the school. Save it for after the game.

All games must end by 8:45pm

From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson. Walk straight back towards the River to Center Blvd(in the direction of the city).

results.description:
COME CHECK IT OUT FOR ONLY $5 BUCKS!

WRITE YOUR SCREENPLAY  
A Screenwriting Workshop With Award Winning Screenwriter Jacob Krueger

Whether you’re a young writer picking up the pen for the first time, or an old pro looking to inject new life into your writing, this exciting eight week workshop will teach you a whole new way of looking at the fundamentals, and help you integrate your artistic goals into your real world life. 

Jacob’s groundbreaking approach to feedback fosters a close-knit community of fellow writers, whose only goal is to support you in yours. Together, you’ll discover a new form of feedback that keeps the focus on what really matters: your story and how you want to tell it. Learn more.

About Jacob Krueger

Throughout his career, Jacob Krueger has collaborated with all kinds of writers, from Academy Award Winner Michel Legrand to Tony Award winners Alain Boublil and Claude-Michel Schonberg (Broadway’s Les Miserables).

Now, he brings his groundbreaking techniques directly to you, with unique Workshops, Master Classes, and Private Coaching designed for writers of all levels with an interest in writing.

Build the writers life you've been seeking today.

"Jacob Krueger is a true collaborator, totally dedicated to the project, leaving his ego behind, but nevertheless demanding the highest standards because of his sharp dramatic sense and intuition."
--Claude Michel Schonberg / Composer, Les Miserables

MORE INFO:  <a href="http://www.writeyourscreenplay.com/"></a>http://www.writeyourscreenplay.com/wys


MEETUP MEMBERS CAN JOIN AT ANY TIME.

NORMAL COST: $350

MEETUP MEMBERS:  Check out the first day of this workshop for only $5 bucks with no obligation!  (New Students Only!)

Class Size is Strictly Limited To Allow All Students The Opportunity to Workshop And Receive Feedback On Their Writing. You MUST RSVP to attend this event.

You'll LOVE this workshop or your money back!

results.description:
• Heal the emotional wounds of past relationships
• Transform deep seated patterns of abandonment and rejection
• Let go of unhealthy dysfunctional relationships
• Develop the ability to remain centered in the core of your being
• Become truly loving and accepting of yourself
• Develop a warm magnetic presence that will draw others to you
• Cultivate inner beauty
• Increase your capacity to give and receive love
• Attract a healthy and loving partner
• Create healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Develop a stronger connection with the higher power
• Learn to evolve spiritually through your relationships


My friend Sema was telling me about how she had fallen for a man, but he had not called her in some time. Sema told me that she felt this man would come back to her somewhere down the road. Yet she also acknowledged that on another level she was experiencing a fear of loss and that she didn’t feel that there was much hope for the relationship. Sema told me later that evening that she could never seem to hold onto the men that she truly wanted to be with.

Sema was obviously strung out on the man, but she was very disconnected from the underlying pain that was driving her. Sema’s head was just spinning in circles as she analyzed everything the man said or did and why he wasn’t with her at that time. I could see that the hurt buried within Sema was keeping her attached to the man in a very unhealthy way…

Does this sound familiar?

Many of us are struggling to find love. But no matter what we do, love always seems to evade us.

I’ve been there myself and I didn’t know if I would ever find the love that I desired. But I persevered because I was very determined to heal and have someone special in my life. I discovered a series of practices that have enabled me to heal the emotional wounds and to develop a magnetic presence. These practices are making it possible for me to attract more loving partners and to create healthier and more fulfilling relationships. I have now decided to share these practices and understandings so that others can also create more love and intimacy and to attract someone truly special.

Open Your Heart by Healing the Emotional Wounds That Carry Over From Childhood and Past Loves
Most of us are still carrying the emotional wounds from our childhood and our past loves. We try to block the hurtful feelings and memories out of our awareness. But these feelings and experiences remain trapped within our body and mind. We then give off a vibe that causes us to attract and become attracted to dysfunctional people who create even more confusion, pain and suffering in our lives.

Learn to “digest” the emotional baggage that keeps you trapped in unfulfilling relationships. Transform the deep seated patterns that cause you to attract people who are negative or abusive or who do not have the capacity to truly love you and be present with you.

Heal the loss of past loves. Heal the shame and the feelings unworthiness, rejection and abandonment. Become clearer about what you really want in life and in a companion. You will naturally attract and find yourself attracted to healthier people as you heal the wounded parts of yourself. More and more love will flow to you as you begin to experience true love and acceptance for yourself. Working with these practices will make it possible for you to cultivate inner beauty and to develop a presence that is very healing to others.

Develop the Kind of Warm Magnetic Presence That Will Attract a Healthy and Loving Partner
Many of us have learned to disconnect from our emotions and are not very present within our bodies. The stresses, emotions and life experiences that we fail to digest accumulate within our body and mind. These stagnant energies and emotions can extinguish our inner fire and passion. Stagnant energies decrease our desirability which makes us less attractive to others.

A body that if full of vital life force is infinitely more desirable. Become powerfully present while remaining centered within the core of your being. Exude warmth, passion, sensuality and desire.

Develop Your Intuition and Sensory Awareness
Heightened intuition and sensory awareness lets us know when it is safe for us to open up to another person. It helps us to understand where people are coming from. Our intuition also guides us to the people that we are meant to be with.

Use Your Relationships to Evolve Spiritually
Healing the hurts and resolving the issues awakens the part of the soul that resides within your body. Awakening your body-mind will enable you to develop a stronger connection with your higher self and the universal consciousness.

Develop Chi Power
Many systems of Chinese martial arts emphasize the development of the dan tien, which is our base of power in the lower abdomen. You will learn specific chi gong practices that will enable you to continually cultivate the chi/shakthi in the dan tien. Developing Chi Power enables you to create a powerful magnetic presence that draws others to you.

Create Healthier and More Fulfilling Relationships
Relationships have a way of bringing our core issues to the surface. Buried emotions and unresolved issues create barriers between ourselves and others. Our love grows stronger and our understanding deepens as we learn to “digest” our emotions, resolve important issues and express our feelings and needs in a healthy way.

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time and I have very limited access to the internet. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can heal from the loss of a love and develop a more attractive presence. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

Sign up for my free monthly internet journal at http://www.doiohm.com...

Please go to http://www.facebook.com/healthyandlovingrelationships

and click on the LIKE button at the top of the page to join the community and gain access to new articles.

results.description:
It is accepted that word of mouth and peer recommendation are the most effective forms of advertising, and their effectiveness is even higher when the people talking about a product or a service have established their authority and credibility around a certain topic.

Influencers have the ability to affect the actions and behavior of people, these influencers are often bloggers.

In the fashion industry, bloggers are the most influential people. They have hundreds to thousands of followers on their social media channels and therefore they are a huge asset to have if you plan to launch a product that targets fashion lovers. and you need them not just to blog about your product once you launch, but also to get their prospective and connections even at the very beginning.

Join us for a great event! 

Agenda:

19:00-19:15 Gathering

19:15-19:40 Shenhav Kimhi,  Digital Marketing and E-commerce Director at Undies.com.

 Kimhi will share her insight and her tips on how to pitch bloggers and how to work effectively with social media.

19:40-20:00 Yael Vizel, CEO & Co-founder of Zeekit

Vizel will share her experience working with bloggers to spread the magic of digital try on! Zeekit allows bloggers to engage with their followers by letting them see themselves digitally wear the outfits featured on the blog.

20:00- 20:30 Gil Eyal, CEO & Co-founder of HYPR. 

Eyal will talk about how startups & influencers can build successful collaborations and how startups should build the perfect campaign for their relevant audience.

20:30-21:00 Networking
results.name: The Power of  Influencers!

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

results.description:
• Awaken your body and mind’s innate healing powers
• Develop healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Learn to work constructively with your own emotions
• Stimulate your minds innate problem solving capabilities
• Develop new resources and capabilities
• Become clear about your life’s purpose
Develop your intuition by tapping into the innate intelligence that resides within your body and mind
Our bodies communicate with us all the time. Many of us are so over stimulated and stressed out that we cannot hear what our bodies are saying. We age faster and suffer many health problems when we do not know how to listen to what our body is telling us.
Discover the amazing wisdom that resides within your own body. Ben will show you how to develop your sensory awareness. Learn to truly listen to your body and care for its needs.
Stimulate the mind's creative problem solving capabilities by learning to "digest" issues, emotions and stresses
Many of us have never learned how to work with difficult issues and emotions. We tend to push these things down inside of ourselves. Undigested thoughts, issues, emotions and the stresses of daily life create a residue that accumulates within the tissues and organs of our bodies. That creates a great deal of additional stress upon our body and mind. These stresses can arrest our process of development, disconnect us from the divine creative intelligence of the universe and shut down our intuition. It also causes our bodies break down at a more rapid pace and that accelerates the aging process.

Learn to use your body-mind's innate healing power to "digest and assimilate" your thoughts feelings, emotions, issues and life experiences. You will begin to release the stresses that are held within the body and to heal the painful emotions associated with anxiety, depression and emotionally traumatic experiences. You will also learn to go right to the source of the issues to bring about a resolution that allows you to really move forward in your life.
Working with these practices helps to increase your intellectual and emotional range, improve memory, initiate new cycles of growth, awaken inner passions, spark creativity and deepen intuition. You will develop the strength and resilience that will make it easier for you to adapt to the demands that life places upon you.
Discover the passion and power that resides within you
Chinese Martial Arts Masters emphasize the development of a base of power known as the "dan tien". The stress of living in such a fast paced world can cause us to disconnect from our foundation. Undigested food, emotions and the stresses of daily life begin to accumulate within the abdomen. We may experience bloating and suffer from various digestive problems. Some of us begin to lose touch with our drive, passion, inspiration and the sense of knowing that reveals our true purpose as our instinctual base shuts down.

You will learn to become fully present within your body, to develop greater personal power, and to awaken the inner passion and sense of knowing that will bring give you a greater sense of clarity about your life's purpose.

Activate the healing intelligence that resides within the body and mind
We all have a powerful healing intelligence that resides within our bodies and minds. This innate healing power helps to mend our bodies any time we suffer an illness or injury. Our innate healing powers are often compromised by the stress and toxins that accumulate within our bodies.
Learn to activate the generative healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Awaken the consciousness of the individual organs. Access and heal the emotions and core issues that are held within the body. These practices are very effective for healing digestive and respiratory disorders and a wide range of other health issues.


Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time and I have very limited access to the internet. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can awaken the healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

Please only YES RSVP if you are coming to the group

Sign up for my free monthly internet journal at http://www.doiohm.com...

results.description:
Dear Friends & Troublemakers!


Let's step into our greatest adventure and live in the fullness of who we truly are - together! Let's release that which no longer serves us and liberate our true and greatest selves - open, vulnerable, infinite, loving and free!! Let's lean into our edges and our vulnerability.  Face our fears and leap into the unknown of our greatest yet to be!!! Let's play in the field of Great Spirit!!

Join us in a powerful and joyous group healing process that will allow you to release internal barriers to happiness, love, empowerment, liberation, joy, success and abundance with ease, grace, fun and laughter! Permanent positive change, expansion and growth occur as layers of repressed pain, fear, limiting beliefs, unhealthy behavior patterns and trauma are released from the body, mind and emotions in a process that combines elements of traditional counseling with a sacred transmission of the divine healing energy of Spirit - to release in one session that which takes years to heal in traditional therapeutic modalities. This all happens in a fun, loving, safe, supportive and completely confidential community setting that we will be recreating every other Monday night.   

Our work with our teachers Don and Jen Hanson http://www.donhanson.com/ has catalyzed truly momentous growth and transformation in our lives, and we feel blessed and grateful to now be certified to share this truly miraculous and amazing, love and light-filled healing journey with all who are interested in being liberated from that which holds them back in order to be all that it is their sacred destiny to be. We are relatable, real world folks who have discovered something that has so transformed our lives, for which we are so grateful, that we want to pass this on to as many people as possible. In keeping with the great mystical traditions, TCM opens hearts and minds, teaches tools, and builds internal structure that allow each participant to cultivate and build their own relationship with Spirit and Sacred Energy, and far from creating any dependency on us or the process, liberates all to deepen and follow the calling of their own unique relationship to Spirit.  
With Love, Marc Anthony

Marc Anthony  is a Certified TCM facilitator who has been trained by Don and Jen Hanson for almost a decade. He has been facilitating TCM groups in New York, Florida and Connecticut. Early on Marc Anthony devoted his life to the journey of self discovery and personal growth. Working with the Spirit and Divine Intelligence of the Universe he helps unlock and transform old beliefs, behavior patterns and resistance to allow a deeper connection with the Divine.  

In his work Marc Anthony also brings various modalities such as Tantra, Sacred Sexuality, Psychodrama, Bodywork and Energy Healing.  He is also an IIN graduate and a successful businessman,investor,entrepreneur and owns a Contracting and Management Company. He is also a father to a beautiful son Nicholas. Marc Anthony lives in New York City and New Jersey and is available for private healing sessions with individuals and couples.

Monday night training tends to focus on techniques, and may include some light randori (free-fighting work). Please check the FAQ if you have any questions. If there isn't an answer there, shoot me an email, and I'll respond as soon as possible.

Class is free if it's your first time.  You can start training in sweats and a T-shirt or bring your own gi. We also ask that your fingernails and toenail be clipped short to avoid injury.  Please fill out this form (just name, address, contact information, and sign date it) and bring it with you.  Do not worry about paying the fee.  You'll do that if you continue training with us.  It's just that the form is also the liability waiver.

Dojo visitors from other training groups (Judo, BJJ, DZR) may pay the one time mat fee to train.

Approximate breakdown of class:
7:00: setup and change
7:15: Begin stretching and ukemi work
7:35: Begin technique work
8:45: Either randori/sparing or continue technique work
9:20: Conditioning
9:30: Class ends, put away mats, change.

results.description:
Particularly since the creation of the E3 Visa, Australians have been flooding the US with laid-back competence and refined coffee appreciation. How have Australian entrepreneurs been faring and what does the future look like? Why are we seeing a recent spate of ASX listings from non-Australian startups and what does it mean for their Aussie counterparts? Why are we all here in the first place and not Australia? Whither the innovation nation?

Angus McLeod will be hosting Eddie Geller of Tiny Beans and, Karl Redenbach of LiveTiles and other influential NY-based Australian founders and VCs for discussion, beers and nibbles at Knotel's beautiful new space at 116 W Houston St on May 9.

Our speakers:

Eddie Geller of Tinybeans.com


Eddie was founder and CEO of Unique World, a successful management consulting business that grew to a 100 person, $15m business before successfully exiting to a large US company in 2011. Eddie is actively involved in the startup community and was the founding investor/director of LayPay and a seed investor in PushStart in early 2012. Eddie is now co-founder and CEO of Tinybeans, which enables parents to create a digital journal/scrapbook of their children’s moments and milestones, and share it privately with their families all over the world. 

Karl Redenbach of LiveTiles.nyc

Originally a lawyer, Karl founded nSynergy with his business partner Peter Nguyen-Brown from his bedroom when he was in his early twenties. Since nSynergy was acquired by Rhipe late last year, Karl and Peter have been focused on LiveTiles, a platform that provides an array of services, functionality, and generally more user-friendly experiences, for enterprise customers using Microsoft. LiveTiles works with some of the world’s largest retail companies from its base in New York, recently listed on the ASX, has won a number of industry awards, and hosted former Prime Minister, Julia Gillard, earlier this year.

RSVP here.
results.name: A Fireside Chat with Australian Entrepreneurs Eddie Geller and Karl Redenbach

results.description:
Our May book is 1934: Lamb in His Bosom by Caroline Miller 

Caroline Miller was fascinated by the other Old South not the romantic inhabitants of Gone With the Wind, but rather the poor people of the south Georgia backwoods, who never owned a slave or planned to fight a war. The story of Cean and Lonzo, a young couple who begin their married lives two decades before the Civil War, Lamb in His Bosom is a fascinating account of social customs and material realities among settlers of the Georgia frontier. At the same time, Lamb in His Bosom transcends regional history as Miller's quietly lyrical prose style pays poignant tribute to a woman's life lived close to nature the nature outside her and the nature within.


Sadly there is not a digital edition of this book but please order up a copy and join in. 

As always, we'd love to have you join us, even if you haven't read the whole thing, if you've never come before, or you haven't been here in months. We don't care. We're not one of those clique-y groups. Come on by and pull up a chair.

Come join us on Monday, May 9th!

Happy reading, 
-Joe

P.S. #1: Oh, about the $1 fee: Meetup charges $15+/month to maintain a Meetup group, so this is just an attempt to defray that cost. 

P.S.#2: If you do need to cancel for some reason, please do so with as much advance notice as possible. We’ve now have more than 400 members and we may well have a waiting list for our events. By canceling as soon as you can, you enable others to participate as well, which is nice for all.

Cost: Members: $5 Non-Members: $15 Non-Member Student: $15

If enough people are interested, we'll go out to dinner at a nearby diner afterward.


Link to event: http://www.nyas.org/events/...<a></a>

Early discoveries in physics were driven primarily by observation, by searching for an explanation for what can be seen. In the 20th century, revolutionary advances in theoretical physics often anticipated—sometimes by decades—the experimental verifications of the existence of elementary particles of crucial importance to particle physics, such as the neutrino and Higgs boson. In recent years, the advent of sophisticated computer technology has allowed studies of complex systems, in which large collections of components interact in nonlinear ways, such as cell colonies, neurons in the brain, the immune system, economic markets, and social groups. In complex systems, simple, nonlinear interactions are iterated over time and give rise to self-organization, evolution, learning, and adaptation—phenomena that eluded explanation until now, or as the physicist Phil Anderson stated, "More is different." This panel, including computer scientist and entrepreneur Kevin Slavin and selected physicists and mathematicians will explore whether studies of complexity complement traditional physics or may upend science as we know it.

* Reception to follow.

Featuring:

Kevin Slavin, BFA

Assistant Professor, Media Arts and Sciences, MIT Media Lab

Lee Smollin, PhD

Founding and Senior Faculty Member, Perimeter Institute for Theoretical Physics

Moderator George Musser, PhD

Contributing Editor at Scientific American; author of Spooky Action at a Distance and The Complete Idiot's Guide to String Theory

Registration — Individual Lecture Prices:

Member $5
Member (Student / Postdoc / Resident / Fellow) $5
Nonmember $15
Nonmember (Student / Postdoc / Resident / Fellow) $7

results.description:
PLEASE READ:

Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7-7:05 - chat

7:05-7:30 - introductions (please be on time for intros)

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

See you there.
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
How can designers and students of design transform beautiful prototypes into functional web applications? How can web developers create better user interfaces? A prototype might look great, but not be technically possible or practical. A great technical idea might be difficult to execute visually. 

Join us for an animated discussion between graduate students at Parsons School of Design and Dev Bootcamp alumni. Parsons students will pitch their app ideas and share prototypes and Dev Bootcamp graduates will discuss how they would approach building the prototype into a fully functioning web application.

The event will explore how to bridge the gap between the two practices and provide tangible examples of problem solving with designers and developers. It will offer participants insight into the inner workings of web and mobile applications and provide an environment for collaborative discussion.
