results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

75min. This Soccer Workout will help to increase your leg power, core and upper body strength, overall agility as well as mental strength. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank 
M. [masked]

SoccerBeyond.com
[masked]


Feel free to like us on http://www.facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

results.description:
Northwell Health System innovation officials to speak May 9

Meeting of Nassau Inventors and Entrepreneurs Club 

Nassau County Executive Ed Mangano announced that three officials involved in innovation at the Manhasset-based Northwell Health System, formerly the North Shore-LIJ Health System, are to speak May 9 at a meeting of the Nassau County Inventors and Entrepreneurs Club. 


The three, who are to speak about Northwell’s innovation program, are:

· Tom Thornton, senior vice president and executive director of Northwell Ventures, a three-year-old unit that seeks ways to turn innovative ideas generated by the nonprofit health system’s 61,000 employees into marketable businesses

· Dr. David Langer, chairman of the Department of Neurosurgery at Northwell’s Lenox Hill Hospital and the creator of a multimedia mobile application that transforms patient engagement and clinician communications.

· Frederick Muench, PhD., a clinical psychologist who focuses on digital health research and who is director of Digital Health Interventions at Northwell.

Northwell Ventures, which works with doctors, scientists and staff throughout the health system to develop and advance ideas in clinical and non-clinical areas to both implement and market, has invested nearly $3 million in startup businesses, including a smartphone app and a drug trial company.

The meeting takes place on May 9, from 7-9 p.m., in the Ceremonial Chambers of the Theodore Roosevelt County Executive and Legislative Building. 1550 Franklin Ave., Mineola. Admission is free.

“We hope this presentation will inspire our residents to turn their ideas into viable business products,” said County Executive Mangano. ”Our talented residents are the County’s best resource for future economic growth.”

The Nassau County Industrial Development Agency and entrepreneur Brian Fried, of Melville, organized the club early in 2012 and since then its events have attracted more than 2,500 attendees. For more information call (<a>516)[masked]</a> or email: [masked]

 Learn more about Northwell’s program here: http://www.newsday.com/business/northwell-ventures-turns-employee-ideas-into-products-1.11564325

Our Monday, June 6th meeting will feature a presentation from Hain Celestial (international organic food company headquartered in Nassau County) and our annual INVENTORS SHOWCASE. We’ll be sending our more information on the Inventors Showcase in the near future.

Learn more about Hain Celestial here: http://www.hain-celestial.com/

Upcoming Agenda:

MONDAY, MAY 9  Northwell Health 
MONDAY, JUNE 6  Hain Celestial / Inventors Showcase

As always, if you have any thoughts or ideas, please don’t hesitate to contact us.

Best regards,

Nick & Brian
results.name: Northwell Health Innovation @ Nassau Inventors & Entrepreneurs Club Meeting

results.description:
About Enviromental Green Drinks Gatherings

Environmental Green Drinks is an informal monthly get-together for people interested in green living, sustainable business and building communities that are safe for living, biking, walking and growing food. We meet at places where the food is excellent and the prices are good.

Green Drinks are open, admission is free and new faces are always welcome, so come and join us some evening!

Acerca de las Reuniones Green Drinks

Green Drinks es un informal evento social para gente interesada en la sostenibilidad y el medio ambiente. Las reuniones facilitan el intercambio informal de ideas y estrategias "verdes" y colaboraciones comunitarias e individuales. Conversamos sobre alternativos fuentes de energía limpia, producción agrícola urbana, la comida natural y orgánica, comprar local, los empleos verdes. . . y la justicia ambiental. Nuestros encuentros están abiertos a la comunidad y todos encontrarán una calurosa bienvenida.

Os Eventos Green Drinks

Green Drinks é um evento social informal para dialogar sobre o estabelecimento duma sociedade sustentável, justa e no qual os comerciantes e indivíduos respeitam os recursos da terra e seus habitantes. A comunidade está muito bem vinda!

Food | Comida

Pay only for food and drinks you order..
Sólo se pagan la comida y bebidas que usted pide. 
Paga só à comida e bebidas que você solicite.

Admission & Parking | Entrada Estacionamento Parqueo

Admission free. Free on-site parking in restaurant lot.
Entrada grátis. Grátis estacionamiento en el parqueadero del local.
Entrada gratuita. Estacionamento gratuito no local.

results.description:
How signing up works: Please sign up on the waitlist. Spots will be assigned within 24 hours.

The Place: Upscale American tasting menus from chef Daniel Humm served in a high-ceilinged art deco space. This restaurant not only sports a three Michelin star rating, but is ranked #5 on The World’s 50 Best Restaurants list.

http://www.elevenmadisonpark.com/

*Please note the attire for gentlemen is formal (jacket required) and the equivalent for ladies. 

Pre-Payment: As the restaurant has my credit card I am requiring pre-payment of $325 (includes tax and tip) with Venmo. Once paid you are guaranteed your spot and no refunds will be given.

RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event.

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better, but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future.

Please note that meetup events are strictly for members. No +1s are allowed as reservations are made in advance and spots are assigned. First time members must confirm in writing that they will attend. Individuals that are no shows are immediately banned from the group. Thanks.
results.name: Eleven Madison Park - Three Michelin Stars

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $12 dollars per player per game; pay through Paypal.

One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates at the goal for 6 minutes, timed with an electronic scoreboard. NO breaks. Regulation size goals with nets. professional  futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes, games are competitive, but friendly. Sorry, no beginners. 

Zero tolerance to fouls . “Futsal is a technical game, not physical”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. 

Refunds: only for 24 hour cancelation. must send a meetup message with the paypal Transaction ID: 17 numbers. 

The Name of the school Beacon HS 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description: The purpose of this group is to establish a safe place where people can deal with the pain and isolation brought about by the ending of a significant relationship. We are not a singles group or a dating network. Instead, we are a family where it is safe to be ourselves. The goal of the meeting is to help members to develop into healthier, more complete, independent, loving men and women. We hope that by being together, listening to each other, and by sharing our experiences, strength and hope, we will learn to see the value of life in a new context. For the first hour of each meeting members share their experiences. The second half of the meeting is reserved for a guest speaker relating to either the legal or emotional aspects of separation/divorce. We meet every Monday eveing at the Church in the Highlands, 35 Bryant Ave. White Plains, New York. We are a mixed group of men and women. There are about 50 members, with approximately 20 attendees per meeting. There are no fees, new members are welcome, no reservation is necessary. We pass a basket at each meeting and suggest a five dollar donation per meeting to cover the cost of the meeting place and coffee/cookies served at the meeting.
results.name: Separation and Divorce Recovery Group Weekly Meetup

results.description:
Wake up to whole new relational spaces and touch into parts of yourself that bring a deep nourishment and inspiration. 

REGISTER: 

https://circling.eventbrite.com/

For experienced Circlers, the evening will begin promptly at 7:30 pm. 


On select evenings, Beginners are invited to join us at 6:30 pm. 

See the schedule below: 

May 2-  Experienced Circlers 


May 9 -  New Circlers 6:30,  Experienced Circlers 7:30 


May 16 - Experienced Circlers 


May 23 -  Community Circling Night  7:30-10:30 

Please be punctual and check-in prior to start time in order to support the flow of the evening. Late arrivers may need to wait until the second circle to join if the first circle has already begun.

Each Circling Lab will be facilitated by a trained Circling Facilitator. 

Participation is limited 


Registering guarantees your spot 

***NOTE: if you are new to Circling you must attend an intro session before participating in a Circling Lab. Intro sessions are offered one Monday each month from 6:30-7:15 and the last Monday of each month at our Community Circling Nights during the 7:30-10:30 pm event 

Upcoming dates are listed below! 

What’s it like to experience Circling? 


http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KmIhCf06Osg

What are the benefits of Circling? 

Circling is a fresh way to develop presence and richer connections with those around you. It can provide fundamental and often unseen insights that, once seen, create new and exciting opportunities. It provides a doorway into flow experiences and breathes life into sometimes vague spiritual concepts and ideas. 

Through Circling individuals can start to develop trust in a deeper intelligence in themselves and others. Part of what makes it special is that, although it is based on complex ideas, it is simple and empowering to take part in. We believe it to be one of the richest tools for human development in the world today because it works on so many levels. 

What is Circling? 

Circling is a practice where the attention of a small group is skillfully focused on an individual. This person gets to feel the impact of being supportively seen by others while also experiencing their honest in the moment feelings. The process revolves around connection, understanding and a deep authenticity between people. It involves bringing a greater awareness and appreciation into our connections with others and can be considered a relational meditation because of this. It is a paradigm-shifting practice that is supported by wide ranging research in how adults learn and develop. For more about information about Circling visit AuthenticWorld.com or www.circlingeurope.com

In order to secure a spot, you must pay in advance on Eventbrite. $20 per session or $55 for 3-sessions in one month $70 (does not include Community Night) for 4 sessions in one month  (does not include Community Night) 


https://circling.eventbrite.com/

Walk-in registrations may be accepted if seats are available. Walk-in registrations: $25


Questions about The Connection Movement, Circling and Authentic Relating NYC? 

Contact Amy at [masked] 

LOCATION: Reflections Center for Conscious Living 


227 E 24th Street (between 3rd and 2nd) 


NY, NY 10010 

May 2-  Experienced Circlers 


May 9 -  New Circlers 6:30,  Experienced Circlers 7:30 


May 16 - Experienced Circlers 


May 23 -  Community Circling Night  7:30-10:30
results.name: Circling Lab - Mondays

results.description:
Defying Death in Hagerstown, by John Paul Carinci (fiction, 300 pages).


NOTE:  John, the author, is a member of our book club and he will join us for this discussion.  He offers members the chance to purchase this book at a discounted price, with free shipping.  It'll arrive autographed!


To purchase the book at a discount, send a check for $11.00 to:  B.O.D. PRODUCTIONS, P.O. BOX[masked], S.I. N.Y. 10312-0332.  Be sure to include your name, address and phone number or email.  The check should be payable to B.O.D. Productions.

MY COPY ARRIVED TODAY (3/24)!

Louis Gerhani is a hard drinking, heartbroken, newspaper reporter for the Washington Gazette. He is disinterested in life after his fiance left him for a doctor, and his final assignment in order to retain his job is to write a full story on Lolita Croome, an 110 year old, philosophical woman, and the oldest living person in the country, who resides in a nursing home in Hagerstown Maryland. As he reluctantly begins the assignment, he uncovers a 90 year old unsolved triple murder of three young women, that Lolita lived through, and a full diary from Lolita from 1923, the year of the murders.

Consumed with solving the murders, turning out the story of a lifetime, and using the diary, Lou begins to wake a sleeping giant that someone is clearly trying to keep unsolved at all costs. Major violence erupts in this quiet town as Lou tries desperately to stay alive, finish the story, solve the murders, fall in love, and learn from a very wise, old woman.

results.description:
Why are some people so frightened by harmless snakes?

My ball python is friendlier than most cats I've met, but sometimes my house guests are very intimidated or disgusted by her.

Once we get past the fear of snakes humans may have evolved early on as a defense for getting poisoned, what do you think makes them scary in modern times?

Relevant: http://www.mandatory.com/2014/01/17/20-snakes-wearing-tiny-hats/
results.name: Discussion: What's so off-putting about snakes?

results.description:
Student Testimonial:

"Bodhi meditation has a focus on healing energy, you can experience this at each session. Much higher level of meditation in group than I can achieve doing my own practice. I was very happy to find a meditation group that was focused on bringing together community members to practice meditation. Bodhi meditation is unique because they offer free sessions to the community. Nan is a wonderful teacher, and very compassionate person. You can sense that she has extensive experience in oriental medicine including acupuncture, herbal medicine, and energy healing,. Thank you Nan. ” Joe, Bodhi Meditation class Wednesday October 29, 2014 


"It's like looking into the eyes of Pure Love. I've been around meditation, acupuncture, and "Spiritual Healers" for over 20 years. In that time I've worked with several healers. Not until I had privilege of meeting Nan Ni did I experience a true healer. Having a session with Nan Ni or "Nan" is like looking into the eyes of Pure Love - the kind of selfless Love that you hoped was "out there", but didn't really expect to find. Nan has a profound sense of commitment to her patients and students. Her caring, genuine smile comes from deep within and warms you the moment that you meet her. Nan's healing, insightful ways never cease to amaze me and fill me with gratitude. Nan can look at you and know what you need. How many times was I shocked when, without my uttering a word, did she know exactly was what troubling me. I wish I were eloquent enough to express my sincere appreciation for the gift of meeting and working with Nan. Nan's answer to that would be to greet each and every person I meet with an open and loving heart. It is my hope that if you are searching for a healer and/or a meditation practice and come across these words, that you will know that you've found what you've been searching for. Thank you, Lynn" Bodhi Meditation Class Saturday March 14, 2014 

“ Very strong healing energy tonight. I got there feeling very tired. I had stomach pain all day, and during the first meditation of the evening it got a lot better. By the end I wasn't thinking about it at all. I left full of energy. ” Pam, Bodhi Meditation class November 22, 2013

“ I didn't realize I would be reaping the benefits of Bodhi Med so quickly after attending only two classes. After my second class I felt even more relaxed. I have insomnia, but after the second session I fell asleep faster and deeper which has not happened for a long time. ” Dee, Bodhi Meditation class September 18, 2013

It was enlightening!!! Every time I practice Bodhi meditation, it feels like my Chi increases more and more! Thank you everyone for sharing this to NYC." Javoski (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) 

"Nan emits healing energy -- the meditation is wonderful" Linda (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) 

"Very calming and energizing. I did not have any negative thoughts or worries last night in bed like I always do. I felt my mind was clear. I will definitely go to another class" Dee (Bodhi Meditation class Friday September 13, 2013) 

"I Walked In With Lower Back Pain, Listened, Opened My Heart And Relaxed My Mind And Walked Out Feeling Better Than I Have In Almost Two Weeks. Thank You So Much. Looking Forward To Friday's " Ed (Bodhi Meditation class Tuesday July 30, 2013)

--------------------------------------------------------------------


Come and experience how this unique meditation can help you purify your body/mind and unleash the creative power within you.

* Increase self-awareness
* Stronger emotional intelligence
* Greater mental clarity, focus and inspiration.

Bodhi Meditation Energize your body Strenthen your mind Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

Students will experience two forms of Bodhi Meditation.

* Seated
* Movement

Your class instructor is Nan Ni Gilbert. Nan is a NYS licensed acupuncturist and Chinese herbalist. Nan is also one of the most advanced Bodhi Meditation energy healer in North America

I leave you with Master JinBodhi's Golden Words:

(Editor's note: The following phrases were suggested by Master JinBodhi and subsequently introduced to his students as a daily practice. Starting your day by loudly reciting these phrases three times, either all of them or a select few, will bring you energy and joy. Give it a try and experience how uplifted you feel...)

1.Self-Confidence

I am most compassionate.

I am most confident.

I am most tolerant.

I am most courageous.

I keep my word.

I am most punctual.

I can do anything.

2. The Power of Knowledge

I am full of wisdom.

I am most knowledgeable.

I love reading.

I love observing.

I love listening.

I love thinking.

I take decisive action.

3. Life Purpose

 I am a gift from the Universe.

I am most charming.

I am most talented.

I can sing most beautifully.

I like challenge.

I am responsible for my actions.

I will fulfill my life purpose.

4. Cause and Consequence

（not for reading loud）

What you give is what you receive.

Care for others, and you are taken care of.

Smile at others, and they will smile at you.

Treat others with sincerity, and sincerity will be given to you.

Make trouble for others, and trouble will find you.

Frequent generosity begets abundance.

Seek to give, not to be rewarded.

• Description :Let's meet and have a great time dancing in One of NYC's Top Dance Parties as featured in Timeout New York Magazine, celebrating their 6th year @ Taj Lounge!
Great dinner and dancing experience, live music, performers and guest DJ's. 

• RSVP: To enjoy the reduced admission , Mention the code that you will see in the comment section, it is different every week !!

• Price: $10 if you RSVP on the meet up. 

• Time:  8 pm- 2am ( Salsa Lesson at 7.00pm)


• Address: Taj Lounge, 48 W 21st St, New York

• What to wear: Dancing is about movement and enjoyment. We recommend wearing comfortable clothing that allows you to be flexible and relaxed. In order to be able to move comfortably across the floor, we advise that you do not wear rubber-soled shoes.

• Do I need a partner ?: No, you don’t need to bring a partner. We rotate during the group class, It will give you the opportunity to dance and meet different people.
results.name: Salsa dancing with Salsa New York @ Taj Lounge: Live Music + Performances

results.description:
If you're interested in getting on a stage in a low pressure environment to try some improv, this event is for you! I have reserved space at the basement stage of the Triple Crown Ale House. We will likely to do some warmups, 2-person scenes, and then do some short sets with other more veteran improvisers. Participate as much or as little as you would like. Or simply come and watch! 

All who attend will get to do 2-person scenes and a bigger jam set at the end!  This is the most low pressure fun performance opportunity out there - perfect for all!  If you're think you're ready, you're ready!  All scenes will be inspired by a suggestion of a random word from the audience.  


I've also invited improvisers from the NYC improv community to attend as well.  So you may get to play with some veteran improvisers as well.

----

Please, no outside food or water of any kind, including water bottles.  The Triple Crown offers food and drink discounts for those with this improv show.  They offer 10% off food, and $4 select draft beers.
results.how_to_find_us: Go downstairs to the basement at 8pm (go to the back of the bar and go down the stairs)

In this class you will learn how to dance like a natural and unlock your inner beauty! You will learn how to respond to the music in a way that allows you to express your emotions through movement. Other added benifits: Increase your muscle tone, stamina, coordination, posture. Releive stress and tension all while have fun and looking great!

All classes begin with a warm up consisting of the core movements, allowing you to develope your skills at your own pace. Wonderful friendly, accepting atmosphere, lots of encouragement and feedback! At Baladi Beat, you are never just another face in the crowd, but an individual!

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation and what we have to offer so you can have the sex life and relationships that you really want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at this event are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us
results.name: TurnON New York City!

group.name: Alternative to the Bar Fun Things To Do In NYC Today!

results.description:
This group meets on the second Monday of each month to discuss a specific mystery, suspense or intrigue novel. Join Moderator Aurelia Long as we discuss the month's featured selection. 


Cormoran Strike is barely scraping by as a private investigator. Strike is down to one client, and creditors are calling. He has also just broken up with his longtime girlfriend and is living in his office. Then John Bristow walks through his door with an amazing story: His sister, the legendary supermodel Lula Landry, known to her friends as the Cuckoo, famously fell to her death a few months earlier. The police ruled it a suicide, but John refuses to believe that. The case plunges Strike into the world of multimillionaire beauties, rock-star boyfriends, and desperate designers, and it introduces him to every variety of pleasure, enticement, seduction, and delusion known to man.
results.name: Suspense Central: The Cuckoo's Calling by Robert Galbraith

group.name: The Science Fiction Society of Northern New Jersey

results.description:
Monday Night Volleyball is intended to be for more advanced, fast paced volleyball geared toward players capable of defending against a hard spike, playing within a structured offensive and defensive system. Some nights we will set up a separate net for more advanced players. This will be up to the discretion of the organizers. 

No beginners, or lower skilled players please.

Please consider your safety and the safety of others when signing up. In faster systems, please realize that being out of position can result in injuries. 


A few rules :

1. Call violations on yourselves. There is no referee. 

2. A ball will be dead when entering the other court. This is for safety reasons. It doesn't matter whether the ball interferes with play or not.

results.description:
The Sifer uses live hip hop fusion music as a way to bring cultures closer together.  We encourage inner peace through self expression and encourage universal love for mankind though sharing our differences.

Our monthly jam is held at The Shrine World Music Venue. YOU'RE INVITED!

Upper Manhattan is an oasis of creativity and artistic expression...it's Nina Simone meets Nas, it's Flying Lotus meets Roy Ayers, it's Prince meets J Dilla. Inspired by the revitalization of the new Harlem Renaissance, NYC's Hip Hop & Spoken Word Jam Session, presents a fusion of audio art backed by our live hip hop jam band Likwuidity.


Founded by dj, songwriter and emcee Likwuid Stylez (Faybeo’n Mickens), The Sifer aspires to foster creativity by accompanying uptown writers, poets, singers and emcees for an impromptu jam session. This event is a SAFE SPACE, and an artist sanctuary for experimentation. Rather you're a virgin to the mic or a seasoned vet, we are all ears and all cheers to creation!   
Musicians are WELCOME!
Singers are WELCOME!
Emcees are WELCOME!
LGBT Artists are WELCOME
Poets & Spoken Word Artists are WELCOME!
Griots are WELCOME!
Actors, Dancers & Expressionist are WELCOME!
Producers are WELCOME!

YOU are welcome to join us!
results.how_to_find_us: Welcome back to NYC's Hip Hop & Spoken Word Jam...now THE SIFER!!!
results.name: Come Jam With Us!!!

results.description:
This is a meeting for people who have, or who have had at some point in the past, a good grasp of Latin grammar. If you had a few years of Latin in high school 20 years ago, chances are you'll be able to catch up without too much trouble. If you're just starting out, it might not be your cup of tea.

For next week, read lines 1-150 of Capitulum 40 of Lingua Latína II: Roma Æterna, and, if you like, reread Capitulum 2 of Familia Romana. Texts are downloadable at Lingua Latina per se Illustrata or for sale at Focus. Other resources are available at the website with videos and the flashcard website.

Macte virtúte!

• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, get a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change.

MOST RECENT UPDATE TO THIS INFORMATION:

The easiest way to get your old Gmail back is to click on the + sign located to the right of "Promotions" and unclick everything except for "Primary" and it'll bring your old gmail back without any tabs.

===========

Read These Very Important Instructions If You Use Gmail

& Learn How To Take Charge of The New Gmail In 3 Easy Steps!

If you use Google's Gmail you're probably aware that they have launched a new inbox with TABS that affect the delivery of your emails from our Meetup groups which you may need to read because they contain important announcements and messages.

To ensure that you continue to receive valuable messages in a timely manner from us, simply follow these easy steps: 


Step 1: Click open the "Social" tab in your Gmail account. 


Step 2: Select any message from Meetup.com and "DRAG" it over to the Primary Tab.

Step 3: After doing that you will see a message pop up asking if you want your emails from Meetup.com automatically delivered to your Primary tab in the future: Click: Yes

That's all you need to do! Now the messages you need to see as soon as possible will go safely into your primary inbox.

Remember to repeat this same step for the "Promotion" TAB in case your Meetup or other important emails are landing in there, as well.

======================================***

Even though the above is not a Meetup event, kindly, please take a moment to RSVP if you find that these instructions will be helpful to manage your new Gmail to let me know. Thanks! 

======================================***

-Zorka Kovacevich, Meetup Organizer

If you want to get into the conversation about what is the difference between "friends with benefits" and a service agreement, or  if you want to know how to set boundaries with romantic friends, this is the call for you.


Bring your questions!! Wendy will be taking them live.

Wendy will also be giving a special offer for her upcoming dating class, Dating By Design starting in August. The special offer announcements will not exceed 10 minutes of this call (total).

Q & A opportunity at the end of the call. 

I look forward to having you there!

FREE! Invite your girlfriends since it’s a phone party!

Registration is required and space is limited so Register Now!

About Wendy, the instructor: 

Hi, I'm Wendy Newman, author of 121 First Dates.  I'm committed to helping women find their own happily ever after – that man who loves you just as you are. 

I'm a workshop leader, and I've led over 100 workshops about men, sex, dating, online dating and partnership to thousands of women in the U.S. and Canada.

Over the past 10 years, I've interviewed thousands of men on sex, dating, relationships, and women. Add to that extensive research, input from outside sources, and good old-fashioned trial and error, and I'd say it makes me someone who has something to say about men, women and dating. 

Also, I'm a percipient and compassionate fellow dater who navigated my way through 120 first dates before I retired my dating scarf for lucky first date #121. We live (in the Twitter-Loin) in San Francisco, California.

Register Now! - telephone lines are limited.

results.description:
Join in on NYSR Summer Distance Reiki Shares!

Boost your work week! RSVP to participate in the NYSR Distance Reiki Shares! With “Right Mind and Intention”, Distance Reiki sessions are as effective as sessions conducted in person.


These Summer Reiki Shares are a group effort of Practitioners who collaborate for the benefit of healing, supporting our personal lives, and enhancing the development of Reiki Skills, including sensitivity to giving and receiving Reiki.

AND YOU CAN DO THIS FROM HOME!

Mondays at 10PM for 45 minutes, we practice Distance Reiki among all participants that RSVP. Angela and I prepare “space” 15 minutes prior to start time and your participation will involve the following:

1. Sit or Lay comfortably and quietly.

2. *Set your intent to heal yourself and others participating to receive
whatever is needed for healing to take place.

3. Hold the space for energy to flow, remembering your own
connection to “Oneness” which supports the flow of energy
between the practitioner and recipient.

4. Once your ready and  receptive to receive, set your intent to begin sharing Reiki.

*Participant names will be forwarded via email or text if you prefer. Please use firstname and lastname initial (i.e.Michelle D.) or your Meetup ID Name.when you RSVP. Guest welcome and must RSVP individually; also required to submit (min) $10 donation via PayPal.

There is no “cancellation of energy”. Each individual receives as much Reiki needed at the present time to assist with the unique situations of his/her own life.

results.description:
Mt. Beacon Fire ~Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE.     A fast pace all the way to the tower so we make the sunrise and can get to work after.  Not good for a first time hiker . 

4 miles 

Hiking Poles are helpful


Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.  From there we continue to the Firetower.  


Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.
On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).

We leave right at 5:15 AM.  Don't be late we will not wait.

+++

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER  & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike
results.name: Mt. Beacon ~ Fire Tower Hike ~ SUNRISE ~

results.description:
Do you own your own business? Are you starting a new business? Are you a very seasoned business professional? Do you want to get MOVING on your 2016 Biz-Goals right now?!


No matter what the answer to any of those questions, we have the meeting for you: New Frontier-26 (Manhattan BNI Chapter 26). We are a group of 37 (and growing!) NYC-based top-notch business-owners and business-development professionals who are all committed to helping grow each others' businesses. We launched less than 7 months ago and will be 80 members by August 1st! That's a promise.


Our Motto: Givers Gain.


The more we give to each other, the more the large group gives back to us! We allow one person per professional-classification (e.g. Social-Media expert, SEO, Graphic Designer, Photographer, and tons more) to actually JOIN our group.....but EVERYONE is invited to visit!


You will get the opportunity to stand and give a short under 1-minute commercial that gives the entire group of members and visitors a simple example of what they should be listening for.  And who they know! We typically have about 10 visitors per meeting, so that's an audience of 45-55 people you're talking to before 9am!


Visitors to our meeting typically walk away with any or all of the following:

• Leads/Referrals on possible new deals

• Contacts in professions they didn't know before but needed, and best of all....

• A full stomach! (Our meetings have delicious hot-eggs, bacon, fruit, bagels, yogurt.....and coffee. Lots and lots of coffee!)


We meet every Tuesday morning (except holidays) from 7am - 8:45am here: Docks Oyster Bar
40th and 3rd Ave
(633 Third Ave)
Manhattan New York, NY 10017


Cost: $20 per Visit (cash or credit-card)


When the structured part of the meeting ends at 8:40, there'll be plenty of time to talk to anyone in an "open-networking" ennvironment afterwards!

If you have business-cards, you can pass them around. We recommend bringing a stack of at least 40! But if you don't have business-cards yet....don't worry! The people who you want to talk with and who want to talk with you....you'll get all the opportunity you need.

That's all! If you're ready to get more accomplished on a Tuesday morning than you ever have before, come visit New Frontier-26, the ultimate Manhattan networking group.

(Note: your office or territory does not need to be in Manhattan to attend....ALL professionals)

results.description:
LeTip of Hoboken

Are you looking for a way to successfully market your business? Want better, higher quality business leads? Then you have come to the right group. Survey after survey indicates that referral networking is the most cost-effective part of the marketing mix. By joining a LeTip chapter, savvy entrepreneurs are able to consistently prospect and be visible. LeTip of Hoboken has members that not only need and will use your business services, they also know others in need of your services. Each LeTip member acts as an extension to your sales and marketing team.

The LeTip Creed

LeTip is a professional networking organization of men and women dedicated to the highest standards of competence and service. Our purpose is the exchange of business tips. Members will, at all times, maintain the highest professional integrity. Each business category is represented by one member and conflicts of interest are disallowed.


A typical meeting has the following components to help you build your business: 

• You introduce your company at every meeting

• Your chapter passes qualified business Tips (Leads) throughout the meeting

• You Showboat your product two or more times a year, giving you ample opportunity to train your newfound sales force

• You have access to the expertise of other LeTip members, ongoing training and mentoring 

• Your chapter has the potential to provide a wide reach into the business community

• You become the speaker several times a year, putting the spotlight clearly on your business.


The following categories are no longer open:

Mortgage Banker
Realtor
Business Banker
Title Insurance
Real Estate Attorney
Life and Health Insurance
Accountant
results.name: LeTip of Hoboken Weekly Meetup

results.description:
We are an independent referrals group dedicated to the business growth of each of our members.  We welcome one member per business category in our membership.    Our 15 members are friendly and focused on supporting one another.  We'd like to grow to 20-25 members - will you join us?

This Meetup group helps us reach business professionals like you.  We welcome guests to visit us in order to network, get to know us, and decide if there's a membership 'fit'.

As an independent group, our dues stay with us and we use them to invest in our weekly meetings with a hot breakfast - as well as public networking events and member-only professional development programs.

Our 'rules' are relaxed compared to other referral groups.  For example, we don't require a sub if you can't make a meeting and our attendance policy allows for an occasional absence.  Instead of fines, we reward our members when they bring in guests.


We don't have a 'requirement' to bring in a referral every single week because we only want qualified introductions - and we know that a connection for another member may not show itself every single week.

We meet weekly to generate solid business referrals for each other. Join us and we’ll talk up your business, too. Partners in Business members have one focus . . . to exchange qualified business referrals.

We cater to the early morning professional, meeting on Tuesdays from 7:00-8:30am.  RSVP and be our GUEST at the next scheduled meeting. For further details, please see our website at Partners in Business.

results.description:
Come join us for an invigorating breakfast and networking event.

There will be at least 15 members at each meeting, regardless of how many people RSVP on Meetup.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

 Last year alone, Business Network Int'l generated over 7.1 million referrals resulting in more than $3.3 billion worth of business for its members!

In Manhattan, BNI currently has more than 1250 members in 53 Chapters. 

BRING LOTS OF BUSINESS CARDS!!!

results.description:
Come join us for an invigorating breakfast and networking event.

There will be at least 15 members at each meeting, regardless of how many people RSVP on Meetup.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

 Last year alone, Business Network Int'l generated over 7.1 million referrals resulting in more than $3.3 billion worth of business for its members!

In Manhattan, BNI currently has more than 1250 members in 53 Chapters. 

BRING LOTS OF BUSINESS CARDS!!!
Cost is $20, which includes breakfast.

Dear NY Live Streamers:

Please join us for our next event at One Spirit Learning Alliance Tuesday Evening at 247 West 36th Street, 6th Floor, following the all day Streaming Media Expo and Conference (at the NY Hilton Midtown on 54th and 6th Avenue).   The conference is various prices, depending on the package you get. Here is the link for the schedule and to register: 

http://www.streamingmedia.com/Conferences/East2016/Exhibition.aspx

Register here!

http://www.streamingmedia.com/Conferences/East2016/Register.aspx


We will be meeting that evening at 6:30 PM for a special guest speaker.  This is a private event, not affiliated with the conference.


Bonnie Bruderer - Host of Ask Bon Bon TV Show

We will plan to meetup up after the conference with a very special guest speaker - Live Streaming Video Expert Bonnie Bruderer!  Here are the details:

The Ask Bon Bon Show has more than 4.3 million viewers every week.


So, who is BonBon, you may be wondering? I know I would be.

Bonnie Bruderer is the host and executive producer of theASKBONBON Show. 

She spent 20 years of her career with celebrity motivational giants  Tony Robbins, Harvey Mackay, Alex Mandossian and many others. 

She worked as a coach, in production, sales and marketing, event management, and as a speaker. She saw the inner workings of what made these world-class experts successful and emulated all of the knowledge to create her media empire. 

She is an award winning and highly acclaimed talk show host, a life and executive coach, holding 10 certifications, including Columbia University. 

She’s an inventor of two patented products, a loving dog-mom, a voracious reader and writer, a kick boxer, yogi, meditation junkie and has appeared and starred in three movies and three sitcoms. 

She is also a three-time author, previous radio show host and loves to laugh and spend time with her family.

Please join us and let’s make sure you finally get to enjoy all the love you truly deserve!

This is an open co-working day for you to bring your own JavaScript project and hang out.

Bring: 

Your JS project and your own computer setup. Don't forget your power supply!

Who should attend:

If you're a JavaScript Engineer and you work from home or have the option to work remote, come join us for a change of scenery and good company. We'll hang out. 

Agenda:

11:00 AM to 1:00 PM - We'll be there, drop in anytime.

2:00ish PM to 5:00 PM - We'll be back from lunch for the rest of the day. 

Show up anytime, just let us know when to expect you. 

Please note that this is an open co-working space, so there may be some noise from other people.

In partnership with Barclays, we listen, nurture, and oxygenate through our international network of Rise hubs. From the Waldorf Astoria to AMC Theaters to Smithfield Foods, Chinese companies have in recent years been active investors in U.S. companies and U.S. real estate. More recent efforts to acquire GE’s appliances unit and Legendary Entertainment indicate that this trend shows no signs of slowing down. Are there emerging patterns to China’s investments in the U.S.? In particular, what does the future hold for Chinese companies looking to invest in the New York metropolitan area? Please join us in welcoming Daniel Rosen of the Rhodium Group, one of the leading authorities on Chinese Investment patterns in the United States. Mr. Rosen is a Founding Partner at the Rhodium Group and leads the firm’s work on China and the world economy. This program is a must attend for anyone looking to connect with the inflow of Chinese investments into this region.

results.description:
I give a 'free', forever ongoing, astronomy class at the Senior Center.  You don't have to be a senior to join, but you must join the Senior Center for $72/year, which you can defer for at least a month, until you determine that you want to continue.

I never give the same lecture twice.  It would bore me.  My lectures are well prepared, and contain enormous resources from the live web, projected from my laptop to a flat screen TV.  It's all about gaining a perspective of your/my place in the universe.

==================

The class meets Tuesdays at 12:45pm.  Just come.  241 W 72st.  Ask for Laird.  (As of August, 2014, as well as for the last 5 years.)

To make sure the class isn't cancelled (it normally meets every week of the year), please email me at laird wh (one word) at aol dot com.  Make sure the word MEETUP does NOT appear anywhere in the email.  (It gets sorted away from my inbox.)
results.why: Astronomy is about EVERYTHING.  Or at least thats why I became interested in it in 2nd grade.  Now, 40 years post Ph.D. in Astronomy, Astronomy, and indeed all of science is still my passion.   My advisor was Carl Sagan.
results.how_to_find_us: Email me at laird wh (one word) at aol dot com.  Make sure the word MEETUP does NOT appear anywhere in your email.
results.name: Weekly Astronomy Class - (free the first month you attend).

group.name: NYC - No God? - Know Astronomy Instead!

results.description:
We will do cold readings of plays in progress and short pieces from 1 to 2pm and then from 2 to 3pm -- if you are an actor pressed for time that day, please let me know if 1pm or 2pm works better for you, and I will try to accommodate your needs! I want you to be able to participate with ease. 

At 3pm, we write til 4pm with a prompt. If you are only coming to write, please come by 3pm so we can start on time without interruptions. If you have paid in advance for the workshop, and you can't attend a writing session, the prompt will be sent to your email, so make sure I have your email. If you have a piece to be read, please try to send it to me via email in advance with a character breakdown to help me with casting. 

You are also free to cast your own piece -- you may not cast yourself in your piece. Give yourself the chance to honor your writing by listening to it as a writer. You may know exactly how you want it done, but that doesn't necessarily help you as a writer. Trust me on this, or ask me about it -- I am happy to discuss it with you. You can also bring in a piece and ask to have it read, and we'll read it cold. 

Please check your piece for time! Each writer gets up to ten minutes of material. This usually means ten pages if you write in accepted format with 12 point Courier font and your pages are not full of monologues. Monologues read longer than a minute a page. So time your work. 

Write Now Workshop is free for actors, but writers pay a fee that I am trying to reduce by 1) opening the workshop up to the community for free as a model for creating community and involvement and offering content to seniors who live nearby and 2) using a space that doesn't cost me a fortune (most of the fees are space fees) and 3) applying for funding as we grow and documenting the way the concept works and 4) having the workshop subsidized by patrons of the arts (already happening so that I can offer it at the current rate). 

The writers fees are currently $35 per session or $30 in advance for 9 workshops at $270 payable by cash or check or paypal to [masked]


Thank you!
Emma
results.name: Read Plays, Respond, and Write!

results.description:
sha Kriya Guided Meditation-

A lot of people find it really difficult to calm the mind and settle the body for meditation when they first try it. Too many people get frustrated and give up on meditation before they can experience its many benefits.

https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/YFnyOdpfrlyNYtcYZZFlWc2mIaF0_rU2gifr2FX8j82LkX4kklllADwXC-0jXrU1I9LYipIwAA56XAuTgbGYnbc4lglEEyO9u5FL-473EHVHBw1ZmkvB_oIwMyLmN3dS0PJdM44t

These 1-hour guided sessions offer a simple, but powerful kriya practice that aligns your mind, body, and inner-energies to easily and naturally become meditative. Once meditative, your experience of the life within you and the world around you becomes much deeper and richer. Daily activity becomes effortless and joyful.

You can easily learn this 12-to-18 minute Isha Kriya process in one session and practice on your own, or return to class to ask questions and deepen the experience with the group. Benefits of regular practice include improving health, energy and vitality; enhancing mental focus, memory and clarity; reducing stress and establishing a deep sense of peace and inner balance.

Isha Kriya is a gentle, seated practice, which can be practiced in a chair. No previous meditation experience is necessary.

The Isha Kriya process was developed by realized yogi, Sadhguru Vasudev. Sadhguru is renowned for his powerful yoga and meditation programs, as well as thriving humanitarian initiatives. He has been hosted to speak and offer meditations at numerous global leadership forums, businesses and universities, including the United Nations, the World Economic Forum, the British House of Lords, TED, MIT, and the World Peace Congress.

This free session will be facilitated by a trained Isha Kriya instructor.

For more on Sadhguru and Isha, visit IshaUSA.org/blog
results.how_to_find_us: New York University Room 433, 5 metro Tech Library
results.name: Isha kriya Meditation

results.description:
Updated March 7th, 2016

Given the warmth that has descended upon NYC, I am making Tuesdays/Thursdays active again, but at 5pm.

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside and Booker T Washington as backups.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 5pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

BOOKER T. WASHINGTON DETAILS

This location is between 107th & 108th Streets just West of Columbus Avenue. It's on the backside of the high school. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. 

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

results.description:
Greetings, 


One of the topics that deserves special attention and the one that we may want to look at closely during our next meet-up is management and coordination that is required in LeSS. 


When it comes to basic Scrum the role of management (specifically, line management) is not discussed explicitly. The reason why it is not discussed explicitly, is because Scrum is a framework that relies on self-organization and self-management, coming from within. As such, the role of Project Manager is not mandated to support internal dynamics of a single scrum team. But it does not mean that coordination and management, as a discipline are no longer required.  They are just handled differently.


Large Scale Scrum (LeSS) framework is still Scrum.  It is scrum done by multiple teams, as they work on the same product (as oppose to multiple teams performing independent scrum activities).  The same guidelines apply to LeSS, as to basic scrum.  Of course, additional coordination between multiple teams might be needed.  With LeSS Huge framework, even more coordination might be required.  However, the role of Project Manager is still not mentioned explicitly.


So, what kind of management and coordination is needed in basic Scrum? Who is doing what?  How does this change with LeSS? How about LeSS Huge?  Does management have any role?


This topic is explicitly addressed in every LeSS training.  So far, starting last fall, we had three comprehensive LeSS traninings in NYC and all three times the topic of management in LeSS was discussed in-depth, accompanied by practical exercises and games.  There were also a number of questions raised on the same topic at the past few LeSS meetups that we had.


Therefore, I would like you all to join us at the next meetup to discuss the topic of coordination and management in Scrum.  Lets compare and contrast Scrum, LeSS and LeSS Huge.


All the best,

gene

N.B. You may also do a favor to your friends that are in project management profession and wonder how agility at scale and management relate to one another.
results.name: Coordination and Management in Large Scale Scrum

venue.name: Gordon International and LaCOUR Inc., New York Design Center, Suite 1401 and 1412

results.description:
This event is currently at its maximum and is closed to new players.

From humble beginnings, a handful of lost souls must rise above their misfortune to achieve greatness.

The uncountable islands of the subtropical Korina Archipelago are the sanctuary for many who have fled from the never-ending wars of distant Altamere. That land, where the life of the common man is cheap and reckless kings all-too-often burn their lives, and kingdoms, out in blazes of glory.

The Korina Archipelago is home to several large city-states, each of which views the others as rivals, but generally coexist, for there are greater threats to their safety. Renegade Altameran privateers, depraved nation-less pirates, demon-worshiping cannibals, horrors from the uncharted oceans, and far worse are reminders for the city-states of the constant dangers that exist outside their walls. 

These dangers are all-too-real, and to whom can one turn to in times of desperation and need when threats arise? Each city-state will defend its own, but outside that, help is not easy to come by. Even the enlightened gods favor all, yet they favor none; those whose prayers and sacrifices are the most persuasive bend their ears for a time. The gods are powerful and wise, but fickle they are, too, and to understand their ways is not the way of man.

This is no place for the weak of heart. Salvation comes from strength and strength alone. The strong survive, the weak do not. This is the tale of the rising of heroes, the elevation of men from what they were to what they are, the making of the great from the small, this is the story of ascension.
results.name: Ascension: The Isle of Dread

results.description:
Hi, all. Welcome to the  NYC Guitar Lovers Open Mic.  

Please take a minute to read what's below. 

 NYC Guitar Lovers Open Mic things works like this:

• Sign up for a playing spot on the sign-in sheet as usual

• 5 bucks goes into the group bowl. Give Mary $15. Hold on -- let us finish, please.

• You get 2 tickets from Mary worth $15 in total that you give to Mary to cover a couple of drinks, a burger, whatever. This is at least what each of us normally spends.

• The 5 bucks goes to the Group to pay MeetUp dues, and gives us a small reserve fund to replace cables and such.

• This way, Mary receives a modest guarantee in terms of business. We get great sound, a great vibe and a very clean, comfortable place to hang and play. Also, Mary does not have to confront anyone for taking advantage of her hospitality. And the best part -- we get to keep Mary O's as our musical home.

This has become necessary because some members have abused Mary's hospitality. Like sitting there for 3 hours and ordering one cup of tea or one soda, using the wifi , and the bathroom and nothing else. 

Mary does not charge us to meet there. We must repay her hospitality by supporting her business. If not we'll be looking for a new musical home. And having been through this search several times before, that will suck big time. Thanks for your support. It's really important  to keep the group going. And to keep it at Mary O's.

Charlie and Bdway Steve
results.name: NYC Guitar Lovers Open Mic

results.description:
Organizers:
AIANY Committee on the Environment, Urban Green Council, New York Passive House (NYPH), and BEEx.

Event Description: 

In 2007, Brussels set out to build "Exemplary Buildings" that were very low-energy, economical, and beautiful. The following eight years witnessed the market transformation as the number of Exemplary Buildings grew. The Passive House standard went from being a novelty, to a building code mandate in 2015. Essential to this revolution were the efforts of architect Sebastian Moreno-Vacca and his firm A2M. His projects have proven that Passive House can be beautiful and need not cost more than other buildings. The talents and influence of A2M are not limited to Brussels. Among other Passive House projects, the company is working on the Belgian Embassy in Kinshasa Congo and New Yorkers will be able to experience an A2M Passive House directly with a new retrofit project, a design center in New York City’s Meatpacking District. 

- Click Here to Register - 

In New York City, Mayor Bill de Blasio’s policy to reduce city-wide carbon emissions 80% by 2050 in his plan One City: Built to Last, has set the course for effective climate change mitigation and resilient adaptation. Passive House is the only building efficiency standard mentioned in the plan and the one standard that reliably and affordably delivers deep cuts in energy use proportionate to the climate challenge. Passive House construction also provides increased comfort, indoor health, and climate resilience – including net-zero and energy-positive buildings.

Speaker: Sebastian Moreno-Vacca, Principal, A2M Architects

- Click Here to Register -
results.name: Beauty at Low Cost & the Passive House Movement (AIA COTE Event)

results.description:
Moderator: 
David Hessekiel, Founder & President, Cause Marketing Forum 

Panelists:

Chris Noble, CEO Matchfire Co. & Causemedia Group 
Samra Brouk, Director, Business Development, DoSomething.org 
Lane Jost, Senior Manager, Corporate Responsibility, PwC 
Elise Waugh, PR Manager, UncommonGoods


What comes to mind when you hear that a company has launched a cause marketing campaign?  Does it exploit or expand capacity for nonprofits? Are consumers accepting of these cause marketing messages or are they cynical about the campaign goals and company intentions?  Is this greenwashing or the beginning of a genuine expression of a company's ethos? 

Total CSR spend was estimated at $20 billion in 2013 across Fortune 500 companies. As millennials gain influence, both as consumers, talent, and corporate decisions makers, there is an expanded sense of urgency to build, and be recognized, as a socially conscious brand. And as impact investing becomes more mainstream that need becomes even more pronounced. 

In this panel, we’ll examine the role of cause marketing and its place in the corporate social responsibility ecosystem. We’ll also look towards the future, as triple bottom line goals are further integrated into traditional, above-the-line business strategy. And we’ll attempt to predict what happens to a sector that seems to drift between marketing and social outcome goals when those objectives are forced to merge.

Join us for what is sure to be an interesting conversation.

RSVP AT NYC CSR MEETUP

COST IS $10 - PAY AT NYC CSR MEETUP

Refreshments (read: beer and wine) and snacks will be offered
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor
results.name: Partner Event: The Future of Cause Marketing in a Shared Value World

results.description:
Moderator:
David Hessekiel, Founder & President, Cause Marketing Forum


Panelists:
Chris Noble, CEO Matchfire Co. & Causemedia Group
Samra Brouk, Director, Business Development, DoSomething.org
Lane Jost, Senior Manager, Corporate Responsibility, PwC 
Elise Waugh, PR Manager, UncommonGoods


What comes to mind when you hear that a company has launched a cause marketing campaign?  Does it exploit or expand capacity for nonprofits? Are consumers accepting of these cause marketing messages or are they cynical about the campaign goals and company intentions?  Is this greenwashing or the beginning of a genuine expression of a company's ethos?


Total CSR spend was estimated at $20 billion in 2013 across Fortune 500 companies. As millennials gain influence, both as consumers, talent, and corporate decisions makers, there is an expanded sense of urgency to build, and be recognized, as a socially conscious brand. And as impact investing becomes more mainstream that need becomes even more pronounced. 

In this panel, we’ll examine the role of cause marketing and its place in the corporate social responsibility ecosystem. We’ll also look towards the future, as triple bottom line goals are further integrated into traditional, above-the-line business strategy. And we’ll attempt to predict what happens to a sector that seems to drift between marketing and social outcome goals when those objectives are forced to merge.

Join us for what is sure to be an interesting conversation. Refreshments (read: beer and wine) and snacks will be offered

Speaker Bios:

David Hessekiel (Moderator)

Fifteen years of working at the intersection of commerce and cause has strengthened David Hessekiel’s conviction that companies can do well by doing good. 

The co-author of Good Works! , Hessekiel owns and leads Cause Marketing Forum, Inc., a firm that educates, inspires and brings together professionals pursuing both purpose and profits.  CMFI has two divisions: Cause Marketing Forum and the Peer-to-Peer Professional Forum. Hessekiel’s insights into these two growing fields have made him a sought-after speaker in the US and overseas and a frequently quoted source by such publications as The New York Times, USA Today, The Wall Street Journal, The Chronicle of Philanthropy and Advertising Age. 

Chris Noble

Chris Noble is the CEO of Matchfire.Co.  Matchfire Co. is a data company with a purpose: to bring greater transparency and value to the exchange of data between consumers and brands. In addition, Chris leads the Causemedia Group, a collection of three companies working to better connect brands and nonprofits by helping them raise awareness and funds for their mutual benefit. Kompolt is a leader in online charity auctions, Studiogood develops and manages social media campaigns and WhatGives is a blog that sits at the intersection of celebrities, causes and brands.

Samra Brouk

As DoSomething.org’s Business Development Director, Samra Brouk manages corporate partnerships at DoSomething.org, the global not-for-profit that empowers Gen Z and Millennials to take action around causes they are passionate about. With 5MM active members worldwide, DoSomething.org is the largest member organization for young people and social change.  While at DoSomething.org, Samra has managed initiatives with both agencies and corporate brands and manages partnerships with 3M, Johnson & Johnson, ESPN, JetBlue, and other top youth brands.

Elise Waugh

Elise is a communications professional passionate about conservation and sustainability – so much so that she’s inadvertently built a career around CSR and cause marketing. She currently works for e-commerce site UncommonGoods in Brooklyn where she built the PR team from the ground up over the past year. There, she’s successfully managed a media relations strategy in a start-up atmosphere, sharing the company’s story of sustainability and social responsibility with publications like The Guardian, NPR, and The TODAY Show. She also champions UncommonGoods’ sustainability initiatives and runs their sustainability steering committee. Prior to UncommonGoods, Elise consulted on cause marketing and media relations in Edelman’s Business + Social Purpose practice.

Lane Jost

Lane is a Senior Manager of Corporate Responsibility on the PwC CR team where in addition to collaborating with his colleagues to optimize the team’s use of data, he is the operations leader of the PwC Charitable Foundation.
results.name: The Future of Cause Marketing in a Shared Value World

results.description:
Please go here to purchase a ticket https://www.eventbrite.com/e/workshop-on-tools-to-build-your-career-through-new-media-channels-tickets-25241760786

Let's face it, the idea of "no need to reinvent the wheel" is not 100% applicable in the age of media. "Embracing" and following a career path on what once worked as a good publicity tool in the age where magazines, newspaper, and TV dominated the media doesn't necessarily work in today's age dominated by the internet, mobile phones, and social media.

At this event we will address adapting to new media platforms and algorithms. While also proving that viral content is not the same as quality content.

Syllabus:

Our presenter will be Paul Rothbein who films 360 content, is part of Summit.Live, and has published Facebook video and photo content that has accumulated to almost 50,000,000 views in only a period of a few months.

Video-

This will be a hands on instruction about to learn about new tools people can use to create content that "wows!" people by utilizing live streaming and virtual reality.

- How to use new content like 360 video, VR, and live streaming where it is more than just a gimmick and why gimmicky content might "wow!" a visitor but not stick.

- How to create online short videos that are engaging and take less than 15 minutes to make and only require a smartphone.

Photos-

- Understanding which Facebook and Instagram photos are the types that not only generate page views but also encourage comments and discussion, and how to create memes that encourage engagement.
results.name: Workshop on Tools to Build Your Career Through New Media Channels

results.description:
Forget "Where the Boys Are" - join AWC NNJ to meet Cathy Coloff and hear the story of her professional life that has given her the opportunity to stand out as a woman in a traditionally man’s technology world. AWC NNJ invites you May 10th to the IT Radix Facility in Whippany for an exciting presentation and interview with Cathy Coloff, Founder of IT Radix, LLC. Cathy has 25+ years of experience in network systems with particular emphasis on local area networking and business applications. With extensive corporate experience at Exxon and Bear Stearns, Cathy works with IT Radix customers to develop their IT best practices without the big corporate price.

Cathy founded IT Radix, LLC, in the fall of 2008, realizing the growing need for small-to-medium sized businesses to stay abreast of ever changing technology. Cathy is the trusted IT advisor to many growing businesses in northern New Jersey, bringing commitment, relationships and even some fun to what some may view as a serious industry. "IT can be a dry topic for many, but I think it's exciting to see how the latest and greatest technology can help a business to prosper and exceed their expectations."

Cathy has worked in the IT industry for 20+ years, working at Exxon, Bear Stearns, IBS Interactive and Veraciti. Cathy has an M.S. in Management of Technology from Stevens Institute of Technology as well as a B.S. in Electrical Engineering from Duke University. While Cathy doesn't remember much about electrical engineering, she does remember how to solve problems and look at things from different perspectives. Most importantly—never stop learning!

You can find more about IT Radix on their web site, http://www.itradix.com

Join us for a fun night of networking and discussion!

results.description:
Donation Based Yoga with Jules in benefit of #ColtonsCure.

"Colton was diagnosed with stage III esophageal cancer 3 days after his 23rd birthday in December of 2014. After a cycle of chemo + radiation, a major surgery, and post-op chemo, the cancer has recurred as stage IV. We're not done fighting because there are new opportunities and new drugs available to fight this. God has a plan for our life, and we plan to see it through, despite circumstance, with His help. Follow along on the blog@cure.coltonwilliams.com"

He is a very close friend, and it has been challenging getting treatment in NY vs KY, where he is from (also, where me and my boyfriend are from). Besides the increase in cost of living, hospital bills, etc. he has to take cabs everywhere because he was in a wheelchair for a while and now is on crutches for the cancer that spread to his leg. So, donations are everything! 


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You don't need a mat!


Start Up Yoga is a pop-up yoga experience, providing mobile yoga sessions throughout New York City. We invite you to breathe, meditate and flow with us. Our novice to advanced classes can be conveniently found in spaces in your neighborhood including parks, office spaces, rooftops and art galleries.


60 Minute Revitalize


Carve out the time to unite your breath to your body. Synergize through dynamic movements and conscious breathing. This experience is enhanced with aromatherapy oils and hands on assistance to support postural alignment.
results.name: StartUp Yoga - Sweat, Heal, and Meditate! Flow With Jules!
