results.description:
Curious about learning to code and giving your career a boost this spring? Join us for refreshments and a glimpse into our 19-week bootcamp program that transforms beginners into full-stack web developers! 

Thinking about switching careers and becoming a software developer? Dev Bootcamp is the original, short-term, immersive software development program that transforms those new to coding into job-ready, full-stack web developers. Our monthly open house gives you the inside scoop from Dev Bootcamp students, instructors, and alumni.  

Hear from members of our community about why they chose Dev Bootcamp, what they learned, and what they do after. Hear from our instructors and admissions counselors about our educational style, resources, and application process. Tour our space and imagine what it would be like to come here and solve problems, build things, and learn something new.


Agenda:
6:15 Tour #1 (you can take a tour before or after the Info Session)
6:30-7:15 Info Session: Panel of current students, alumni, and staff
7:15 Tour #2 (you can take a tour before or after the Info Session)
7:15-7:30 Mingle and wrap-up 

Can't make this event? Come in for a tour on Tuesday or Wednesday between 4 and 6 pm. Sign up here for a tour here

Questions? Email [masked] or read our FAQ page.
results.how_to_find_us: We are located at 48 Wall Street, 15th Floor, in the Swig Equities building, next to the Museum of American Finance.
results.name: Dev Bootcamp May Info Session

results.description:
Experience a Bollywood-inspired dance-fitness program that combines exhilarating choreography and intensive workouts with upbeat music from around the world.

Price: $20/single class or package. Please register for classes on BOLLYX.com.

About the instructor:

Minal Mehta is the Co-Founder and President of BOLLYX. She has a fitness background in competitive synchronized swimming, water polo and swimming, and an artistic background in various styles of dance, including Bollywood, Kathak, jazz, Indian folk, and hip hop. Minal was at the forefront of Bollywood dance exploding in collegiate competitions nationwide, leading her UC Berkeley Bollywood dance team (Aao Na) to sweep all national competitions in 2005. Minal is an AFAA certified group fitness instructor and teaches BOLLYX classes in NYC.  Minal graduated from UC Berkeley in 2005 with a B.A. in Economics with Honors and from Harvard Business School in 2011 with an M.B.A in general management.

results.description:
Why just paint when you can Tipsy Paint? That's what we thought too! So put a brush in one hand and a drink in the other (doesn't have to be alcohol) and join us for a unique, colorful way to spend the night out and make new friends!

Tipsy Painting is a step-by-step, group-oriented painting instruction, which is designed to simultaneously entertain and enlighten our members. 

A professional artist guides you through a featured painting that is yours to keep and proudly display at the end of the night. And don’t worry — no experience is necessary. 

PREPAY ONLY. MUST BUY IN ADVANCE. *GET TICKETS HERE 

*$35-$45, price goes up as the event date gets closer. This event will sell out, especially for women. Tickets not sold at the door.  

What's included: 

• 2+ hour course lead by an expert artist to teach you the art of mixing colors, blending and painting techniques. 

• 12x16 pre-sketched canvas, acrylic paint (water based), and all painting supplies (brushes, aprons, easels) supplied

• Drink & Food Specials (1 drink min, can be non-alcoholic)  

 • Great Music At Right Volume For Mingling 

• Free Raffle & Prizes 

*Get Tickets HERE (sells out quickly so don't wait to get tix)

This event is being co-organized by several other groups. The # of RSVP's here are not reflective of actual attendance. Based on presales, at least 25 members will be attending! 

Can I still attend If I don't know how to paint? Yes, there's no experience necessary. 

Can I come alone? Yes, about 80% come on their own. 

Is this age/ethnic/age specific? No, this event is not meant to be age/ethnic specific or gender balanced. All are welcome, 21+. 

How do I attend? RSVP w/ group and purchase ticket here - 

https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/painting/dates/May-10-2016_at_0630PM

Here's picture we'll be painting -
results.how_to_find_us: Downstairs
results.name: Painting Social (Make Friends & Learn To Paint) Prepay Only

results.description:
We are proud to have with us Nicole Johnson, Solutions Architect for devops toolset and automation platform Chef and former president of her local Toastmasters chapter, will be sharing tips from her years of experience creating and giving technical talks. 

Join us, Tuesday, May 10 at ThoughtWorks (99 Madison Ave., 15th Floor, New York)!

Bring a talk idea and your laptop, or a pen and paper, and leave with an outline and some individualized feedback on how to do your best!

This workshop can be useful for developers at every level, but especially if you are interested in giving talks on conferences or meetups as such. 

Pizza and drinks will be provided. 

6:30-7: Food & socializing 

7-8:  Nicole - A Talk on How to Give Talks:     
- What makes for a good tech talk topic?   
- How to structure your talk    
- Make your talk memorable - engaging the audience, handling objections, etc.   
7:300-8:00: Work on an idea for your very own talk 
8:00-9:00: Present your talk idea and get feedback
results.name: How to put together a tech talk - workshop

venue.name: Pepper Hamilton LLP at The New York Times Building

results.description:
General Counsel & Head of Regulatory Affairs, Global Debt Registry

AND

Present:

Recent updates in alt finance: profitability, CFPB and Treasury Department

Due to circumstances beyond our (and their) control, a large enough number of  startups were unable to confirm their availability to pitch at our Meetup on May 10th. Without a critical mass of pitching companies, we have decided to change the event's subject to :

Recent updates in alt finance: profitability, CFPB and Treasury Department


Background :

Perhaps as a sign that the alternative finance and marketplace lending space is maturing, there has been a shift in focus from “building” to “profitability.” We will discuss this change in focus and its implications.

On Tuesday, May 10th the Treasury Department is scheduled to release its findings from last year's request for information on marketplace lending. Depending on the timing of the release, we hope to have a discussion of our reaction to the findings.

Regardless of the Treasury Department findings, the CFPB is targeting the marketplace lending space for regulation: what does that mean for the industry as a whole?

Program :

45 minutes of networking
30 minutes standing panel with Q&A
45 minutes of networking and individual Q&A 

Panel:

Gregory Nowak, Partner at Pepper Hamilton, and practice leader for hedge funds and marketplace lending 
Oren Bass, CEO, Pave, Inc.
George Popescu, Editor in Chief, Lending Times
Scott Jones, Corporate and Securities partner at Pepper Hamilton, and 
Ben Kahrl,General Counsel & Head of Regulatory Affairs, Global Debt Registry

Location: Pepper Hamilton office in New York.  


Time: Tuesday, May 10, doors open at 6:30pm for networking. 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

About George Popescu and Lending Times: 

Lending Times covers the peer-to-peer (p2p), marketplace and in general the alternative lending market. We provide a daily news digest and, a few times a week, an analysis piece usually about an aspect of this industry. Analysis topics include interesting business models, crowdlending and crowdfunding real-estate, unique originators, potential sources of venture capital and securitization via original service providers to the space. We cover companies like Lending Club, Prosper, Avant, SoFi, Funding Circle, OnDeck, Zopa and more.


George A. Popescu is the editor in chief of Lending Times, a news, data and analysis portal for the executives of p2p and marketplace lending industries. George built 10+ businesses and exited 4 of them successfully. He was the co-CEO and co-founder of Backed, an online lending marketplace focused on co-signed personal unsecured loans. Previously he sold and exited Boston Technologies (BT) in 2014. BT is a fin-tech company in the currencies over-the-counter space. George was the Founder and CEO and boot-strapped it from $0 to a $20+ million business without any equity investment. BT has been #1 fastest growing company in Boston in 2011 and on the Inc. 500/5000 list 4 years in a row. BT was acquired by Currency Mountain in 2014.

About Greg Nowak and Pepper Hamilton:


Pepper Hamilton LLP is a multi-practice law firm with more than 500 lawyers nationally. The firm provides corporate, litigation and regulatory legal services to leading businesses, governmental entities, nonprofit organizations and individuals throughout the nation and the world.


Gregory J. Nowak is a partner in the Philadelphia office of Pepper Hamilton LLP and a practice leader for hedge funds in the firm’s Funds Services Practice Group. He concentrates his practice in securities law, particularly in representing investment management companies and other clients on matters arising under the Investment Company Act of 1940 and the related Investment Advisers Act of 1940. Mr. Nowak also handles mergers and acquisitions, corporate and regulated investment company tax work and other corporate matters. He also represents broker-dealers and CTAs and CPOs with respect to matters under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and the Commodity Exchange Act. 

About Oren Bass and Pave:


Pave, based in New York City, our approach is simple, we advance money to people so that they can advance themselves. Unlike banks or credit card companies, our mission is to help you succeed by providing better access to affordable funding.We combine best in class technology with a personal touch, providing affordable rates and the right guidance to help you stay in control of your finances and future.


Oren Bass, co-founder and CEO of Pave was previously in structured finance at Goldman Sachs, Clifford Chance and Trustee at Fcancer.org. Now doing what I love - building a business. 

About Ben Kahrl and Global Debt Registry: 


Global Debt Registry (GDR) is the only real loan validation platform for consumer lending in the United States.  GDR digitally validates and certifies 100% of consumer accounts in a portfolio to reduce risk and provide investor confidence. GDR has been validating and ensuring the enforceability of charged off loans successfully for the last decade and is now applying their expertise to Marketplace lending (MPL) loans from origination. GDR works with platforms and investors to independently ensure the validity of the loans, critical underwriting data and certifies the representation of loan portfolios in support of initial investments, sales and securitizations.

Ben Kahrl, General Counsel & Head of Regulatory Affairs, Global Debt Registry. Prior to joining Global Debt Registry, Ben was a principal in the law firm Kahrl Wutscher LLP with a litigation practice representing banks, securitized trusts, mortgage lenders, mortgage loan servicers, mortgage loan investors, and other consumer lending industry participants. He is a frequent speaker on legal and technology issues for the banking industry, and teaches real property law for the Institute for U.S. Law at George Washington University Law School. Ben is licensed to practice in Maryland, New Jersey, New York and Washington, D.C., and is a member of the American Bar Association’s Committee on Consumer Finance Services. He received his undergraduate degree summa cum laude from UCLA, and received his law degree from the University of Pennsylvania Law School.

results.description:
My Co-host of WGLA and an amazing coach is having an event that I would highly recommend you attend! She is giving C2C connections a 50% discount!

Register at: http://boost-conversions.eventbrite.com
50% off with discount code: c2c

http:// https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tajqxo9Pki0

It is one thing to know the sales process, it is another to be able to master it. The gap lies in the delivery. Going through the steps will yield only average results. Knowing how to walk in any situation and present yourself in a way that makes an instant connection with prospects, delivers immediate impact and inspires them to take action on what you have to say, will convert sales on an optimal level.

Join an exclusive group of powerful business and sales professionals where you will learn how to increase your influence and dramatically boost your conversions.

Here is what you will learn in this exclusive, hands on, evening seminar:

•  Why your communication style may turn your prospects off and how you can fix it

• The reason why showing problem / solution is ineffective and what you need to do instead to grab attention

• The key to using your body language to engage your leads and convert sales faster

• How to use your speaking voice and shape your words to influence your prospects into action 

Plus there will be 2 live demos on how to boost your presenting power to make an instant impact and convert higher.  One demo will be of a sales conversation and the other, pitching from stage. 

You will be amazed at how small changes make a huge impact. 

This seminar will impact your business if you want to…

•  Speed up the sales process

• Increase your influence with the power of your words

• Differentiate yourself from the marketplace

• Present with power, confident and authenticity

• Magnetize people to you and be memorable

• Easily want to engage anyone you speak with

• Move beyond good results and maximize your efforts   

Who is this for?

1. Entrepreneurs and Sales Professionals looking to expand their market, gain greater visibility and shorten the sales process for increased volume and profits.

2. VP’s and Managers of Sales Teams looking for ways to significantly boost their team’s effectiveness and conversions.

3. Public Figures looking to activate their community to spread the word and take action on what they have to say.

Raving Fans from Previous Events...

VIDEO https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NKhkluVwbhE

Register at: http://boost-conversions.eventbrite.com50% off with discount code: c2c

results.description:
Dear beautiful sisters,


This Preparation Meeting is for those who are interested in joining the upcoming women’s ceremony in mid June, or for anyone who would like to learn about the work of the sacred Mother medicine.

The gathering will begin with a guided meditation and energy attunement, followed by screening of an introductory video. Afterwards, our team will answer questions and share helpful recommendations on how to mentally and physically prepare for a soul awakening shamanic journey. There will be some time for like-minded sisters to connect and hang out while enjoying light food and refreshment.

**This meet-up event is hosted by 'Little Owl" ~ authorized medicine woman of Oklevueha Native American Church of New York (ONACNY) onacny.org ** 

Suggested Donation (at the event): $10 

Your kind support will help ensure that we can continue to offer more enriching activities, meetings, and prayers for our community. Thank you!!


About “Women’s Medicine Circle” ceremony in mid June:

This women-only ceremony will focus on empowering the divine feminine while healing the body, mind and spirit by working with sacred Mother medicine. This ceremony is highly recommended for women who feel called and ready for a new level of self-realization, consciousness expansion, and fearless, purpose driven moments of life.

The opportunity to open your heart, be nurtured, experience unconditional love and release fears comes at this perfect time as we witness our Mother Earth transitioning and evolving herself.  This healing ceremony will be guided by a medicine woman who truly cares and understands the female heart and sensibilities. In such a supported space you are free to express, laugh, release, and cry with a beautiful group of women while creating deep and lasting bonds with your sisters!

The Women's Medicine Ceremony takes place overnight with powerful medicine songs (Icaros), mantras and healing music. It is organized by Oklevueha Native American Church (ONAC) of New York, and is guided by ONAC’s authorized medicine woman 'Little Owl'.

To sign up for the ceremony or to request more information, please send an email to: [masked]
results.name: Introduction Meeting for "Women's Medicine Circle"

results.description:
BEGINNER TANGO: Absolute Beginning

Beginner Tango course is meant for people who either never ever danced Argentine Tango, took few classes long time ago or took few lessons quite recently but are not sure what they know or if they are ready for next level.

You will learn basics necessary to progress further. The material is presented in very organized manner allowing smooth progress from class to class. 

Please note that even if you dance other dances like salsa, swing, zouk or any of Ballroom or American Style dances, even if for years you took ballet, jazz, hip hop or any other of solo dances, you need to take the Beginner level class. The axis, the basis for the dance, musicality and partnership is completely different. Taking those 4 classes might be the life changing experience for you. It is obvious that having dance background helps, but it shall also give you enough experience to know that the basic classes are THE MOST IMPORTANT ONES, as they create a base for all your learning experience. What you don’t know will always and always chase you.

 It’s good to take this course to put all your information in order. You gain the necessary vocabulary and learn all the basic movements to be able to easily follow the explanations in higher level courses. Please respect our commitment to excellence. And make it your own.

No partner necessary. Join at any time – though we do recommend starting at the beginning of the cycle (see above for dates). You can take this course as many times as you find necessary for you.

The full course consists of 4 60-minutes classes.
SIGN UP NOW
results.name: Dive into Argentine Tango: BEGINNER TANGO: Absolute Beginning

results.description:
Why just paint when you can Tipsy Paint? That's what we thought too! So put a brush in one hand and a drink in the other (doesn't have to be alcohol) and join us for a unique, colorful way to spend the night out and make new friends!

Tipsy Painting is a step-by-step, group-oriented painting instruction, which is designed to simultaneously entertain and enlighten our members. 

A professional artist guides you through a featured painting that is yours to keep and proudly display at the end of the night. And don’t worry — no experience is necessary. 

PREPAY ONLY. MUST BUY IN ADVANCE. *GET TICKETS HERE 

*$35-$45, price goes up as the event date gets closer. This event will sell out, especially for women. Tickets not sold at the door.  

What's included: 

• 2+ hour course lead by an expert artist to teach you the art of mixing colors, blending and painting techniques. 

• 12x16 pre-sketched canvas, acrylic paint (water based), and all painting supplies (brushes, aprons, easels) supplied

• Drink & Food Specials (1 drink min, can be non-alcoholic)  

 • Great Music At Right Volume For Mingling 

• Free Raffle & Prizes 

*Get Tickets HERE (sells out quickly so don't wait to get tix)

This event is being co-organized by several other groups. The # of RSVP's here are not reflective of actual attendance. Based on presales, at least 25 members will be attending! 

Can I still attend If I don't know how to paint? Yes, there's no experience necessary. 

Can I come alone? Yes, about 80% come on their own. 

Is this age/ethnic/age specific? No, this event is not meant to be age/ethnic specific or gender balanced. All are welcome, 21+. 

How do I attend? RSVP w/ group and purchase ticket here - 

https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/painting/dates/May-10-2016_at_0630PM

Here's picture we'll be painting -

results.description:
Can't attend ScalaDays? Or even if you can, but can't get enough Scala, Spotify can help us out!

Neville Li from Spotify will be presenting Scio, a Scala API for Google Cloud Dataflow. More details:

Abstract: We will present Scio, a Scala API for Google Cloud Dataflow (incubated as Apache Beam). Apache Beam offers a simple, unified programming model for both batch and streaming data processing while Scio brings it much closer to the high level API many data engineers are familiar with, e.g. Spark and Scalding. We will cover design and implementation of the framework, including features like type safe BigQuery macros, REPL, and serialization. There will also be some live coding demo.

Bio: Neville is a software engineer at Spotify who works mainly on data infrastructure and tools for machine learning and advanced analytics. In the past few years he has been driving the adoption of Scala and new data tools for music recommendation, including Scalding, Spark, Storm and Parquet. Before that he worked on search quality at Yahoo! and old school distributed systems like MPI.
results.name: Scio a Scala API for Google Cloud Dataflow (Apache Beam)

Class Tuesday night 6:30-8:30pm.
Intercambio is an “exchange” (as translated in English) of language and culture in a friendly atmosphere. The primary purpose is to provide an open forum for both English and Spanish learners to practice their conversational skills with native speakers. Intercambio is an essential compliment to formal language study, as it exposes participants to everyday dialects, idiomatic expressions and usages that are best explained by a native speaker.
Everyone is welcome!
results.name: Intercambio - Spanish/English language exchange

group.name: El Centro, volunteer led language classes in Midtown

Register at: http://boost-conversions.eventbrite.com


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tajqxo9Pki0

It is one thing to know the sales process, it is another to be able to master it. The gap lies in the delivery. Going through the steps will yield only average results. Knowing how to walk in any situation and present yourself in a way that makes an instant connection with prospects, delivers immediate impact and inspires them to take action on what you have to say, will convert sales on an optimal level.

Join an exclusive group of powerful business and sales professionals where you will learn how to increase your influence and dramatically boost your conversions.

Here is what you will learn in this exclusive, hands on, evening seminar:

•  Why your communication style may turn your prospects off and how you can fix it

• The reason why showing problem / solution is ineffective and what you need to do instead to grab attention

• The key to using your body language to engage your leads and convert sales faster

• How to use your speaking voice and shape your words to influence your prospects into action

Plus there will be 2 live demos on how to boost your presenting power to make an instant impact and convert higher.  One demo will be of a sales conversation and the other, pitching from stage.

You will be amazed at how small changes make a huge impact. 

This seminar will impact your business if you want to…

•  Speed up the sales process

• Increase your influence with the power of your words

• Differentiate yourself from the marketplace

• Present with power, confident and authenticity

• Magnetize people to you and be memorable

• Easily want to engage anyone you speak with

• Move beyond good results and maximize your efforts   

Who is this for?

1. Entrepreneurs and Sales Professionals looking to expand their market, gain greater visibility and shorten the sales process for increased volume and profits.

2. VP’s and Managers of Sales Teams looking for ways to significantly boost their team’s effectiveness and conversions.

3. Public Figures looking to activate their community to spread the word and take action on what they have to say.

Raving Fans from Previous Events...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NKhkluVwbhE

Register at: http://boost-conversions.eventbrite.com
results.name: Beyond the Sales Process: The Real Way to Boost Conversions

Class description: SALSA is a popular form of social dance that originated in New York City with strong influences from Latin America, particularly Puerto Rico, Cuba, and Colombia. The movements of salsa have origins in Cuban Son, Cha-cha-cha, Mambo and other dance forms.

Attire: It is preferred that you wear dance shoes if you have them otherwise you can wear any shoe with a leather or suede sole bottom. If you are taking level 2, dance shoes are mandatory (no sneakers or sandals) and bring a change of shirts with stretch pants.

Length & Pricing: 90 minutes / $25

This class will meet once a week every Tuesday from 6:30-8:00 for six weeks. If you check our class schedule we may have other SalsaOn2/Mambo classes featured on a different day/time/level so check us out at www.pielcaneladancers.com/ClassSchedule


Instructors Name: Joe Burgos, Founder/Director/CEO of Piel Canela.

Contact us at;

results.description:
In this workshop we will cover eight different ways to value pre-revenue companies.

Specific models that will be covered are:

1. Venture Capital Method - most popular
2. Discounted Cash Flow or NPV method
3. The Chicago Method
4. The Dave Berkus Valuation Model
5. Bill Payne's Model
6. The Risk Factor Summation Model
7. Replacement Method or "All-In" Method
8. The Rule of Thirds

We will discuss one example for each.

We will also discuss how to estimate the company's terminal value, WACC, and Free Cash Flow. 

NEW: we are now including a new section on how to value intellectual property and how having intellectual property affects your valuation.

Income and Balance sheet projections are not in scope for this Workshop as those are covered by the Financial Modeling workshop.


Payment for the Workshop will be required at the point of registration.

The early bird price of $27.50 is available until May 5th. After this the price goes to regular: $32.50.
results.name: Valuation Models for Pre-Revenue Companies II - SOLD OUT

results.description:
***We'll be back at American Express, our generous sponsors who make the monthly meetups possible. They have sensitive security procedures so please: 
1) enter your FULL NAME on the RSVP question. 
2) bring photo ID matching your name, or building security won't allow entrance.  

Come as close to 6:30pm as possible, registration closes at 7:30pm.

We're excited to have Mark Murphy (of Commonsware) back for a pre-IO talk, and Liam Spradlin (of touchlab) for updates on Project Phoebe & mutative design. Doors open 6:30pm, talks start at 7pm. 


Talks:
Mark Murphy, "Android, the Desktop, and Your App"
      In a few weeks, Google will hold their annual I|O conference. Rumors abound that Google will announce some sort of Android-on-the-desktop initiative, offering Android for desktop and notebook form factors. Even if Google doesn't announce anything at I|O, a move to have Android compete with Windows and OS X seems inevitable. This will have impacts on your app, to adapt to non-touchscreen displays, mice- and keyboard-centric user input, resizeable windows, and so on. 
     In this presentation, we will explore what what user expectations will be for desktop-style Android apps, how Android and your app might deal with those issues, and what else to watch out for with respect to any possible announcements in this space. 


Liam Spradlin, "Mutative Design: What it's like to use a mutative interface"
      Mutative design is a new methodology that hopes to address the problems inherent in designing for averages. It looks to create interfaces and experiences that are born, live, and evolve according to a user's ongoing realities, providing a no-compromise design that accounts for every user, regardless of vision level, data access, physical ability, or even tech savvy. The first steps in thinking about and experimenting with this methodology were made with the introduction of Project Phoebe in December (hello.phoebe.xyz), and now it's time to take a look at Phoebe's latest steps.
      In this talk we'll unpack what it's like to actually use and live with a mutative interface, how mutations may be automatically selected for using aggregated information about various user states, and how to ensure users feel comfortable with an interface that may change and grow as they do.

A big thanks to our sponsor, The American Express Company, and David for coordinating with us again.
results.name: May: Android on the Desktop, and the Latest on Project Phoebe

results.description:
Why just paint when you can Tipsy Paint? That's what we thought too! So put a brush in one hand and a drink in the other (doesn't have to be alcohol) and join us for a unique, colorful way to spend the night out and make new friends!

Tipsy Painting is a step-by-step, group-oriented painting instruction, which is designed to simultaneously entertain and enlighten our members. 

A professional artist guides you through a featured painting that is yours to keep and proudly display at the end of the night. And don’t worry — no experience is necessary. 

PREPAY ONLY. MUST BUY IN ADVANCE. *GET TICKETS HERE 

*$35-$45, price goes up as the event date gets closer. This event will sell out, especially for women. Tickets not sold at the door.  

What's included: 

• 2+ hour course lead by an expert artist to teach you the art of mixing colors, blending and painting techniques. 

• 12x16 pre-sketched canvas, acrylic paint (water based), and all painting supplies (brushes, aprons, easels) supplied

• Drink & Food Specials (1 drink min, can be non-alcoholic)  

 • Great Music At Right Volume For Mingling 

• Free Raffle & Prizes 

*Get Tickets HERE (sells out quickly so don't wait to get tix)

This event is being co-organized by several other groups. The # of RSVP's here are not reflective of actual attendance. Based on presales, at least 25 members will be attending! 

Can I still attend If I don't know how to paint? Yes, there's no experience necessary. 

Can I come alone? Yes, about 80% come on their own. 

Is this age/ethnic/age specific? No, this event is not meant to be age/ethnic specific or gender balanced. All are welcome, 21+. 

How do I attend? RSVP w/ group and purchase ticket here - 

https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/painting/dates/May-10-2016_at_0630PM

results.description:
Come out and play some games, hang out, have fun and maybe make some new friends.


The store has a library of games for us to play and some people bring their games as well. Leave a comment if you are bringing any games. It's OK if you do not.  If you are new to games, we'll teach you how to play. New-comers are always welcome.


The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there. Please support them by making purchases while we are using their establishment whenever possible. Thank you. 

If your plans change and you can't make it, please update your RSVP. Please do not just show up without RSVP.


Come join our board game Facebook group to stay in touch.

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/
results.name: Astoria Board Game Meet Up @ Geekery HQ

results.description:
Caserta Concepts, Datameer and Microsoft share their combined knowledge and a use case on big data, the cloud and deep analytics.  Learn how a global leader in the test, measurement and control systems market reduced their big data implementations from 18 months to just a few.  

Speakers share how to provide a business user-friendly, self-service environment for data discovery and analytics, and focus on how to extend and optimize Hadoop based analytics, highlighting the advantages and practical applications of deploying on the cloud for enhanced performance, scalability and lower TCO.

Agenda:

- Pizza and Networking

- Joe Caserta, President, Caserta Concepts - Why are we here?


- Nikhil Kumar, Sr. Solutions Engineer, Datameer -  Solution use cases and technical demonstration

- Stefan Groschupf, CEO & Chairman, Datameer - The evolving Hadoop-based analytics trends and the role of cloud computing

- James Serra, Data Platform Solution Architect, Microsoft, Benefits of the Azure Cloud Service

- Q&A, Networking
results.how_to_find_us: 11 Times Square NY, NY 5th Foor Room # 5202 Broadway
results.name: Datameer and Azure for Big Data Insights

results.description:
The Ask Bon Bon Show has more than 4.3 million viewers every week.

So, who is BonBon, you may be wondering? I know I would be.

Bonnie Bruderer is the host and executive producer of the ASKBONBON Show. 

She spent 20 years of her career with celebrity motivational giants  Tony Robbins, Harvey Mackay, Alex Mandossian and many others. 

She worked as a coach, in production, sales and marketing, event management, and as a speaker. She saw the inner workings of what made these world-class experts successful and emulated all of the knowledge to create her media empire. 

She is an award winning and highly acclaimed talk show host, a life and executive coach, holding 10 certifications, including Columbia University. 

She’s an inventor of two patented products, a loving dog-mom, a voracious reader and writer, a kick boxer, yogi, meditation junkie and has appeared and starred in three movies and three sitcoms. 

She is also a three-time author, previous radio show host and loves to laugh and spend time with her family.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SIdZPY4VXL8

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kB0i3-K82T0

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yG9NJ8E9b3k&list=PLZ3yEeb3lu9k9Zm9Hf0NNtxSWN1uCt_N7&index=5

To learn more please visit her website at:

http://theaskbonbonshow.com/


Please join us and let’s make sure you finally get to enjoy all the love you truly deserve! 

*********************************************

Please note:  The $15.00 Price (which covers our room cost and fees) is only if paid in advance here on this website which we are doing to streamline the evening to maximize on networking and learning. At the door, the price will be $20.

*********************************************

Directions to One Spirit Learning Alliance: 
247 West 36th Street, 6th Floor 
New York, NY

Subways are plentiful nearby. 
A, C, E, 2, 3, 7, N, Q, R, S & LIRR and Port Authority Buses 
HopStop.com it here

If you are driving in, print out a discounted parking coupon athttp://www.iconparkingsystems.com/neighborhood/fashion-center-parking/

*********************************************

NETWORKING / AFTER PARTY: Following this event , please join us for the Networking After-Party at Juniper Bar, 1 block away 
@ Juniper Bar 
237 W 35th St New York, NY 10001 (35th Street bw 7th and 8th Ave). 

Go all the way to the back of the bar to the elevated seating area in the back.

http://www.yelp.com/biz/juniper-new-york 

http://www.juniperbarnyc.com/menus.php

Every month, The New York  Power Team features a special guest speaker delivering content on a variety of topics of interest to high performers like you. Health and fitness, nutrition, finances, relationships, careers, overall mental well-being – we cover it all. Plus our outstanding peer group offers the support, encouragement – and accountability – to help you stay on course toward the life you want to lead. Make plans to join us at our next meeting and help spread the word to others who would benefit from the value we provide!

• Meeting dates are usually the 1st or 2nd Tuesday of each month -- or as announced when conflicts arise. 

Rest assured, we strive to give PowerTeam members an outstanding return on their investment of time and effort at every meeting. That means more social and volunteer activities. More personally relevant content. More skill and mastermind sessions. More goal setting. More support and accountability. If you know of a great presenter you'd like to recommend for an upcoming meeting, please let me know – we're always open to new guests who provide value. 

___________________________________________________ 

We hope to see you all at a meeting or event soon. Have an outstanding day and live with passion!

results.description:
OK. We have a great evening planned for May 10th.  We will be opening the festivities with a variety of Beers and will be hosting a highly informative beer tasting session sponsored by Permission Data.

After which we will adjourn to the meeting room to hear from two speakers who are doing some amazing things in the Rust world: 

Kamal Marhubi -  Systems Programming Shouldn't Be Hard

"Programming against Posix and Linux APIs is often difficult. Even expert C programmers can be foiled by accidentally mixing up parameter orders, and C's type system never complains.  Kamal has been doing significant work on nix-rust, helping to add memory and semantic safety to systems APIs. "

Kamal has a blog here and you can view some of his Rust contributions at https://github.com/nix-rust/nix

Amit Levy - Tock: A Safe OS for Microcontrollers 

"Frameworks and operating systems for embedded microcontrollers (think Arduinos) generally think of all code running on a platform as one big monoloth - everything is written by one group of people and it only does one thing. This isn't the case, though. We build embedded software just like anything else: grab a library from here, a code snippet from there. Moreover, recent generations of embedded devices do more than one thing (e.g. smart watches) and control increasingly sensitive functionality (e.g. implanted medical devices). What happens when there is a bug in one part of the code?"

Amit and his team are submitting on this topic to a prestigious publication and conference.  We are lucky enough to receive a "sneak preview" of their presentation. 

The location is Work-Bench which is at 110 5th ave. On the 5th floor.  Please stop by the security desk with ID to be allowed in to the event.
results.name: Systems Programming (in Rust) and Tasting (in Beer)

results.description:
Class Tuesday night 6:30-8 pm, $3 per evening.
Intercambio is an “exchange” (as translated in English) of language and culture in a friendly atmosphere. The primary purpose is to provide an open forum for both English and Spanish learners to practice their conversational skills with native speakers. Intercambio is an essential compliment to formal language study, as it exposes participants to everyday dialects, idiomatic expressions and usages that are best explained by a native speaker.
Everyone is welcome!
results.name: Intercambio - Spanish/English Language exchange

group.name: El Centro, English classes in NYC

One of our members suggested we try Tenzan, and, after a visit, we agree. While sushi/sashimi/fish are prominent, the menu has a range of options. There's also a very creative list of cocktails. We have the entire upstairs mezzanine reserved - a great space for mingling. As usual, cash is preferred.

results.description:
Craig Vitter, Solutions Architect, Basho

Free beer + drinks, candy, swag and more!

A Database Month event http://www.DBMonth.com/database/riak-ts

Handing Time Series data in highly available and scalable way has always been a significant challenge.

In this session we will introduce you to the newly open-sourced Riak TS (Time Series) database and show you how to get started and how to analyze time series data with Python, Pandas and Jupyter.

We will explain how RiakTS has been designed specifically for handling vast amounts of time series data, and will also show you how to utilize Python for time series data analysis.

During the demonstration phase we will use Jupyter to write and execute Python code that:


• Creates a table in Riak TS

• Populates the table with data

• Queries the data that we added

• Uses Pandas to visualize the results of our queries

Craig Vitter, Solutions Architect, Basho Craig has been designing and building data driven applications for more than twenty years.

At Basho, Craig works with customers looking to architect and build applications on top of Riak KV or Riak TS.

Swag giveaway + food/drinks at 6:30pm
Power-Networking at 6:35pm 
Presentation starts at 6:40pm

Did you know that Techie Youth is the ONE-AND-ONLY organization providing career-opportunities to severely-at-risk foster-youth in New York?

Techie Youth is a 501c3 not-for-profit charity of NYC that provides technology-education, followed by assistance beginning an IT-career, to at-risk youth in NYC & Long Island who are in foster-care and classified as being severely-at-risk of becoming homeless and/or incarcerated in the next 18-24 months.

These kids need YOU, they have nobody else.
Please help them. Learn about Nadine, a student of Techie Youth: http://www.TechieYouth.org/hope

results.description:
Hey Community Builders!

Please RSVP here!


Join our friends at CultureIQ, ZogSports, ThinkHuman, and General Assembly to discuss scaling company culture! 

A collaborative culture is one of the hardest things to maintain as a company grows and scales. It is also essential to ensure success over time. Whether you are shaping a culture from scratch or revamping how things get done in your organization, this event will explore how to shake up those silos, disrupt the pecking order, and foster collaboration internally to drive success.

CultureIQ, ZogSports, and General Assembly have teamed up to bring you a memorable, interactive gathering of professionals faced with this challenge. Participants will walk away with tactics for how they can authentically bake collaboration into their culture from the speakers, the exercises, and each other.

Agenda

• Refreshments & networking
• Thought leader presentation by Meredith Haberfield (30 mins)
• Group activity led by ZogSports
• Tying it all together / collaborative networking activity led by CultureIQ
• More refreshments & networking

About the Presenter

Meredith Haberfeld
Founder & CEO, ThinkHuman

Meredith is founder and CEO of ThinkHuman, a culture consulting firm to growth-stage entrepreneurial organizations —think Spotify, Farfetch and SoulCycle. Meredith has conducted original research on employee engagement, has 15+ years of experience as a culture and leadership consultant, and is best known for her transformative work with executives, entrepreneurs and their teams. Meredith teaches at top educational institutions, including the Esalen Institute and MIT, and is a frequent expert for media outlets including The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, BusinessWeek, CNBC, CNN, and Forbes.

About the Event Partners

CultureIQ
CultureIQ is a platform that helps companies strengthen their culture. It consists of software and strategy that enable organizations to make positive, measurable changes to their culture, and a community that connects peers and experts around the topic of culture. CultureIQ helps companies actively engage their culture through an ongoing process of collecting, understanding, and responding to internal feedback to drive employee engagement, retention, and success.

ZogSports
ZogSports organizes private field days, co-ed tournaments, team building activities and holiday parties for hundreds of companies seeking to improve employee engagement. Imagine your office playing human foosball, tug of war, and BubbleBall right after conquering an inflatable obstacle course! Top that off with food/drinks and your coworkers will come away feeling more connected to the company and each other (all while making your life a whole lot easier in the process). Oh yeah, we’re also the largest co-ed social sports league in the country!

And remember, please RSVP here!
results.name: Creating a Collaborative Culture

A professional artist guides you through a featured painting that is yours to keep and proudly display at the end of the night. And don’t worry — no experience is necessary. 

PREPAY ONLY. MUST BUY IN ADVANCE. *GET TICKETS HERE

results.description:
Join us for an evening of intense usability testing with fellow startup companies. 

Think 'Speed Dating' for Product Feedback. Over the course of an hour and a half you'll meet with 5-6 other startups and take turns to give and get feedback on each other's ideas.

THE FORMAT: 

Bring your wireframes, sketches, or freshly-baked code - and arrive with one clear task you want the user to achieve.

For example, it could be navigating through your onboarding, posting an event, listing an item on your site, or taking and sharing a photo.

You'll then have 7 minutes to watch (and listen!) to another startup interact with your product, before the tables turn and you get to test their product out too.

NOTE: WeWork City Hall used to be named WeWork Fulton Center, there is now a new WeWork location called Fulton Center – they are not the same.  Please make sure you go to the WeWork location at 222 Broadway.

results.description:
>> PURCHASE TICKETS HERE <<<

PLEASE BYPASS the RSVP button at right and register directly above. If you are a dues-paying Member of Out Professionals, this assures you no-cost or low-cost admission to this event. (Nonmembers are always welcome, but nonmember rates apply if you are just part of our Meetup group.) For a full year of Member savings and other career benefits, join Out Professionals here. 

WOMEN OF OP.LYNX INVITE YOU TO NETWORK AND SOCIALIZE AT A PRIVATE VIEWING OF AN EYE-OPENING TAKE ON SEVENTIES ART.

One evening only — Tuesday, May 10 — the members of OP.LYNX, the dynamic women’s network of Out Professionals, invite you to enjoy socializing and networking at SoHo’s buzz-worthy Leslie-Lohman Museum of Gay and Lesbian Art (“Best place for gay culture” — Time Out New York).

Enjoy a leisurely private viewing of “The 1970s: The Blossoming of a Queer Enlightenment.” The Seventies were informed by the sexual revolution, anti-war efforts and the civil rights movement of the Sixties. This vibrant show explores the liberating decade between the galvanizing response to the police raids at the Stonewall Inn and the first rumblings of the AIDS crisis.

Loans from the Lesbian Herstory Archives and the New York Public Library make up some of the 115 works on view. Included is the iconic X Portfolio by Robert Mapplethorpe (1978), which precipitated the Culture Wars of the Eighties.

This noteworthy event continues a promotional partnership between Out Professionals and Leslie-Lohman (“Invaluable museum” — The New York Times), internationally the first museum dedicated to exhibiting, preserving and fostering the creation of LGBTQ art.

Photo credit: Rink Foto: The first large group of lesbians in the San Francisco Gay Parade, invited by Harvey Milk; 1974/2016. Archival inkjet print. (Detail)


WHERE

Leslie-Lohman Museum (“A mirror for gay history” — Smithsonian Magazine), at 26 Wooster Street, between Grand and Canal Streets; wheelchair accessible. Subway: A/C/E, J/Z, N/Q/R or 1/6 to Canal Street.

WHAT’S UP

Private Out Professionals viewing of “The 1970s: The Blossoming of a Queer Enlightenment.” Networking (bring business cards), 6:30 to 8:30 p.m. Enjoy white wines and waters, accompanied by cheeses (cow, goat, sheep milk); seasonal fruit and nuts; and baguette, crostini and pita triangles, with dips from around the globe.

ALL-INCLUSIVE ADMISSION

Pre-registered nonmember, $30; at the door, $35. Pre-registered, dues-paying OP Member, $20; at the door, $25. Walk-ins welcome. Pre-sale closes at noon on Tuesday, May 10. Pocket a copy of your online receipt; thanks! All sales final. Sorry, no refunds or exchanges.

IT PAYS TO BE AN OP MEMBER OF OUT PROFESSIONALS!

OP.LYNX was founded to enhance and diversify Out Professionals membership and to create programming of special interest to lesbian, bisexual and transgender women. A 12-month individual Out Professionals membership (new or renewal) PLUS guaranteed admission to tonight’s noteworthy event is yours for just $75. And remember, that buys you a year’s worth of low-cost or no-cost OP networking and socializing. Order here.
results.name: Let's Meetup and View LGBT Art!

results.description:
This May, China Institute has partnered with the Beijing Contemporary Art Foundation to bring some of China’s best-selling and most beloved writers to New York. Please join us on Tuesday, May 10, 2016, for a conversation between Yu Hua, one of China’s best-known novelists, and Xudong Zhang, Director of NYU China House. Together they will delve into the mimetic impulse in Yu Hua’s fiction, exploring the realist dimension of this writer who has been studied primarily under the rubric of modernism, experimentation, and the avant-garde.

Yu Hua is the author of five novels, six story collections, and three essay collections, including To Live, Brothers, and China in Ten Words. He is a Contributing Op-Ed Writer for the New York Times and his work has been translated into more than twenty languages. He is the recipient of many awards, including the James Joyce Award, France’s Prix Courrier International, and Italy’s Premio Grinzane Cavour. Yu Hua lives in Beijing.

Xudong Zhang is a Professor of Chinese and Comparative Literature at NYU. He is the Director of NYU China House, where he is an expert on modern Chinese Literature and Culture.

REGISTER TODAY!
results.name: Celebrated Voices of Contemporary Chinese Literature: An Evening with Yu Hua

results.description:
Given by Yasuko Kasaki
Tuesdays from 6:30 – 7 pm
Free

Please join us in the sharing of miracles. Here, your mind can come to rest and you can remember true peace. No experience with meditation is required, and everyone is welcome. We ask only that you make it your intention to sit still, quiet in body and mind, and to listen to; receive and follow my instruction to the best of your ability. You will learn to meditate as you practice. Please arrive for Meditation before 6:30 pm as we don't allow latecomers to enter.

We at CRS are dedicated teachers and students of A Course in Miracles (ACIM) who are waiting to share miracles with you through our ACIM Healing. We ask the Holy Spirit to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and we share forgiveness and bear witness to the miracles that are happening in your life. Each week I will share with you a different inspirational message from Holy Spirit. This may take the form of creative visualization exercises, or instruction about the nature and purpose of meditation, or about our true nature and relationship to ourselves, to one another, and to the world. In a sense, this is both a meditation practice and a meditation class.

Some students have been coming regularly for a number of years. Others drop in and out as they have time or need. Some come to learn and grow, others more so simply to calm down, to take time out from the frenetic pace of their busy lives. If you are new and feeling uncertain or shaky, do not hesitate to introduce yourself to some of the other students, to ask questions before or after. Try to observe and emulate the stillness and concentration of others around you whom you sense are most grounded. Soon, you, in turn, may provide inspiration and guidance for others.

While the principles are based on ACIM, it does not matter if you are unfamiliar with ACIM or are not prepared to study it outside of this meditation. You can still take from this practice some very practical, effective lessons, tools, and experiences that can enable you to lead a more peaceful, purposeful, fulfilling and loving life.

Namaste,

Yasuko Kasaki,
Founder
CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing)
123 4th Ave, 2nd FL (between 12th & 13th streets, above Think Coffee)
New York, NY 10003
[masked]
www.crsny.org
results.name: ACIM-Based Guided Meditation

** Recommended parking is at the Red Hawk Parking Deck. **

If you're looking to learn some of the fundamentals of data science, this is an event that you won't want to miss.


About the Speaker

Manojit Nandi is a Stanford-educated, former Verizon data scientist who currently works at STEALTHBits Technologies focusing on real-time and batch methods for anomaly and threat detection in their enterprise's data.

About the Talk

In this talk, Manojit will be discussing how machine learning is used in data classification tasks. He'll be covering standard machine learning algorithms such as Support Vector Machines and Random Forests, which can be run on any general-purpose computer (no special hardware needed) using Python. 

He'll discuss the behavior of these algorithms from both a quantitative and a qualitative perspective, and how they are used in applied settings. This talk is designed for people who have no background in machine learning, so no prior knowledge of statistics or machine learning is assumed. 

Feel free to bring your own laptop if you'd like to follow along with the talk/demo.
results.name: Intro to Machine Learning: Supervised Learning

One of the most comprehensive tours of Central Park you will ever have!  Join members of NYSN and their friends for this private walking tour through the world’s most famous Urban Oasis during the most beautiful time of the year as the sun sets and the skyline comes alive.  You will find out the history of the park, see then and now photo’s and socialize along the way!  It is a fun way to spend the evening.

PLEASE PAY WHEN YOU ARRIVE *BRING EXACT CHANGE* $15

Highlight’s include:

The famous statues, Navy Terrace, Bethesda Fountain, Bow bridge, Literary Walk, The Ramble, Belvedere Castle, Sheep Meadow, Tavern on the Green, and more!

What should I wear? Wear comfortable shoes. Most people come from work

Can I come alone? Yes 99% of those attending will have signed up on their own.

Refunds given only if tour is canceled due to rain.  If cloudy the history tour still happens

The group will meet at The Firehouse Tavern at 522 Columbus ave at 85th between 6- 6:30pm.  The tour ends at tavern on the Green 67th and Central Park West

Tour is Approx: 90 minutes.

results.description:
Dear Dharma Friends,

NOTE: Please RSVP on DharmaDrink.com.

The workshop topic will be on the 12 Links of Conditioned Arisings or 12-Linked Chain of Dependent Origination (nidanas). It explains the cycle of birth and death and is one of the most widely employed system for explaining causes and conditions.

Here it is way simplified: (1) fundamental ignorance; (2) action; (3) consciousness; (4) name and form; (5) six sense organs; (6) contact; (7) sensation; (8) craving; (9) grasping; (10) coming into existence; (11) birth; (12) aging and death. Each step is a consequence of the preceding step, but many causes come together under various conditions to produce consequences (conditional arising and karmic results). There are explanations abound.

The Heart Sutra summarizes the 12 Links as follows: - There is no ignorance - or ending of ignorance, - through to no aging and death - or ending of aging and death

While ordinary people think of cutting off their pain and suffering but without cutting off their greed, aversions and delusions, Buddhadharma stresses the contemplation of understanding causes before the consequences. The Heart Sutra addresses the resolution of ending cycle of suffering, the 12 Links.

Join us for a fun workshop taught by Venerable Guo Xing. This topic is major section of the Heart Sutra. While the sutra is one of the shortest and best known, the concepts are deep and that often requires many (and more) sessions to understand. If you are interested in this type of studies or have some background, this would be a beneficial workshop for you. It may not be for everyone. There is no cost to this workshop. If you want to donate you can donate to your charity of choice or Venerable GuoXing's center. -------
Venerable Guo Xing is the current Abbot of Chan Meditation Center in Queens NY and Dharma Drum Retreat Center in Upstate NY, part of Dharma Drum Mountain, an international Buddhist organization based in Taiwan. Venerable was ordained under Late Chan Master Shen Yen in 1986 and assisted the Master between 1987 and 2007 in leading meditation retreats in Taiwan, Southeast Asia, and the United States, totaling more than 50 retreats, including the first 49 day retreat at DDRC in 2000. Venerable is one of Chan Master Sheng Yen’s Dharma heirs. _/|\_

Eddie

- - - - - References / Recommended Readings - - - - -

There is No Suffering, a commentary of the Heart Sutra by Chan Master Sheng Yen

Basic Buddhist Concepts by Kogen Mizuno

http://www.buddhanet.net/e-learning/snapshot05.htm
results.name: Ignorance Aging Death Or None Of (12Links) Dharma Workshop by Venerable Guo Xing

results.description:
Become the best damn hypnotist you can – Tuesday night* Practice Group

NEO-ERICKSONIAN HYPNOSIS PRACTICE GROUP – Join us for our regular on-going Practice Group and become the best damn hypnotist you can be!

*Every second and forth Tuesday evening of the month. Continues May 10th and 24th for 2 hours, 7 PM to 9 PM at the TRS Suites in New York City.

Each meeting will focus on something new or in need of practice so we can improve our skills and expand our range. We’ll watch videos of Milton Erickson in action and take the time to dissect them and really learn from them. You’ll learn and share new techniques. We’ll swap scripts. We’ll swap books and other media. Above all, we’ll PRACTICE and get GOOD.

One benefit you get from attending is the group support of learning. Last time we met we watched a couple of hours of a newly available DVD set called “In the Room with Milton Erickson.” It’s how Erickson taught Ericksonian Hypnosis. Up to maybe a dozen people would squeeze into his office and listen to him speak and watch him do demos. Now YOU can be in that room too. It’s pretty amazing, really, and SO instructive. I love it.

AND – it’s only $20 a night! (Amazing deal.)

Open to graduates of Doug’s NLP or Hypnosis trainings or students who have received similar training from other reputable training centers.

TUESDAY evening, May 10th

TRS Professional Suite, 40 Exchange Place, New York City, NY

7:00pm – 9:00pm

* NOTE – Please arrive EARLY so we can start at 7:00


CLICK HERE - ONLY $20 (via PayPal)

Doug O'Brien
Certified Master Practitioner and Trainer of Neuro-Linguistic Programming; Ericksonian Hypnotherapist
</a><a href="http://www.dougobrienhypnosis.com/">http://www.dougobrienhypnosis.com
http://www.ericksonian.com

As a Hypnotherapist, Doug helped found the Department of Complementary Medicine at Columbia Presbyterian Hospital in the mid-nineties, under Dr. Mehmet Oz. Doug worked directly with pre-operative and post-operative patients on stress management and pain reduction as well as long term behavioral change to generate healthy living.

Doug O'Brien, is an NLP Master Trainer - originally given that designation by Anthony Robbins over 20 years ago - and is called a modern Shaman by some. He is also a musician and composer and a Trance Master Guide.

He is the guy who gave Tony Robbins an insight that completely changed Tony's approach to his second book (it was going to be called "The Niagara Syndrome" and became, instead, "Awaken the Giant Within")

Doug is the guy who has been the success coach to two of the top internet marketers in the country as well as corporate executives, top musical artists, fashion designers and professional athletes.

He has helped literally tens of thousands of people quit smoking in one session.
He has helped similar numbers lose weight and keep it off through the power of Hypnosis.

He can help YOU, too.

Endorsements/Testimonials
“I have attended all three of Doug’s Trance Night sessions. Each experience has been extremely powerful with noticeable results and the impact has lasted. I am definitely looking forward to attending the future Trance Nights.”
– Jackie

"Best Meet-up ever.”
– Kate

“Your Trance Night was a wonderful respite from the world. It was like a vacation from all of the stresses of every day life, a vacation for my soul. It continues to ripple though me today. So glad I came.”

– Marshall

results.description:
Maximize your potential with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your SPRING with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call 

<a>[masked]</a>

Looking forward to training with you!

results.description:
Thanks to all who could make Tuesday's talk and reading - I Am Never Upset for the Reason I Think (Video below). 

During our sharing, we discussed what the word "World" means. Some Advaita sages have said - "There is but one earth, but many worlds." 

While we all want to see change in our "world", the human mind thinks change can only come through struggle and conflict. How can we have change by "seeking not to change"? It may seem paradoxical, but the Course teaches us exactly this. We hope you'll join us on Tuesday at 7pm as we explore this idea of "Seek not to change the world". We're happy to have your presence.  

Please RSVP before Tuesday, 5/10 to attend our next meeting.


https://youtu.be/jYxVeWFnSeQ

results.description:
Tech Tuesday is Hack Manhattan’s weekly general interest open house. Don’t worry, it’s not just about technology—any kind of project is welcome.

Tech Tuesday is the perfect opportunity to visit Hack Manhattan and check out what it’s all about.

Bring a project and get to work, use our tools, drink a homebrew beer, hang out, and draw on advice from our wonderful community. Visitors are strongly encouraged to bring a project to work on, or at least a laptop.

Find out more about Hack Manhattan at our website, hackmanhattan.com. Not everyone can come in every Tuesday, so most of the community happens on our mailing list.


If you want to join Hack Manhattan as a member, we expect you to have visited us at least thrice before applying.

Note: The last Tuesday of the month is our monthly business meeting. It usually lasts less than 30 minutes.

results.description:
Beverly Francis will call the democratically-elected program of English country dance with live musical accompaniment by The Dressed Ship! CDNY dancers have voted for their favorite dances, and Beverly will be teaching and calling them to all who come!

The Dressed Ship is:

Bill Peek, piano 
Tom Phillips, violin
Jody Kruskal, concertina


Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance!

English country dance is choreographed community dancing, with repertoire ranging from court dances of the 1650s through dances composed this year. If you’ve seen any of the Jane Austen movies, you’ve glimpsed some kinds of ECD.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up.

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID.  Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us.  They will give you a free pass to return as our guest!

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!

results.description:
Want to take the leap into ultra running but unsure how to go about it? Have you read Born To Run and were inspired to try out the Leadville 100? Watched the Barkley Marathons documentary and intrigued to know more? Join us for an evening of stories about these events and tips on training, nutrition, and gear!
Jackrabbit (Upper West Side) will host this panel style event - bring your questions!

Speakers include: 


Harald Zundel - former Navy SEAL turned pro adventure racer turned ultra runner. He has completed 3 loops of the (in)famous Barkley Marathons course, helped Dean Karnazes run across the USA, and finished 3rd at the Bigfoot 200 last year. This summer he will race UTMB (Ultra Trail du Mont Blanc) in the Alps. 

Keila Merino - Bronx elementary school teacher by day, ultra-runner on nights, weekends, and summers. She was named NYRR's Ultra Runner of the year for the past 2 years, completed the 'Grand Slam of Ultra Running,' and placed 3rd at the Leadville 100. This summer, she will run across the USA and attempt to break a Guinness World Record. 

Jackrabbit will also raffle off one pair of Altra running shoes!!

results.description:
Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

A note on warm ups: We do not do a full warm up as a group in Central Park, so we encourage you to show up at 7 p.m. having jogged an easy mile or two ahead of time.

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage

Pictorial Photographers of America (PPA) is open to photographers - professional, amateur, and beginner - of all levels. Founded by Clarence H. White in 1916, it is one of NYC's oldest photography clubs.

We meet at 7:00PM on the 2nd and 4th Tuesdays of the month at 346 West 20th Street (between 8th& 9th), St. Peter’s Church Rectory in Chelsea.

You can contact us at: [masked]

One meeting per month is usually a presentation by a photo professional, and one is a members' competition (digital and print categories) critiqued and judged by a professional.

Please ring the bell when you arrive.

Visitors are very welcome.

Please join us for on Tuesday, May 10th, at 7:00PM for our monthly competition.

The judge will be Charles Rosoff.


Charles Rosoff, ASA, MRICS is President of Appraisal Services Associates in New York City, a firm of appraisers of Fine Art and Antiques & Decorative Arts focusing on providing forensic valuations for dispute resolution and litigation. Our fine art and antique appraisers value individual properties as well as large collections (50,000+). Besides fine art and antique, we value photography, decorative arts, collectibles, residential and office contents since 1984. The appraisals are provided to assist the collector, attorney, accountant, fiduciary, insurance company and claimants in routine filings as well as in litigation and dispute resolution. We also provide tax appraisals based on rental rates, fractional gifts and for fractional ownership discounts when allowed.  We also assist in providing blockage discount appraisals for artist's estates and large collections. We listen very carefully to the needs of our clients, providing a scope of work that can range from a simple consultation to an inspection, summary report, self contained report and testimony. Extensive experience in expert witnessing results in great success equally for both plaintiffs as well as defendents. Frequently both sides stipulate to our reports.

Active as an appraiser since 1984, Mr. Rosoff was the Legal Issues Columnist for the American Society of Appraisers Personal Property Journal, taught Appraisal Research Methods at New York University, and is currently teaching USPAP and the ASA PP204 Legal Issues course at University of Chicago, SUNY Purchase, and  RISD.  He is Co-Editor of two legal textbooks, Valuation Strategies in Divorce and Valuing Specific Assets in Divorce published by Walters Kleuer.  For two years, he participated in two mock trials at the Association of the Bar of the City of New York, and participated as a speaker in the Port-Mortem and Estate Planning program of ALI-ABA, the Advanced Learning Institute of the American Bar Association.  He has also delivered at three international conferences held by the American Society of Appraisers, and is a Certified Instructor of Uniform Standards of Professional Appraisal Practice promulgated by the Appraisal Foundation.  Furthermore, Mr. Rosoff has testified over 17 times across the United States in Supreme, State and County Courts. State and County Courts.

Charles Rosoff, ASA, MRICS

results.description:
Faster than JSON with Paul Fielek. JSON has become a great one-size-fits-all solution for sending information between applications, but what can you do when JSON becomes too cumbersome for your project? This talk will cover MessagePack, Protocol Buffers, and FlatBuffers. I will focus on the advantages and disadvantages of each serialization format, and how they can help optimize your applications' communication.

Human Powered Ruby with Andrew Glass. Machine learning and AI are all the rage, but there’s often no replacement for real human input. This talk will explore how to automate the integration of human-work directly into a Ruby app, by enabling background workers to request and retrieve data from actual human workers. The secret is Amazon Mechanical Turk, a crowdsourcing marketplace connecting ‘requesters’ who post tasks with ‘workers’ who complete them. Attendees will learn how to automate the completion of human tasks (e.g. price research, image tagging, sentiment analysis, etc) with impressive speed, accuracy and scalability.
results.name: Crowdsourcing and Protocol Buffers

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S_hGdGKAkv8

New York Premiere with director João Botelho in person

Portugal/Brazil. Dir. João Botelho. 2014, 139 mins.
In Portuguese with English subtitles.
With Graciano Dias, Maria Flor, Filipe Vargas. 

Adapted from esteemed Portuguese novelist Eça de Queirós’s nineteenth-century masterpiece Os Maias, this sumptuously designed tragicomedy is a sweeping saga of forbidden love and familial decline. It follows the ill-fated bloodline of the fallen Maia family across three generations, eventually landing on 27-year-old Carlos (Graciano Dias), who sets out to restore the clan’s honor by setting up a medical practice in Lisbon. But the allure of illicit romance is strong. The stunningly stylized production design embraces theatrical artifice to create a dazzling storybook world.

Admission is free, on a first-come, first-seated basis.

Since events of this kind typically fill up, I strongly recommend that you arrive early.

Note:  We are only posting 5 of the films as events and I will not be able to attend the entire series.  The first two people who arrive at the venue will have their pick of a free ticket to a film in this series that I am not attending.


UPDATE:  The museum is offering a Festival Pass for this entire series for $40. Click here for full list of films and purchase link for the pass.

Please be sure your communication settings allow you to receive updates regarding this event.

Originally posted 4/22/16.

results.description:
In August 2015, an elite team of explorers in an expedition to the High Arctic to produce a feature documentary, a book, a series of exhibition worldwide and to augment a study being carried out by the Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution.


The Mission of Elysium – Artists for the Arctic is to capture the panorama, flora and fauna of the high Arctic in a perspective no one has ever seen before. The Arctic region is regarded as one of the most enchanting wilderness regions of our planet, yet volatile and under severe threat from the warming of the world’s climate. This expedition promises the most awe-inspiring and stunning visual interpretation ever seen of the Arctic. If a picture is worth a thousand words, then the images of the Elysium Artists team shall inspire appreciation and love for the Arctic and a greater awareness of the impacts of climate change.

Sixty expedition members were carefully selected for this unique benchmark expedition starting from Longyearbyen to North Spitsbergen, North and East Greenland and finishing at Keflavik, Iceland. Besides panoramas of glaciers, icebergs and snowy mountains, imagery will focus on polar bears, walruses, belugas, narwals, arctic foxes, auks, snowy owls, muskoxens, arctic hares, and fin and blue whales. 


About the Speakers

Martin Kraus has been an avid diver for the past 35 years (martinkraus.com). He has been diving on 6 continents and, after wreck diving in NY, got very interested in cold water diving and joined the Elysium Expedition as a photographer and helping with the climate change messages and exhibitions. Highlights of his recent diving include the Philippines, Chuuk Lagoon and orcas in the fjords of Norway. He will go to remote areas of Iceland in a month time to show Guillemots birds diving for prey underwater.  

John and Joanna Lentini are legally wedded dive buddies. John is a banker by day, and diver for play. He was a supporting videographer on the Elysium film crew. Joanna is a writer and photographer with a focus on wildlife, dive travel, and underwater environments.  She was a contributing photographer on the Elysium Expedition. During surface intervals in the New York City area, Joanna keeps her skills sharp with underwater portrait work in local pools. You can view some of her work at www.deepfocusimages.com. Both John and Joanna were heavily involved in preliminary planning and logistics for the Expedition for close to two years leading up to the trip. 

Arthur Vaccarino was a member of the scientific crew and a support diver for the mission. He was tasked with assisting the head scientist in sample collection and processing. Additionally he was a support diver for the various photographers and filmmakers.
results.how_to_find_us: 2nd floor. Please use the rear stairs.
results.name: May Meeting: Elysium - Artists for the Arctic
