results.description:
TOPIC

The struggle between the forces of good and evil is a common theme in art and literature: one merely needs to go to the cinema or read fiction. Can good and evil be determined astrologically? Michael will illuminate their relationship by philosophically exploring concepts of good and evil; discussing traditional and modern astrological approaches to the issue; and, presenting a series of horoscopes of the famous and notorious.


SPEAKER

Michael Barwick is a professional astrologer with 30 years of experience. He maintains a professional practice centered in Toronto, Ontario, Canada and is a respected international speaker.


Michael has spoken at Cleveland's Midwest Astrology Conference (MAC) and Buffalo’s State of the Art (SOTA) Astrology Conference. He has also spoken for Astrology Toronto (AT), the Canadian Association for Astrological Education (CAAE) and other organizations across Ontario.

Michael has seen and experienced that astrology is a profound tool for learning about yourself and the world around you, personal empowerment and tackling life challenges successfully. He is currently serving as the president of Astrology Toronto, a non-profit corporation that convenes astrological workshops and educates the public about astrology.


A suggested donation is $5 very much appreciated. Please know whatever you can afford is acceptable. Donations collected pay our rent, Meetup.com fees, beverages and snacks, and speaker! If you show up a little early, the Quest Bookshop is an excellent source of many metaphysical books and items, and well worth a browse. Please know they close at 7 pm. 

DIRECTIONS

Our meetup takes place at the Theosophical Society, which is next door to Quest Bookshop. You may enter through the bookshop before 7 pm (when it closes) or to the left of the bookshop after 7 pm. A sign will be posted on the door you can enter. The following is a rough outline. We start at 7 pm.

7–7:20 - Short talk sharing some astrological fundamentals, especially for beginners 

7:20–7:40 - Brief intros from attendees, announcements 

7:40–8:40 - Main presentation 

8:40–9:15 - Socializing (while putting away chairs)
results.name: May 2016: Divine & Diabolical: the Astrology of Good and Evil

Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds/credit: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund, please provide the Paypal Transaction ID: 18D76937M[masked]R No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W 77th street): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors, check for pictures. the door is closed but unlocked, report to our security and go to the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Help us to post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
How often do we take the time to slow down, tune in to what our body needs, massage and stretch our muscles?

We live in a culture that values always being in action, either at our computer or at the gym (or even the yoga studio!).

But taking the time to stretch is just as important, both for its physical benefits as well as its psychological, emotional and spiritual ones.

It improves our range of motion, while also stretching our range of emotion.

- Release tightness and tension from your muscles
- Improve flexibility and circulation
- Relieve lower back pain
- Stress relief
- Deeper breathing, which leads to feelings of spaciousness and well-being
- Reconnecting with the body, leaving us feeling more whole, aware and capable of dealing with life's challenges
- Release 'happy' hormones
- Connect with the senses, sensuality and release shame around our body

We will start with a guided meditation, followed by deep breathing and slow stretching.

Please bring a yoga mat, a pen and journal, and dress comfortably.

See you on the mat!

Love always,

Melody

Sensual Meditative Stretching: Release Stress and Befriend Your Body

Every other Tuesday, 7-8:30 pm

27 W 24th Street,  Suite 700A

New York, NY

$15 donation / $20 for 2 if you bring a friend

Register

NOTE: in order to cover costs, this meetup requires at least 5 people to be signed up 24 hrs prior for it to happen. Please RSVP mindfully and purchase your ticket so I know what size room to book for us in advance.

----------------------------
ABOUT MELODY KIERSZ
Melody Kiersz holds a degree in Happiness from the prestigious New York University, is a Certified Holistic Health Counselor graduated from the Institute for Integrative Nutrition, a member of the American Association of Drugless Practitioners, and a Certified Yoga Teacher through Jungle Yoga Ashram.

Melody is a deep listener and reads between the lines to guide you in discovering the ways you're holding yourself back from your true expression. She specializes in healing our relationship with our bodies, our selves and others, improving body image and self-esteem, increasing our ability to speak up, share, and allow ourselves to be seen and loved as we are. As the Founder of Naked Wellness, her goal is to guide you as you peel all those layers of resistance so you can turn yourself on for a life full of health, passion, power, freedom, joy and pleasure.

Based in New York City, Melody offers in-person and long-distance private sessions, and is really passionate about everyone really getting that they are absolutely perfect exactly as they are.

Find out more at nakedwellness.com

results.description:
Hello,

How do you trade for one hour and make daily sized gains?

Gapping stocks present an extraordinary profit opportunity for the educated trader and are an effective strategy for short term day traders, as well as longer term swing and core traders. Because stocks gap up and down every day, these opportunities occur frequently in the market. Many traders misunderstand the language of gaps and therefore miss these daily profit opportunities. Or worse, fall victim to the volatile nature of gaps. 

Join Michael Di Gioia, And Anmol Singh for this eye opening look into the professional world of Gap Trading. Learn effective techniques any trader can use to locate, evaluate and enter the best gap trading strategies. This workshop will also demystify many common misunderstandings about gaps and also provide clear insight into the psychology of the investors and speculators that create the best gaps opportunities.

Reserve your space now for this popular free workshop.

results.description:
Gotham Rock Choir, NYC's only Rock, Pop and Soul Choir (featured on NBC's "Today" with Kathie Lee and Hoda) is currently admitting new members!

Some helpful info:

--GRC runs in "cycles" (think terms or semesters). Our new cycle (Cycle 18) from from May-August, culminating in a concert at an off-Broadway theatre. Rehearsals are once a week, on Tuesday evenings from 7-9 PM. Please be sure that you're available for this day and time each week. 

-- GRC repertoire includes pop/rock songs from the 60s to today, made famous by artists such as Queen, The Beatles, Aretha Franklin, Bon Jovi, etc. Music-reading skills and previous choral experience are not required--all you need is a good ear, a passion for singing and an appreciation of pop/rock music. Many solo/small group opportunities for especially talented vocalists. 

--GRC is a performing choir. Each cycle includes a Cabaret Evening, where our members can perform their own favorite tunes as solos/duets/small groups, as well as a full choir concert held at the end of the Cycle. In addition, we may be doing some outside gigs. Previous outside gigs have included performances at Madison Square Garden, Barclay Center, the New York City Veteran's Day Parade, the Knitting Factory, the New York Stock Exchange Christmas Tree Lighting and Gotham Girls Roller Derby. We recently completed an as-yet unaired commercial for a famous beverage. 

See our website at GothamRockChoir.com for more info on joining GRC. 


***GRC rehearses in a school on the Lower East Side of Manhattan. Out of an abundance of caution for the students who attend there, we don't publish the address. Those who indicate that they plan on coming will receive an email with the exact address.***

results.description:
******PLEASE NOTE: TGI FRIDAYS CLOSES AT MIDNIGHT, SO LET'S ALL MAKE SURE TO BE OUT BEFORE THEN & NOT OVERSTAY OUR WELCOME.******

Come join us for our weekly Boardgaming Meetup.

We're a friendly group of gamers that play everything from Carcassonne & Ticket to Ride to Zombicide & heavier Eurogames! Everyone is welcome - all ages (must be over 21) but must be young at heart!

If you don't recognize the games, don't worry, everyone is happy to teach new players the rules.

We usually go for about 3-4 hours but people drop in any time and leave when they need to. If you're looking for a chill, fun way to spend a Tuesday night - come!

To support our gracious hosts, you MUST purchase a bite to eat or a few drinks (soda is fine!).

If anyone has a specific game they wish to play, feel free to ask. I am sure between us all, we should have it.

-------------------------------------

We always welcome new people & we're all here to have fun, but we do have a few ground rules that we ask everyone to be aware of:

- Treat everyone in the group with respect & do not discriminate. Some of us "trash talk" when we play, but it's all in good fun & in the spirit of gaming.

- This is a restaurant/bar so accidents are bound to happen. However, if you're responsible for ruining someone else's game by spilling a beverage or food on it, the right thing to do is to offer to purchase a new copy for them. Some of the games we bring are out of print so please treat every board game with respect.

- If a game is accidentally ruined by a staff member, everyone at the table should pitch in to buy a new one for the owner. More often than not, this comes to about $10/person or less, so in our opinion it isn't too much to ask for.

Thanks everyone & see you on Tuesday night!

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:40 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

results.description:
The recent earthquakes devastated Kumamoto and parts of southern Oita Prefecture. We are having a special earthquake relief fundraiser Shochu'sday for the disaster relief efforts in Kumamoto. $1 from every glass of shochu will be donated to disaster relief, we will have a raffle or some Kumamoto gifts, and a donation box to raise money. The money will be directed toward micro-relief efforts organized by a friend of Kampai! and Izakaya Hunders, Sansyo Nakamura, a well-known roku-go performer in Kumamoto. The wake of the first quake, Nakamura-san dropped everything and drove immediately to the most affected areas and began helping with rescue efforts. He's established a donation system for supplies and funds to which we hope to contribute.

Have you tried shochu? The traditional distilled spirit from Japan? It's more dry than sake and much easier to drink than other spirits. Goes great when paired with food.

Stephen Lyman, editor of http://kampai.us and shochu sommelier for SakaMai and other NYC Japanese restaurants, pours selected shochu each Tuesday around NYC. The location will be on the move so stay on top of each week here on meetup or by following Stephen on twitter @kampaius
results.name: Kumamoto Earthquake Relief Shochu'sday

Note: due to building security policies, attendees must RSVP 24 hours in advance (by Monday at 7:00PM), and must arrive at the event before 8:00PM on Tuesday.


Open Office Hours

Meeting every Tuesday evening, 7:00PM - 10:00PM

This month's host: Moat

Office hours is open to developers of any background and skill level. Newcomers to programming, Python, or NYC are all welcome, as well as experienced programmers and locals. The purpose of this event is to promote learning and community involvement within the NYC Python community.

Activities vary and may include (but are not limited to):

Informal tech talks: Topics can be anything related to Python or programming. Have a topic you'd like to see presented? Leave a comment starting with "Talk topic suggestion". Want to present? Message the organizers.

Technical discussions: Bring your code and / or questions about any relevant topic, and there will most likely be someone present who can help. For questions about a specific topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Need help with Django / Nginx / SQL". If you're able to help with a particular topic, please leave a comment in the form of "Can help with Flask / Apache / NoSQL".

Note: Recruiting and other solicitation are not allowed at these events. These are run for developers by developers. Behavior that makes others uncomfortable will not be tolerated, and offenders will be asked to leave.

Profuse thanks go to our sponsors for loaning us this space and providing refreshments.

Thank you, and see you Tuesday night!

results.description:
Relationships are central to living “the good life.” Most of us want to find ways to improve our relationships – including with partners, children, parents, other family, friends, people at work or in our communities. We can connect more empathically and authentically with the people in our lives through learning new skills and approaches in communication. 


The old joke about how to get to Carnegie Hall – “practice, practice, practice” – is also true of improving our ability to connect with other people in our lives. Most of us don’t unlearn old habits and learn new ones by going to a short class or reading a book! A communications practice group combines learning new skills with – yes – practicing them. 


We’ll learn more about how to both express our own needs in ways we’re more likely to be heard, and listen for the needs others are expressing — even when they’re speaking in ways we find it difficult to hear them. We’ll practice how to handle conflicts in our lives with comfort, courage and confidence, instead of avoiding conflicts or approaching them with force. Taking in feedback on our own attempts and giving feedback to others is part of the practice process.

 
Using ideas and methods based on the Nonviolent Communication™ (NVC) process developed by Marshall Rosenberg, we will learn to connect more authentically with those in our lives. Our group will be facilitated by Marty Epstein, facilitator of workshops and small groups with Nonviolent Communication™. 


All levels of learning and experience welcome. Books on Nonviolent Communication™ (NVC) will be available for purchase at the sessions for those who find that kind of study helpful. 


Suggested donation: $10-$25 per session. (If that’s a stretch for your budget, come anyway, and pay what you would enjoy contributing to help make these sessions possible.) 


When, where and how often: We’ll meet twice a month on Thursday evenings from 7 to 9 pm. We’ll meet at the Riverdale-Yonkers Society for Ethical Culture, which is sponsoring this program as part of our mission to inspire people to live more humanely, respecting the worth of every person. 


More information: email [masked] if you have questions or concerns you’d like answered. 


“All that has been integrated into NVC has been known for centuries about consciousness, language, communication skills, and use of power that enable us to maintain a perspective of empathy for ourselves and others, even under trying conditions.” — Marshall B. Rosenberg, Ph.D.

results.name: Practice Group: Communication for Connection

results.description:
WritersAnonymous is a writers social support group in New York City that was formerly located in Boston, MA. When the group was in Boston, the members all pledged to write something ambitious and potentially life changing, and that was such a rewarding experience. We even wrote and published a book called "Seven At The Sevens," which is for sale on WritersAnonymous.org and Amazon. Also, if you do a Google search for "Seven At The Sevens," it's the first item that pops up! While there, you can also find our NPR interview about the book. Although we ended up publishing a book, the group’s main mission was about keeping each other’s writing going and on track, and holding each writer accountable to his/her own self-imposed but ambitious goals. The main purpose of WritersAnonymous.org was not about publishing a book or to have each other’s writings critiqued, although that can and did happen.

Further, WritersAnonymous is about being inspired by your peers and inspiring others to find their own voices. It is about connecting with people who have a similar passion in life and who may understand you a little better because they have the same burning desire to tell a story in whatever written form it may emerge. It is also about forging new and lasting friendships in a supportive and encouraging environment during the often lonely and difficult creative writing process.

So, want to write and create something worthwhile, and also equally help others in their literary journeys? If so, join the group and let's begin!

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank  
M. [masked]

SoccerBeyond.com
[masked]


Feel free to like us on http://www.facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.

What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.

Meditation & breathing techniques are simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.

Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation
- Introduction to the Happiness Course and Sudarshan Kriya

“Benefits Reported by participants: - Reduced Stress & Increased Productivity - Increased Joy & Happiness - Enhanced Focus & Concentration - Improved Relationships”


Please RSVP to reserve your spot.

Note: This workshop is happening at a public place and there is a $10 admission fee.

results.description:
Come join your peers from Westchester County and the surrounding areas (hello Bronx, Connecticut, Orange and Putnam Counties) for our long-running lively, friendly facilitated discussion group. 

Our group is for ALL people (cisgender, transgender/gender non-conforming, and not-quite-sure people) as well as people who fall on different places along the monogamous to polyamorous dimension. As long as you inhabit the space between totally straight and totally gay somewhere (i.e., bisexual/non-monosexual queer, same-gender-loving, bicurious, questioning and bi-friendly). 

People who wish to understand their bisexual loved ones are also welcome.

This group is for people over 18. It is NOT a hook-up group. As the name says, we meet to talk about bisexual issues. People whose behavior makes other group members uncomfortable will be asked to leave. 

The group meets at The LOFT LGBT Community Center​ in White Plains, Westchester County, New York at 7:30 PM on the 2nd and 4th Tuesdays of every month. 

Even if you can't always make it to the group meetings in person, please join us on line, ask questions, chat, make some "net-friends" and keep up with what is happening in the Westchester County and surrounding bisexual community.
results.name: 2nd Tuesday Westchester Bisexual Discussion & Support Group

group.name: NYC's Bisexual, Non-Monosexual & Queer Meetup Group

results.description:
Join us for happy hour drinks with your techie Bushwick neighbors.


We trade project info, local goings-on, and thoughts on tech trends & culture. Meetup members have a variety of backgrounds and work in startups, arts, advertising, libraries, healthcare, and more. Some of us are new to the neighborhood, some have been here for many years, and others only wish they lived here.

Bring your laptop if you want, but there'll be far more talking and drinking than coding ツ

We're a low-key, friendly bunch. Choosing not to drink is fine. This is meant to be an inclusive space, and as long as we're respectful toward each other, everyone is welcome to join us.


PS. Scheduling didn't work out for an April meetup, but we'll be doubly happy to see you after 2 months!

results.description:
The Morris County Ski Club meets on the 2nd and 4th Tuesday of the month (the 2nd Tuesday only in June, July, August and December). Although our name says ski club, we are a year round activities and social club.

Our membership meetings and happy hours (AAF) are free to attend, and are always fun filled. Joining our club is very inexpensive; $50 for the first year and $35 per year afterwards.

The benefits of joining our club include access to members only events and trips, and discounts at most of the ski resorts in NY, PA, & VT, and local ski shops.

We foster an environment to meet new people, partake in various activities.  You can even suggest and/or run new events. If you come to one of our meetings you'll see how everyone is having a good time while learning about our events.

results.description:
Everyone said they had a good time, so let's do it again.

If you're  looking to get out and try something different, may I suggest coming out and playing Trivia Quiz.

We have had a very nice group of regulars that have been participating and are always looking for more people to join us.

It is free to play and there is no Meetup fee for this event. So give it a try. And if you're coming right from work The Garth Road Inn does serve food...very Reasonable and Good.

The Garth Road Inn has been serving the Scarsdale community for many years.  It's comfortable, affordable & centrally located.



**There will be a prize for the winning team!**

 
And there will also be bonus questions where a team can win stuff!!

Bring your friends or you can join other Meetup members to form a team.

It's a great opportunity to use all that information you have acquired over the years.  *_*


There will be an entertaining mix of questions!

Let's get those brain cells working & have some FUN!!!

There are 5 rounds
Questions are read off and each team writes down the answers....it's a team effort!

****All are welcome to attend!****

 
And there are always people from the Pub itself playing, we will be joining in on the FUN!

I look forward to seeing you there! *_*

results.description:
Learn & Sweat Bhangra sessions are for you 

- if you want to energize after a long work day

- if you love to sweat it out to heart pumping music

- if you think fitness doesn't mean lifting weights

- if you want to learn and groove to energetic Bhangra while burning serious cals.

The class begins with a warm up, high energy and high fun, this Bhangra class combines the strong, festive moves of traditional Bhangra dance with a follow-me fitness-class style. 

Each week participants also have the opportunity to learn a more in-depth piece of Bhangra choreography to a popular dance floor hit. 

If you love Bhangra music and you’re looking for a fun, unique way to keep fit, join us to sweat it out while partying to the beats.

No previous dance experience is necessary - just bring in your smile! Our Instructors are professional, friendly, and open minded. So come on in and let swag emerge!

Wear comfortable clothes and shoes.

The drop-in price is $20 and can be paid here on meetup, or head over to our website www.nycbhangra.com/nycbhangra/signup for other options to pay.

Checkout our other BEGINNER BHANGRA classes too!
results.name: Learn & Sweat BHANGRA

results.description:
Hi All!

Looking forwarding to our second meetup! If you missed the first meetup, it was a blast! A great meet and greet of our members, some very productive conversations about directions we would like this group to go in, and projects that we would like to start. We're very excited to move our ideas forward! Since then, I have been working hard to schedule events and sessions  for the upcoming meetups, and look forward to your input. We're grateful to be hosted again at the office of the Silicon Alley startup Abacus (https://www.abacus.com/).

For this upcoming meetup, we will:


1) continue to get to know our members, discuss projects, ideas and collaborations. 

2)  have a quick coding session for our website and collaboration pages - if you're interested in learning HTML, CSS, Angular.js and Firebase, I'll be introducing some of the projects that I have been putting together for this group through examples in the languages mentioned. If your unfamiliar with Angular.js and AngularFire, it's very powerful way to get a startup project up and running in hours. I'm looking forward to presenting some tools that I've built since our last meetup that should help in the collaborative process for our members. Several of our members also mentioned side projects and businesses that they have been working on. If you're interested in getting people involved and would like to present, please shout!

3) listen to presentations from several of our member, as well as other organizations interested in collaborating with and/or hiring black developers

If you're interested in presenting a project that  you're currently working on, or a business that you are recruiting for.. please drop me a line.

Looking forward to meeting with you all on Tuesday May 10th at 8pm.
results.how_to_find_us: 4th Floor- Buzz up, or call and I'll let you in (814-360-4086)
results.name: Coding and Presentation Session-Black Developers Meetup

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

results.description:
Deepen your connection to self and invite peace and happiness...


All are welcome to this healing circle of Reiki, meditation and pranayama (breathing).  New to Reiki, Pranayama or meditation?  Join us!  Interested in Reiki, Pranayama or meditation? Join us!  Already familiar with Reiki, Pranayama or meditation? Join us!  Reiki practitioner? Join us!  All are welcome! Come join this monthly Reiki, Meditation and Pranayama (Yogic breathing) Healing Circle and get reconnected with self and happiness.  This hour long healing circle will help you center, balance and invite deep peace into your life, while giving you tools to practice at home and on your own, until we meet again the following month.

The healing circle will begin with Reiki, followed by guided Pranayama (yogic breathing techniques that you will learn in the healing circle and can practice at home on your own until the next healing circle), followed by a Yoga centered guided meditation (centered around the Chakras, Dharma, Kharma, Ananda, transformation, finding balance, serenity, happiness, understanding your life's purpose and more) while you receive Reiki from an experienced Reiki Master, followed by more Reiki and Reiki sharing. This healing circle is for all who are interested in Reiki and meditation and is open to anyone who is interested in both giving and receiving Reiki.  All lineages are welcome.  There will be time for discussion and sharing.  No experience necessary.  Please dress comfortably and bring a yoga mat if you have one.  (Option to sit in a chair as well).  If you have a current yoga class package with Amanda you can use it towards this circle (just bring $5).  No yoga class package? No worries,  join us.  The entrance to the studio is on the side street facing Walgreens.  Questions?  Contact Amanda by email: [masked]  OR  text/ call (862) 621-9642....Namaste and we look forward to seeing you there :)
results.how_to_find_us: Brick building right next to Walgreens.  Entrance is on the side of the building facing Walgreens (not the door on Van Houten Ave)

results.description: MUSIC FROM FIVE CENTURIES, presented by Grammy-nominated concert violinist (and former Metropolitan Opera concertmaster) ELMIRA DARVAROVA and New York Philharmonic hornist HOWARD WALL brings a rich palette of masterpieces running the gamut from baroque to contemporary. Bach, Handel, Mozart and the younger generations - they all created exciting, vibrant music which was as fascinating then as it is now. This retrospective of many styles throughout the centuries (from baroque to jazz, blues and rock!!) is presented in duos for violin and horn, as well as in some solo pieces for each instrument. The artists have performed this program in Europe, Canada and throughout the United States. May 10, 2016 at 8:30 PM at Christ & St. Stephen's Church (120 W. 69th St.). FREE CONCERT (please note that the starting time is 8:30, not 8:00 PM)

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
This presentation will introduce usage of Apache Apex for Time Series & Data Ingestion Service by General Electric Internet of things Predix platform. Apache Apex is a native Hadoop data in motion platform that is being used by customers for both streaming as well as batch processing. Common use cases include ingestion into Hadoop, streaming analytics, ETL, database off-loads, alerts and monitoring, machine model scoring, etc.

Agenda: 

9:30pm - Predix overview and usage of Apache Apex 

10:15pm - Demo 

10:45pm - Q&A 

Abstract: Predix is an General Electric platform for Internet of Things. It helps users develop applications that connect industrial machines with people through data and analytics for better business outcomes. Predix offers a catalog of services that provide core capabilities required by industrial internet applications. We will deep dive into Predix Time Series and Data Ingestion services leveraging fast, scalable, highly performant, and fault tolerant capabilities of Apache Apex. 

Speakers: 

- Venkatesh Sivasubramanian, Sr Staff Software Engineer, GE Predix & Committer of Apache Apex 

- Pramod Immaneni, PPMC member of Apache Apex, and DataTorrent Architect 

Please register for General Electric - Internet of Things Predix Time Series & Data Ingestion Service using Apache Apex (Hadoop) on May 10, 2016 at: 

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/6272571274088007940

After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about joining the webinar.

@ApacheApex, meetup presentations, meetup recordings, download, Apache Apex releases, docs

This webcast is of an Hadoop Ingest and Transform meetup event in another city (2833 Junction Ave, #200, San Jose, CA), we are webcasting it enable other Big Data Ingesters to participate. If you are interested in helping organize (hosting, presenting, community leadership) Hadoop Ingest and Transform community, please email [masked]

results.description:
Are you looking for a way to grow your business? Would building relationships with professionals in other industries help your career?

If the answer is yes, you may want to consider visiting BNI Platinum Chapter 14! We meet each week to discuss our businesses and ways we may be able to help one another. Our members work in a wide array of industries including: financial services, real estate, legal services and many more!

Our members are focused on fostering relationships with one another which naturally lead to business referrals over time.

We welcome visitors to come see what we are all about!

Where: Ruth's Chris Steakhouse, Upstairs Board Room

148 W 51st St, 2nd Floor 

Between 6th and 7th Ave's

When: Wednesday mornings (7am-8:30am)

To see a list of our members and more about our chapter visit our web page at http://bit.ly/1MgHufC

*If you have been to a BNI chapter before, you know that we are only allowed to have one person per profession. If you see that no one fills that role, then you should be welcome to come! However, if you notice a potential conflict our members will work with you to see if our chapter would be a good place to visit, or if it would be better to visit another one of the BNI chapters.

If you are interested in visiting our chapter please reach out to Brett Sigler at [masked]

results.description:
Of all the innovations of man, it is hard to identify any one invention that has had more of a profound impact on our personal and professional lives. The origins and evolution of printing date back millennia, and yet we continue to innovate printing technology to this day.  Join us and listen to Jeff Bier, President of Cartridge World of Franklin Lakes, review the fascinating history of ink and the recycled ink and toner cartridge. Being traced back to 2500 BCE the Egyptians and Chinese used inks made from gums and glues, now modern digital inkjet printers can print up to 1000 pages per minute.  Although inkjet printers only appeared in the consumer market since the late 1980's, the challenge was  to come up with an affordable inkjet printer that would create high quality printouts.  The printers have come a long way since the 1980's with some of the first available priced at over $1000.  Now some manufactures are using thermal technology and others are making 3D printers.

Business owners, managers, and salespeople learn about each other's business and we share referrals.  First time attending? Enjoy breakfast on us!


Now, more than ever, business people need to network to stay in business. BNI Crossroads provides a positive, supportive, and structured environment to share ideas, contacts, and business referrals.

To avoid conflict, BNI chapters are allowed to have only one professional per profession - which mean that each of our members represents a specific category of business, effectively locking out the competition. With over 180,000 members worldwide, BNI is the largest business networking organization in the world. Last year alone, BNI generated 6.6 million referrals resulting in $8.6 billion dollars' worth of business for its members. We offer members the opportunity to share ideas, contacts and most importantly, business referrals.  Check out to see if your profession is currently taken at the following link: http://www.bninewjersey.com/chapterdetails.php?chapterId=1636&t=db3907f9cf60c71add464fcce0eddcfde87cc619cfe76e34c4aa5cb439f60347&name=BNI%20BNI%20Crossroads

If you or  someone you know  are looking to increase your sales and your sales force, we have plenty of leads to give out.  Check us out on May11th and enjoy  breakfast on us.

Email with questions or for more information.

results.description:
Professionals Exchanging Ideas and Referrals (PEIR), is an independent networking group of business professionals dedicated to the business growth and success of each of our members.  We meet in Berkeley Heights, NJ; our members represent businesses from the surrounding 15 mile radius. 

We are currently seeking new affiliates in business categories not represented by our present membership.  Note - we are not about handing out business cards, but rather we are about building trusted business relationships and sharing business acumen.  Think networking PLUS a mastermind  group.  Please "opt-out" if not serious about a long-term professional relationship.

• We generally meet on the 2nd and 4th Wednesday mornings of the month (8:30am to 10:00am) with periodic evening networking and social events.

• We expect regular attendance at meetings, but understand that business (and life) will occasionally “trump” your attendance. 

• We seek legitimate business referrals and opportunities, and recognize these do not arise weekly.  Members should be “givers” as well as “takers”. 

• Our semi-annual dues are utilized for networking and member-only presentations and development. 

The following business areas are currently represented:

• Insurance – Property, Casualty & Life

• Mortgage Broker - Residential & Commercial

• Financial Advisor – Planning, Investments, Life, LTD, & LTC, Employee Benefits

• Residential Realtor

• Attorney – Business /  Real Estate / Estate Planning

• Web Design / e-Marketing / Graphic Design

• Title Insurance – Residential/Commercial

• Property Restoration -  Fire, Water, Smoke

• Interior Design -  residential & commercial

Examples of businesses we are seeking to join us (not all-inclusive):

Architect - Banking -  Business Consultant – Commercial Lender - Commercial Realtor - Contractor - CPA/Tax Practitioner - Florist – Handyman – Health & Fitness Professionals - Photographer – Printer - Recruiter

results.description:
SAYSO! Sexual Assault Yearly Speak Out

http://nownyc.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/SAYSO-2016-Flyer-page-001-232x300.jpgSAYSO is a public event that raises awareness about sexual violence and celebrates healing and recovery. The event is spearheaded by Safe Horizon and supported by a planning committee of local rape crisis, criminal justice and community organizations.
When?: Wednesday May 11th 2016, 3:00 – 7:00 pm

Where?: Willoughby Plaza, Downtown Brooklyn (between Adams and Pearl Street)

What?: Survivor speakers, yoga, reiki, art, music, giveaways and more!

SAYSO! not only brings sexual violence into the bright light of day, it uniquely stresses a positive message: celebrating healing and recovery of survivors of sexual assault. On stage, there will be survivors telling their stories through spoken word, music and movement. Instructors in trauma-focused yoga and qi gong will lead participants in healing movements. Off stage, organizations from throughout Brooklyn will share information about rape crisis and other support services. There will also be participatory art projects and reiki sessions that passersby can join in.

SAYSO! was created by the NYC Alliance Against Sexual Assault as a city-wide event. Since 2010, Safe Horizon has partnered with other community organizations to host SAYSO! in Brooklyn. For more information on the history of the event, please click here.
results.name: SAYSO! Sexual Assault Yearly Speak Out

Cassi Alexandra is an independent documentary and portrait photographer whose work focuses on healing. She was born and raised in Florida where she graduated from Southeast Center of Photographic Studies and The University of Central Florida with Bachelor's in Photography. She began her career at The Orlando Sentinel in 2009, and quickly after became a contributor for The New York Times. After graduating she gained valuable experience at The Flint Journal in Michigan and then moved to Brooklyn, New York in March 2011. Some of her clients include The Wall Street Journal, The Washington Post, Bloomberg, OZY, ABC News and Harpers Magazine. CassiAlexandra.com

results.description:
Since Wendesdays in the Spring and Summer tend to be the most popular times. I am going to put in a few new  ground rules, so by RSVP-ing "yes" you hereby state you have read the following stipulations and will abide by them. We are setting the RSVP limit to 24 but do not be disheartened to join the "wait-list".  Those who RSVP"yes" are given a definite spot in the game if they arrive before or EXACTLY at 5:30. If you have been "wait-listed" and arrive before or at 5:30 and slots are open, you are given a spot. For those who do not RSVP and just show up must wait until 5:30pm and depending upon the order you showed up in and if the conditions mentioned above are not met, you will be allowed to play to make it so the teams are 13 each. If you have RSVP-ed and do not show up by the time we kick off and teams are full, you will be put aside.  for those who show up late, I will set some cones aside so you can play a smaller game against anyone else who shows up late. If you don't show up at all and RSVP-ed "yes", you will be warned 3 times and after that every time I see your name on RSVP you will be put as a "no". I know this is an issue for some of you but please understand in all fairness we don't want a game of 14 v 14, the field does not have enough space.

 If you have any gripes about this please message me and we can talk but in all likely-hood I will not make an exception.

results.description:
As Industry Professionals, as Students and as Educators, we need to understand what drives the modern vehicles that push marketing, media, content and branding. Today, the fuel is TECHNOLOGY and we need to be fluent in the extraordinary and transient phenomenon taking place each and every day.

Technology has become a ‘Lifestyle Brand’ and as it continues to re-define all that we do and how we do it, it becomes more and more challenging to remain agile, adaptable and relevant. What impact does this have on you and the way you manage your business, your workflow, your clients, your production and creative process?

The APC is proud to present an evening with a panel of Industry Experts that will create an open dialogue & conversation to learn just how we deal with the ‘touch points’ and the ‘pain points’ that Technology has created.

Kyla Jacobs, Global Business Development Director – 

TBWA/WW (Omnicom)

Bethany Mach, Executive Director/Global Client Lead – AMEX – 

Mindshare

April Ayala, Director Technical Operations – 

Spies & Assassins (K&B)

Paul Nicholson, SVP Production & Technology – 

Showtime Networks, Inc.

-Panel to be Moderated by Jimmy Levin, Career Coach & Talent Acquisition Specialist at – Job Search Therapy

Date: Thursday April 28, 2016

Time: 5:30PM

YOU MUST REGISTER FOR THIS EVENT HERE: http://www.apc-nyc.org

results.description:
￼“Collective Song Club”   Meets every other Wednesday – 5:30-8:30PM

The "Collective Song Club” will begin on October 14th and follow every other Wednesday evening (skipping the night before Thanksgiving).

Location: Planet Studio NYC (www.planetstudionyc.com) 

244 West 54th Street between Broadway and 8th Avenue in Suite 800B on the 8th floor. It will begin at 5:30PM so those heading home from work can stop in without it getting too late. Each session will end promptly at 8:30pm when the studio will go back into record mode for the evening schedule. Drop in at anytime up until 7:30pm during each session. You can’t even really be late! Leave when you like!


The goal of the Collective Song Club is to create a nurturing space for songwriters, artists and producers to present their works in progress, completed songs and productions as well as ask questions about the music business. Vetting songs about to be recorded will give you one more moment of clarity and reflection before you spend energy and dollars on your recording. Song tempos and keys can be discussed as well as best possible producers and vocalists for your project. The studio will have guitars and a keyboard available so no need to feel you have to bring your own. The studio can playback a CD, your iPhone or Android, MP3 player, or connect via the internet to your website or Dropbox. Bring a few lyric sheets of the song you would like to share. The entire evening is about forming a creative community that enhances your art and helps you grow as a songwriter.


There will be no advance payment or sign-up necessary. Each session will cost $20 per person payable at the door as we begin. The studio has a “Square” reader so you can put it on your debit / credit card for $22 with the additional sum to cover the handling charge. Come one week or skip a session - feeling inspired - come on down - feeling tired or have a change of plans - there’s no need to feel like you have to be there. Sessions might be crowded - some might be just a few people - or you!


There are no requirements other than to become a full member of the Collective. The annual membership fee until the end of 2015 is only $35. This membership entitles you to participate in all the Collective workshops as well as perform a song (or have your song performed) in our quarterly Member Benefit Showcases held at the Bitter End. It's easy to become a member - go to www.newyorksongwriterscollective.com and look for "Sign Up/Sign In" in he top right corner of the webpage!


The CSC is an experiment that will hopefully find a place and grow with the necessary changes and additions as it is established. Could it happen every week save for special days and holidays? Could special guests from the industry drop in that would be announced shortly before a session on the Collective website? We shall see!
￼￼
results.name: The "Collective Song Club" presented by the New York Songwriters Collective

results.description:
Do you think you know the corner of Wall and Broad Streets? Even if you go past it every day on your way to work, you may not be familiar with the history of one of the oldest locations in New York City, dating all the way back to Dutch Colonial days. 

Join fellow NYC Explorers for a short tour. It's not really a walking tour, because we won't go far from the starting point. We'll hang around the corner of Broad and Wall for 20-30 minutes. That's just enough time to gather some fun facts about this famous location. 

This Meetup is part of our On This Corner series. It's a short, after-work gathering to see New York with fresh eyes and to get together with new and old friends. Maybe you'll want to continue the conversation over drinks or dinner (on your own; not part of this event).
results.how_to_find_us: Look for a group on the steps of Federal Hall, near the statue.

results.description:
First Speakers: Decision Fish: Scalable Decision Support Tools for Consumers

Join us for an interactive discussion about financial decision making. Participants will share a little about how they make decisions: especially the systemic and behavioral hurdles. We’ll explore how decision science and behavioral economics can explain and lower these hurdles. Next, we’ll share Decision Fish’s unique approach to helping people make high-stakes decisions and show you our latest prototype.

About Decision Fish

We formed Decision Fish because we recognize that when people make financial decisions, they often do this with big financial institutions whose interest is making money, not necessarily helping people do the right thing. It's an unfair fight because companies have more people, money, information and  other resources. This leads to mistrust and mistakes.  Decision Fish’s mission is to help people make better financial decisions step-by-step with simple and independent online decision support tools that leverage the founder's experience and techniques from his 26-year Wall Street career. It's like TurboTax® for decision-making.

Brett Whysel is a Decision Analyst, Lecturer and Fintech Social Entrepreneur with 26 Years of Wall Street experience. Brett helps individuals and institutions make better decisions by applying the state-of-the-art in decision science, behavioral economics, finance and philosophy. He is developing online and mobile tools to aid financial decision-making with measurable individual and social benefits. He also serve as an analytical consultant, designing robust decision support frameworks and models. He lectures, speaks publicly and blogs on these topics at www.decisionfish.com. His work is informed by 26 years’ experience working with large nonprofits, municipalities and other institutions on borrowing, financing, investing and risk management. We are seeking clients, partners, advisors and beta testers who want to make (or help others make) high-stakes decisions with confidence.

Noreen Whysel is a User Experience Researcher based in New York City. She is the COO/UX Director for Decision Fish. She serves on several technical committees and organizations, including the board of GISMO, a NYC regional chapter of the NY State GIS Association, the UX Committee of the Identity Ecosystem Working Group and advisor to the Brooklyn SBDC Technology Transfer Days program. She has worked in an operations capacity for for many years for technical communities including the OWASP Foundation and the Information Architecture Institute, as well as other small businesses and nonprofits. Noreen has spoken frequently on topics in information architecture, emergency management, and open data. Noreen holds a BA in Psychology from Columbia University and a MSLIS from Pratt Institute.

Second Speaker:  Zalyia L. Grillet UX from My Eyes: How Parkinson’s Disease is Shaping My Design Skills. 

Zalyia Grillet is a freelance UX Designer currently holding the roles of UX Designer for ScriptEd Freelance Developer Shop and the UX Teacher’s Assistant for 2020 Shift. As a young Afro-Caribbean millennial, Zalyia has always had an affinity for solving problems and using cross-cultured experiences to do it. 

From studying Ethnomusicology, to starting her own greeting cards business, to pursuing Experience Design, her thought process has grown to be very unique to understanding and aligning with people’s culture, emotions and ideologies. With focuses such as multicultural design and accessibility, Zalyia has worked with helping entrepreneurs and companies to redesign their digital and physical user experiences. 

She is also the co-founder of an upcoming organization entitled UX Diaspora (UXD). UXD is a digital migration of people of color in UX to educate, connect and inspire one another around the world. When she not doing UX, she spends time with her family as well as volunteers her time with multiple non profit organizations. 

Participating Meetups:

Information Architecture Meetup: http://www.meetup.com/information_architecture/

Semiotics Web Meetup: http://www.meetup.com/SemioticsWeb/

OWASP Brooklyn Meetup: http://www.meetup.com/OWASP-Brooklyn/
results.name: Meetup Mashup: Decision Fish & UX Stories

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded clubs, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Playwright Irish Pub on West 35th at 5th in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  This Playwright location is steps away from Herald Square and in between Penn Station and Grand Central. 

We have the cozy 2nd floor fireplace room reserved for our groups. Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 7:30pm $5 beer, house wine and house mixed drinks

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event.

-Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission-Fun and friendly bar staff

-A full menu available  

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect: 60-100 people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Any train to Penn Station Herald Square/ Grand Central

Why should I come? To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!
results.name: New Yorks Friendliest After Work & New Members Welcome Party - FREE

results.description:
Join us on Wed, May 11th for something a little different. Instead of looking at a specific SQL Server technology, we will look at data modeling techniques.  Because as we all know, if the data model isn't correct, all the technology in the world won't help!

Bridging the Gap With Business Data Objects


Abstract: When data modeling first evolved as a discipline, the primary focus was to specify the definition and format of data, enabling the development of information systems. As corporate environments have become very complex, data architecture has shifted to provide integration between and across many systems, as well as a foundation for data warehouses, business intelligence, and analytics. This session discusses the concept of business data objects (BDOs), and how they can add clarity as a logical and physical modeling construct, through to physical implementation in architectural frameworks, and serve as a common basis to facilitate discussion of real-world concepts with business stakeholders.


Idera will be providing the refreshments for this meeting. (And possibly also some raffle items / giveaways). 

BIO: Ron Huizenga has over 30 years of experience as an IT executive and consultant in Enterprise Data Architecture, Governance, Business Process Reengineering and Improvement, Program/Project Management, Software Development and Business Management. His experience spans multiple industries including manufacturing, supply chain, pipelines, natural resources, retail, health care, insurance, and transportation
results.name: Data Modeling Techniques - Bridging the Gap With Business Data Objects

results.description:
***You must RSVP via Eventbrite. RSVPs on Meetup.com will not grant you access to our event. Please purchase your ticket at Eventbrite.*** 

Conversations is a series of events focused on open discussions on the changing new media landscape. Our events will feature panels with insights from the most respected news organizations, the newest disruptive publishers, and tech and media thought leaders. Through conversations, let’s work to transform media together. 

As we approach the one-year anniversary of the launch of Facebook's Instant Articles, and more publishers look to off-platform distribution to find their audiences through Facebook, Google AMP, Apple News, Snapchat and beyond, what impact have we seen? How are publishers adapting to the new reality? An expert panel, moderated by Emily Bell (Director, Tow Center for Digital Journalism at Columbia University) shares its experience and insight into how this new relationship is changing newsrooms and business models.

MODERATOR:

* Emily Bell (Director, Tow Center for Digital Journalism at Columbia University)

PANELISTS:

* Samantha Barry (Head of Social Media & Sr. Director of Strategy, CNN)
* Allison Lucas (General Counsel, BuzzFeed) 
* Choire Sicha (Director of Partner Platforms, Vox Media) 
* Carla Zanoni (Executive Emerging Media Editor, Audience Development, Wall Street Journal)

SCHEDULE: 

6:00-6:30: Registration / Networking Reception 
6:30-7:30: Panel discussion and Q&A 
7:30-8:30: Networking Reception 

RSVP for the event here: http://www.nydn.us/convos

For 25% off of the admission price, members of this Meetup group may use the discount code: MEETUPFRIEND 

Presented by the Daily News Innovation Lab (http://www.nydn.us/lab).

***You must RSVP via Eventbrite. RSVPs on Meetup.com will not grant you access to our event. Please purchase your ticket at Eventbrite.***
results.how_to_find_us: http://nydn.us/convos
results.name: Conversations: "Platforms as Publishers: Where Are We Now?"

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: $24 Day­pass during the meetup. For monthly/yearly membership, the Initiation Fee (currently $99) is waived (no discount on monthly dues, for yearly membership please inquire with the Cliffs for discount). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101/Top-rope basic class is offered 50% Off. Must sign­up and pay in advance by calling the Cliffs at 718­729­76125.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
It's time to get kicking. Kick your neighbor. Kick your brother. Kick the big red ball. Just don't kick your dog. Game. On.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of kickball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game with rules similar to baseball -- except instead of using a bat to hit a little ball, you use your feet to kick a ball about 10x the size of a baseball. Kick the ball, run to the base, avoid getting your ball caught mid-air or yourself tagged out. Easy. And no athletic skill is necessary, just the ability to kick! Go out and practice now to get ready. Kick the postman when he delivers your bills. Kick that neighbor who won't turn down his stereo. Just get kicking!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/64476072/Kickball%20Rules.pdf.</a>

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be kicking and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.
results.name: Urban Athletics: Kickball for Grownups (Co-ed)

group.name: I wanted to do that...Just not alone!!

results.description:
How to NOT OverSpend on my Marketing Budget 

Paid Ad Channels, Strategies, Tactics, Tips and Tricks

Hey New York eCommerce / Magento Meetup Fans,

Have you ever had questions about paid ads? Always wondering what works and what doesn't?  Are you always trying to figure out a way to track everything? 

This month we have Jeremy Kagan of Pricing Engine, giving us the ins and outs of paid ads. 

The meetup will be an overview of:

- Shopping ads (Google and Amazon)

- Search ads (Google and Bing)

- Remarketing/Display

- Social Ads (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Pinterest)

- Video

- Thoughts on tracking

A discussion of customer acquisition through paid channels and the various options available.  Pricing Engine will bring some team members who can answer those pesky eCommerce questions.

A little information about Jeremy Kagan

Jeremy is the founder and CEO of Pricing Engine and is also a Professor at Columbia Business School, where he teaches graduate and executive education classes in Digital Marketing Strategy. His book “Digital Marketing: Strategy and Tactics”, the first textbook for digital marketing, will be published in 2017.

Jeremy has been a strategy consultant and corporate trainer in the digital media industry, where his clients include companies in content, services, and e-commerce, as well as traditional companies needing digital media expertise.  Jeremy previously worked at Sony Music Entertainment in the Global Digital Business, where he was the Vice President of Global Account Management, working with large partners such as Nokia and Sony Ericsson.  Before this, he was Vice President/Director of Strategy and Customer Insight for Publicis Modem, a leading digital advertising agency, where Jeremy headed research and innovation out of the New York office.

Linkedin Profile: www.linkedin.com/in/jeremykagan/

About Pricing Engine

Pricing Engine, a digital marketing platform that enables small businesses to benchmark, optimizes and expands their search and social advertising campaigns.  The company works through channel partners like local media companies, digital service providers, and small agencies to provide ‘productized’ managed ad packages to very small businesses (VSB’s) – the “Main Street” businesses – fully managed by professionals and at an affordable price point.  Pricing Engine’s proprietary data sets are used for monitoring and benchmarking users with easy-to-understand “Report Cards”.  The company is a Google, Bing, Facebook, and Twitter agency and API partner with almost 20,000 users.

http://www.pricingengine.com/

results.description:
"Learning From Hackers to Develop An Offensive Security Framework"

Despite more than $70B annual spending in cyber security solutions, organizations continue to face an uphill battle answering the question of whether they are secure, understanding where to prioritize their resources and validating their security controls. What is needed is a better process to inform defense-- one that understands how a potential attacker views, prioritizes and targets an infrastructure and then how they reach their ultimate target.  Using real-world case studies, we will share the breach methods that hackers are using and discuss how to develop an offensive security framework that complements your defensive security mechanisms

Itzik Kotler is CTO and Co-Founder of SafeBreach. Itzik has more than a decade of experience researching and working in the computer security space. He is a recognized industry speaker, having spoken at DEFCON, Black Hat USA, Hack In The Box, RSA Europe, CCC and H2HC. Prior to founding SafeBreach, Itzik served as CTO at Security-Art, an information security consulting firm, and before that he was SOC Team Leader at Radware. (NASDQ: RDWR).


"Next Generation Data Loss Prevention – Complementing your DLP with Automated Data Classification & Labeling"


Tom Frommack  CEO, Watchful Software

Tom is presently the CEO of Watchful Software, a Data-Classification & Labeling/InfoSec software company headquartered in New York with customers all over the world. He is also a Principal at two Cyber Security Venture Capital firms: Hudson Fairfax Group and Option3 Ventures.


"Using Machine Learning To Secure Mobility"

Faiyaz Desai Director, Enterprise Engineering, Lookout

As Director of Enterprise Sales Engineering at Lookout, Faiyaz is responsible for driving strategy and technology adoption within the Fortune 500. Previously, he was the Director of Sales Engineering for global accounts at Avaya.  Faiyaz has held various technical roles at Avaya and Touchbase- a major networking and communications integrator.  He received his Bachelor of Engineering degree from South Gujarat University.  Faiyaz has built organizations, influenced product roadmap, and attained trusted advisor status with many of the world’s most prestigious brands.
results.name: May New York Information Security Meetup

Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded clubs, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Playwright Irish Pub on West 35th at 5th in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  This Playwright location is steps away from Herald Square and in between Penn Station and Grand Central. 

We have the cozy 2nd floor fireplace room reserved for our groups. Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 7:30pm $5 beer, house wine and house mixed drinks

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event.

-Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission-Fun and friendly bar staff

-A full menu available  

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect: 60-100 people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Any train to Penn Station Herald Square/ Grand Central

Why should I come? To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!
results.name: New Yorks Friendliest After Work & New Members Welcome Party - FREE

Join AbelCine, in partnership with American Photographic Artists (APA), for a special evening event in NY, Capturing Motion: Introducing Movement to Your Storytelling Process on May 11, 2016. Seats are still available!

During this special event on May 11, you will hear from three professionals who have successfully transitioned to working in motion alongside their traditional stills work. They will discuss all aspects of their experience from why they decided to incorporate motion into their body of work, to what challenges they faced when first starting out and how they market themselves in a new industry.
