results.description:
So I’ve done 25 of these wine dinners over the past two years.  I’ve covered some of the most interesting winemaking regions of the world.  But has anyone noticed that a certain region has been missing?  Yes, California.  So I figured it was time to finally change that.  But since I like to expose people to wines they might be unfamiliar with, it won’t be Napa or Sonoma.  Let’s go to Paso Robles.

Paso Robles, on California’s Central Coast, is considered a winemaking frontier.  Sprawling and hot, not as exclusive as Napa.  It’s drawn an unpretentious sort of winemaker who doesn’t mind being a little different.  And if you want to sound like a local, don’t give the area’s name a fancy Spanish pronunciation.  It’s “Paso Row-Bulls.”

Winemaking here dates back to the end of the 18th century, when Spanish missionaries planted the Mission grape.  Commercial winemaking started in the 1880s, with Zinfandel vines that were suited to the hot climate.  Paso Robles remained a winemaking backwater until at least 1990, when there were just 20 wineries, but that number has grown to over 200 today.  Zinfandel has remained a hallmark Paso grape, but Cabernet Sauvignon is now the most planted variety, and the so-called Rhône Rangers, winemakers specializing in the grapes of France’s Rhône Valley, have produced excellent results in Paso Robles.  More than 40 varieties are grown in the Paso AVA, including some Italian grapes little seen outside Italy. 

Paso Robles is not far from the Pacific Ocean, but the Santa Lucia mountain range isolates it from coastal influences, so the climate is quite continental, with hot days and cool nights.  Some narrow river valleys, called the Templeton Gap, allow in some coastal breezes and provide some climate variation.  For a long time, Paso Robles was a large, undivided AVA, but 11 new sub-appellations have been created to acknowledge variations in climate, altitude, and soil types. 

We’ll be trying a range of wines that show what Paso Robles is capable of, made by well-established, prestigious winemakers as well as smaller boutique wineries.  Two whites: one a classic southern Rhône blend of Viognier, Marsanne, Roussanne, and Grenache Blanc; and a Vermentino, widely grown in northwest Italy and southern France (where it is called Rolle).  A well-priced Cabernet.  An Aglianico that evokes southern Italy in California.  And wines from three major producers: a Turley Zinfandel, made from one of the oldest Zinfandel vineyards in California; a classic Rhône-style red blend by Tablas Creek, which was founded by the Perrin family of Châteauneuf-du-Pape fame; and a hybrid Rhône/Bordeaux-style blend (combining Syrah with Cabernet and Petit Verdot) by L’Aventure, founded by a French winemaker who felt too limited by French AOC laws and now makes some of the best wines on the Central Coast. 

We’ll be returning to Plates in Larchmont, which encourages BYOB on Wednesday.

http://platesonthepark.com/

2013 Sans Liege Côtes du Coast  $30 

Wine Advocate 92 – A smoking blend of 49% Viognier, 27% Roussanne, 15% Grenache Blanc and the rest Marsanne, the 2013 Côtes du Coast offers terrific richness and depth in its lemon curd, buttered citrus and honeycomb-styled bouquet. Medium to full-bodied and voluptuous on the palate, it nevertheless stays nicely focused and clean, with notable purity and freshness on the finish. Aged 18 months in 20% new French oak (with some in stainless steel), it's a food-friendly, beautifully made white that's well worth a multi-bottle purchase.

2014 Giornata Wines Vermentino  $24 

Jancis Robinson 16/20 – Whole-cluster pressed. All stainless-steel tank and drum. Ambient yeast. Fresh, spiced aromatics. Notes of mixed tropical fruit with no sweetness, light wax and pepper accents. Spry, lively and serious. Nice focus with a sense of richness without heaviness.

2014 Daou Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon  $24 

Wine Advocate 91-93 – The 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon is loaded with notions of black raspberry, cassis, spice and licorice. More textured, voluptuous, layered and concentrated than all of the previous vintages, it will have an easy 10-15 years of longevity.

2011 Ryme Cellars Aglianico Luna Matta Vineyard  $42 

Jancis Robinson 17/20 – Delicious perfumed and dark fruit palate with a sense of freshness and lightness accented by gunmetal and iron. Grippy, slightly tenacious tannin characteristic of the variety that becomes supple alongside food. This is a wine meant to be enjoyed with a meal. Nicely executed.

2013 Turley Wine Cellars Zinfandel Ueberroth Vineyard  $49 

Wine Advocate 95 – Consistently spectacular in the capable, meticulous winemaking hands at Turley Cellars, the 2013 Zinfandel Ueberroth Vineyard comes from one of the oldest Zinfandel vineyards in California (planted in 1885). The ungrafted, head-trained vines from steep limestone slopes just down the road from Justin Smith’s Saxum Winery have produced a monster and a fascinating Zinfandel in 2013. Coming in at 15.8% alcohol, the wine displays deep black raspberry and black cherry fruit, hints of crushed rock, and fresh acidity that is no doubt attributable to the pH of the limestone soils. The wine, in spite of its relatively lofty alcohol, comes across as remarkably elegant, concentrated, and stunningly proportioned. This full-bodied tour de force in Zinfandel winemaking should drink well for a decade or more.

2011 L'Aventure Winery Optimus  $50 

Wine Advocate 94 – The 2011 Optimus is a rocking value that gives more than a glimpse into the style and quality of this estate. A blend of 50% Syrah, 33% Cabernet Sauvignon and 17% Petit Verdot and spending 14 months in 70% new French oak, it delivers fantastic black and blue fruits, tobacco, violets and cedar aromas and flavors to go with a full-bodied, supple and beautifully polished mouthfeel that stays fresh and lively. Gorgeous all around, it will drink nicely through 2021, if not longer. Drink now-2021.

2012 Tablas Creek Esprit de Tablas  $58 

A Galloni 93-95 – A big, explosive wine, the 2012 Esprit de Tablas is warm and ample on the palate, very much in the style of the year, yet there is plenty of power lying in reserve. In 2012, Syrah plays a larger role than in both the 2010 and 2011, which is felt in the wine’s broad, expansive personality. This is going to be a fascinating Esprit to follow over the coming years.

Wine Advocate 92 – Made from 40% Mourvedre, 30% Syrah, 21% Grenache and the balance Counoise, the 2012 Esprit de Tablas is an elegant, supple and medium to full-bodied red that excels on is lively pure texture and overall elegant personality. Revealing perfumed notes of sweet cherries, black raspberries, ground herbs and underbrush, this moderately concentrated, balanced and overall pretty Paso Robles red will evolve nicely through 2022.
results.name: Paso Robles

Hey team:

It was great getting together to discuss Chapter 1! For this next meetup, we will be continuing our journey through the Artist's Way and will be discussing both Chapters 2 and 3:Recovering a Sense of Identity and Recovering A Sense of Power

For this next Meetup, be ready to discuss: 

• Chapters 2 and 3 - main themes.

• How your Morning Pages and Artist’s Dates are going.

• How your affirmations are going.

• What different perspectives are you getting from doing the exercises?

• Favorite exercise? 

• Any big breakthroughs?


Also feel free to work through whatever exercises you prefer, but please try to do Exercise 8 from Chapter 2: Ten tiny changes to make in our lives and come ready to discuss.


Looking forward to discussing these chapters! We made an email list to hold each other accountable — please private message me with your email if you would like to join the list.


(P.S. - if you don’t get around to reading the chapters and exercises, but would still like to participate and talk about the book, please join us for this next Meetup!).

results.description: Come to our purely positive séance where we encourage mystics, psychics, mediums and all people to enhance their spiritual awareness in a safe and empowering environment. All of our séance conductors are highly trained and renowned mediums. Whether you are looking to connect with a loved one who has recently passed or to receive messages from spirit, our group offers a warm and friendly environment to all who are interested. Before each séance we begin our group with a 15 minute lesson on psychic development, covering topics from psychic impressions to spirit communication. We then begin our séance with a nondenominational prayer of protection and lead a guided visual mediation. After the meditation each person who attends will receive a message from one of our highly trained séance conductors. All participants are guaranteed to receive a message. Our group meets for approximately 2 hours. The purpose of our séance is to communicate directly with spirit and to form an open and inviting spiritual community in New York City Our meeting times are every other Wednesday Night at 7:00pm and our fee is $20. Please be timely, because we do not open our doors once we begin our meditation (for obvious reasons :). For legal purposes it is understood that our group and the messages given at our séances are for entertainment purposes only.
results.name: Seance in The City Meetup

results.description:
The Psychedelic Program at the Center for Optimal Living will be hosting a public group focusing on psychedelic integration.
Following the success of our ongoing monthly groups held at The New School, we are happy to offer a new opportunity for individuals to share about their experiences with psychedelics in a safe, supportive setting.
The group will begin with a brief introduction and guided meditation by Katherine MacLean, PhD (Director of the Psychedelic Program), followed by facilitated discussion and spontaneous sharing. We will focus on best practices for implementing positive life changes and reducing potential harms associated with psychedelic use.
If you have had a personal psychedelic experience, whether it was intensely positive or challenging and confusing, this is a fantastic opportunity to share your story and learn from others about how to integrate the lessons from these experiences into your daily life. The group is also open to people who have never had a personal experience with psychedelics. Please note that in keeping with the law and out of respect for your fellow group members, we strongly discourage the active use of psychedelics or other psychoactive drugs during group meetings. Information about The Psychedelic Program, including monthly groups, individual psychotherapy, and educational and training events, can be found at www.psychedelicprogram.com

Tickets: $20 https://psychedelicintegration.splashthat.com/

https://www.facebook.com/events/548882475294690/
results.name: Psychedelic Integration: Weaving the Lessons into Your Daily Life

results.description:
We'll meet at the Main Street School parking lot for a loop run to Tarrytown and back. This is a lovely "run in the dark" with Hudson River views. Total distance is just over 4 miles. 

Details about the run

Route: We’ll leave promptly at 7pm from the Main Street School parking lot. We'll head north on the Old Croton Aqueduct Trail, and turn left (west) at the Lyndhurst greenhouses to connect to the Riverwalk. At the Riverwalk we'll continue north to Van Wart Ave, before turning right (east) to return to Broadway for the run back to Irvington. A route map is available here. 

Special equipment: Headlamp or small flashlight (winter months)

Modifications for a shorter/slower-paced run: At various points runners can divert east toward Broadway and head back to Irvington.

Water/Bag Storage: There are no water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. If the weather is warm, I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.


Location: Main Street School parking lot (101 Main St)

Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.
results.name: Irvington to Tarrytown Loop

results.description:
We all have a need to feel accepted and loved unconditionally. If your parents were not loved unconditionally, they each developed an inner child which felt unloved. This made it hard for your parents to love you the way you wanted and needed to be loved. When you were not loved unconditionally, you too developed an inner child which felt unloved.

Your needy inner child, which feels unloved, is locked into the past. It feels that the past has been difficult and painful and is afraid that the future will be the same way. It is afraid and doesn’t feel worthy.

The thoughts and beliefs of your needy inner child are based on fear, hurt and remorse. There are thoughts of self-recrimination and replaying of old programs of parental disapproval, which now manifest as self-judgment. The underlying message of your needy inner child is, “Life is a struggle." Your needy inner child believes it is a victim of the world and carries an underlying feeling of hopelessness and helplessness.

The way out of this needy inner child rut is first to gain a sense of detachment, which allows you to observe your needy inner child’s thought system in action. Whenever there is a feeling of fear or tension in your body, you can know that there is an underlying attachment or identification with a needy inner child belief system.

The first step towards healing your needy inner child is through non-judgmental observing. Observing with non-judgment and love allows you the freedom, detachment and the perspective which fosters deep healing. As you learn to be compassionate and understanding of your inner child, the journey to healing begins. If this is done consistently, the needy inner child begins to feel safe and eventually sees a new direction. As you continue this path of observing your needy inner child with love, a sense of hope that the past need not be repeated begins to emerge and a transformation occurs. You will feel more relaxed and will have a sense of trust that you are safe and loved.

In this 8-week Healing Inner Child Program that is guided by a trained facilitator, you will learn how to give your needy inner child the nurturing attention it has always wanted. As you participate in the Healing Inner Child Program, you will learn to pay attention to what your needy inner child says, thinks, feels and how it behaves. You will learn to observe it with detachment and compassion, realizing you can transform and heal it with the help of your Higher Self.

In the supportive environment of a group or one on one, you will learn that you are not alone and have a choice to perceive your situation differently. The shared experiences and activities provide a rich opportunity to release limiting fears and bring more unconditional love into your life.

Included is a workbook with eight lessons that can be a journal of your inner child healing. Weekly focus cards and a guided audio meditation (a male & female voice version) will help you bring your inner child issues to your Higher Self for transformation. What you learn can apply to any relationship — your spouse, significant other, co-worker, friend or relative.

The topics of the 8 weekly sessions are:

Nurturing Your Inner Child — Becoming Your Needy Inner Child's Nurturing ParentThe Inner Critical Parent — Replacing Self-Criticism with Self-NurturingInner Child Baggage — Recognizing & Healing Self-Destructive ThoughtsConnecting with Higher Self — Learning to Connect Your Inner Child with Inner WisdomTransforming Fear — Rocognizing Needy Inner Child Cries for LoveStop, Look & Listen — Paying Attention to Who Is in ChargeHealing Relationships — Seeing Through the Needy Inner Child to Light EssenceSimple, Uncomplicated Love — Expanding Your Identity to Being Love
results.name: Healing Inner Child Workshop

Join us for the launch of a brand new season of D&D Encounters! Ravenloft, the classic D&D setting of gothic horror, rises from the grave as we begin with the exclusive Adventure’s League adventures leading up to Death House. This is a 5th Edition Dungeons & Dragons game for 6 players. Reserving a seat is no charge, but players pay a $10 door fee. Adventurer’s League passes can be purchases for $80, which cover 10 sessions of play.

In order to RSVP, players must go to our registration page and sign up for a specific table. Be sure to read the description to find out if the table matches your experience level! Be warned that signing up on this Meetup page does NOT guarantee a player a spot at a table.

Register here: bstrat.eventsmart.com

Play begins around 7:30pm and ends at 10:30pm. Late arrivals and early exits should try to notify their DM in advance, but are rarely a problem.

We will be creating characters during this first session and then running a three-week introduction to the game, a perfect opportunity for players who are looking to begin a fresh new campaign. Players are welcome to bring ideas for their character, or even build a 1st level character in advance and help the newer members. Character sheets, pencils, paper, dice, miniatures, and battlemaps are all provided by the store; copies of rulebooks are available to borrow, but are limited by supply. Players are welcome to bring their own gaming supplies as well as snacks and beverages.

Encounters welcomes brand-new players every week, so don’t hesitate to jump into one of our Beginner-level tables with no prior RPG experience!

A little on the later side to schedule this up but its a meetup so I hope everyone can make it. This months meetup will be around Chef Cookbook Development by John Bellone. John Bellone currently runs the Platform Engineering team @ Bloomberg and was tasked with rolling Chef out globally within all aspects of the Bloomberg infrastructure. As you can imagine rolling out to a company of this size you will need a ton of standards and best practices on how/what/who cookbooks should be doing and looking in the environment. During this talk John will dive through his process for proper Chef Cookbook Development and how he is training all of the members of the Bloomberg org on howto use Chef. John is also a avid contributor to OSS projects but most recently has been spending a large amount of time making reusable cookbooks for the world to consume. You can view some of John's work at github.com/bloomberg and github.com/johnbellone. Please be sure to stop by and give a listen to his talk. Plus its on hump day and we have free food and beer. You can't beat that!!! Thanks!

results.description:
Topic:  Spark for Reactive Machine Learning: Building Intelligent Agents at Scale

Presenter: Jeff Smith, Data Engineering Lead - x.ai


Abstract: If you want to build an intelligent agent, the first thing that you're going to need is a lot of data. Then, the second thing that you're going to need is some way to process all that data. Enter Apache Spark, the biggest thing to happen to big data since Hadoop MapReduce. With Spark, its machine learning libraries, and related projects, you can learn machine learning models over arbitrarily-sized datasets.


This talk will be a technical exploration of different aspects of building a large scale machine learning system like an intelligent agent. The focus will be on using Spark and related tools to build machine learning systems that stay responsive in the face of errors or changes in scale. These sorts of considerations are crucial for any team looking to build an agent who is expected to be always available and always learning. You can build just a truly reactive system to support an intelligent agent. This talk will show you how to do so by harnessing the power of Apache Spark and other important open source libraries.

Keynote Speaker Bio: Jeff Smith builds large-scale machine learning systems using Scala and Spark. For the past decade, he has been working on data science applications at various startups in New York, San Francisco, and Hong Kong. He’s a frequent blogger and the author of “Reactive Machine Learning Systems,” an upcoming book from Manning on how to build real-world machine learning systems using Scala, Akka, and Spark. He leads the data engineering team at x.ai, building Amy, an artificial intelligence who schedules meetings.

Agenda:

7:00pm - 7:20pm  Introduction by IBM - Apache Spark


7:20pm - 8:00pm  Keynote presentation - Spark for Reactive Machine Learning: Building Intelligent Agents at Scale


8:00pm - 8:30pm  Networking and Refreshments

Venue Sponsor: WeWork - "WeWork is the platform for creators.  We provide the workspace, community, and services you need to make a life, not just a living.  To learn more about the WeWork locations in New York City, click here to book a tour or send an email to [masked]

Thanks to an awesome partnership among the Malala Fund, <a>Girl Be Heard</a>, and Creative Chaos, we invite you to a private screening of...


"He Named Me Malala"

at 28 Jay Street in DUMBO, Brooklyn,

7pm, Wednesday, May 11th.
Space is limited. 

RSVP HERE is required: ([masked])
click 'events' and look left for 'Malala'.

He Named Me Malala is a documentary film about Pakistani education activist, Malala Yousafzai. It is an intimate portrait of Malala and her family, and their fight for the right of girls everywhere to go to school. 

Girl Be Heard has a special connection with Nobel Laureate Malala Yousafzai and had the honor of performing for her and her father at the Asia Society for the premiere of the film. You can watch Girl Be Heard's Malala-inspired performance

"I want to thank Girl Be Heard for putting to music the beautiful anthem I created for the Malala Fund," said

Malala Yousafzai

.  "It is your love, your support, your faith that strengthen me each and every day."

Following the screening will be a Q&A led by Girl Be Heard Director of Global Partnerships,

Abigail Ramsay: "We are delighted to partner once again with the Malala Fund and with our neighbors, Creative Chaos," says Ms. Ramsay. "Malala is an all-time favorite shero among our girls."

We hope to see you there!
results.name: Join Girl Be Heard for a screening of the documentary 'He Named Me Malala', 5/11

results.description:
Ad Blockers have gotten a lot of recent attention, especially in the publishing space. Come listen to a discussion with Till Fiada
, who founded AdBlock Plus - about current and future state of ad blocking. About Till: (from EyeO)


Till Faida founded Eyeo GmbH 2011 in Cologne with Wladimir Palant to help run Adblock Plus, the world’s most popular browser extension, and to develop additional software that provides users more control over their surfing experience. As CEO he manages the business side of the company and is currently working on the Acceptable Ads initiative which seeks to establish user-friendly ad formats in the online advertising industry and broker a compromise between users who block ads and advertisers who make them. His background in international online marketing, as well as his interest in technical issues assisted Faida in pursuing Eyeo’s idea of making the Internet a better place.
results.name: Ad Blocker tech discussion with Till Faida, founder of AdBlock Plus.

results.description:
Hi all, for May, let's meetup and read The Brief and Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao by New Jersey's own Junot Diaz...

"Oscar is a sweet but disastrously overweight ghetto nerd who—from the New Jersey home he shares with his old world mother and rebellious sister—dreams of becoming the Dominican J.R.R. Tolkien and, most of all, finding love. But Oscar may never get what he wants. Blame the fukú—a curse that has haunted Oscar’s family for generations, following them on their epic journey from Santo Domingo to the USA. Encapsulating Dominican-American history, The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao opens our eyes to an astonishing vision of the contemporary American experience and explores the endless human capacity to persevere—and risk it all—in the name of love."

results.description:
I'm  now going to be traveling for work on 4/27, so I've had to reschedule for Wednesday, May 11. I hope you can all make the new date!

In advance of Mother's Day, let's talk mamas - good, bad, and ugly!

Let's chat about "My Name Is Lucy Barton: A Novel" by Elizabeth Strout in the private, back room of 16 Prospect.

Here's Amazon's summary:
#1 NEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLER • A new book by Pulitzer Prize winner Elizabeth Strout is cause for celebration. Her bestselling novels, including Olive Kitteridge and The Burgess Boys, have illuminated our most tender relationships. Now, in My Name Is Lucy Barton, this extraordinary writer shows how a simple hospital visit becomes a portal to the most tender relationship of all—the one between mother and daughter.

Lucy Barton is recovering slowly from what should have been a simple operation. Her mother, to whom she hasn’t spoken for many years, comes to see her. Gentle gossip about people from Lucy’s childhood in Amgash, Illinois, seems to reconnect them, but just below the surface lie the tension and longing that have informed every aspect of Lucy’s life: her escape from her troubled family, her desire to become a writer, her marriage, her love for her two daughters. Knitting this powerful narrative together is the brilliant storytelling voice of Lucy herself: keenly observant, deeply human, and truly unforgettable.

The NYT Sunday Book Review also wrote about the book in January: http://www.nytimes.com/2016/01/10/books/review/elizabeth-strouts-my-name-is-lucy-barton.html?_r=0
results.name: April Book Club

results.description:
The Place: Berimbau Do Brasil serves a variety of authentic Brazilian food in an intimate, understated setting. The exposed brick, subtle lighting and joyful Brazilian music create a warm atmosphere. This cozy neighborhood gem offers a diverse menu of flavorful, elegantly plated traditional Brazilian dishes. 

http://berimbaunyc.com/


RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event.

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better, but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future.

Please note that meetup events are strictly for members. No +1s are allowed as reservations are made in advance and spots are assigned. First time members must confirm in writing that they will attend. Individuals that are no shows are immediately banned from the group. Thanks.

results.description:
Wednesday Runs in Central Park!

On hump day, we own the pavement. Going forward, we'll meet on Wednesdays at 7:30PM at the southwest corner of Central Park. We'll start with a brief stretch and share, and then we'll embark on either the 3-mile or 6-mile loop.

This running group is for everyone in the innovation/startup community, but we don't discriminate. We're open to all runners and professions. Please RSVP when you know you'll be able to meet.

After our runs we'll relax at a nice nearby pub to discuss how we're going to fix the world's problems.

Clarification on the meeting spot: We'll meet at the northeast corner of Columbus Circle. This is the same as the southwest corner of Central Park. We'll meet right next to the big statue that is next to the entrance to the park trail. Just be precise, we'll meet at the immediate west of said big statue.

See you soon!

Alex

results.description:
Wednesday night training tends to focus on randori (free response training), and with work on one or two techniques or drills. If you are new to training, this will not be as intense for you as for people that have been training long term. Please check the FAQ if you have any questions. If there isn't an answer there, shoot me an email, and I'll respond as soon as possible.

Class is free if it's your first time.  You can start training in sweats and a T-shirt or bring your own gi. We also ask that your fingernails and toenail be clipped short to avoid injury.  

Please fill out this form (just name, address, contact information, and sign date it) and bring it with you.  Do not worry about paying the fee.  You'll do that if you continue training with us.  It's just that the form is also the liability waiver.

Dojo visitors from other training groups (Judo, BJJ, DZR) may pay the one time mat fee to train.

Approximate breakdown of class:
7:30: setup and change
7:45: Begin stretching and ukemi work
8:15: Begin technique work
8:30: randori/sparing 
9:20: Conditioning
9:30: Class ends, put away mats, change.

Dojo visitors from other training groups (Judo, BJJ, DZR) may pay the one time mat fee to train.
results.name: Wednesday Night Randori Training

We got comics from NBC, Comedy Central, BET and more. We are not here to drag you through a boring show and make you wonder why you didn't rent a movie. We are here to put on a great show with credited comics and leave you wanting to comeback for more. We know life is hard and for few hours we want you to forget and just laugh away. We are something to see in Bk and another reason this city is great! Be a part of something special. Welcome to SMASH! Doors Open at 7:30pm

results.description:
Class focus is on restorative postures with a gentle sequence. Good for anyone, especially those looking to practice yoga from a gentle perspective.
Yoga can be taught from a chair seated and standing with the aid of the back of the chair to modify postures and create a individualized experience.
Vinyasa and Core Strength Yoga are taught in fusion. Breathing techniques are taught in sequence with posture names, positioning, parts of the body that benefit (adverse muscle groups, organs and nervous system) and the Chakras that will be balanced in association.
Extra 15 minute meditation practice given after class during Savasana (final relaxation) for those interested in a deeper practice. Bringing greater spirituality, grounding and peace of mind. 

Discount for those 65 years or over or on Medicare. 

This is a wheel chair excessible facility.

Free Parking. 

$12 a lesson.

$10 for seniors.

Stop Worrying, Start Living

There are many uncertainties in this life. When we respond with worry, our mind becomes tight and uncomfortable, and it can be difficult to think clearly or enjoy anything. In this series we will learn to replace worry with positive, constructive attitudes in meditation and during our meditation breaks, so that we can enjoy life with confidence. Each class is self contained. No prior meditation experience is required. Everyone welcome.

$15.00 Suggested donation. No one turned away for lack of funds.

results.description:
Experience a Spiritual Tool
That Can Help Transform Your Life!

No matter what your spiritual background or faith, you are invited to learn a simple technique that can help transform your life. Join us and others in your community to experience spiritual insights gained by singing HU—a love song to God.

Singing HU can:
• Expand your awareness
• Help you release mental and emotional stresses
• Heal a broken heart
• Offer solace during times of grief
• Help you experience divine love


We sing HU together for about 20 minutes followed by five minutes of quiet contemplation. Light refreshment and conversation follow. Please join us—your friends and family are invited, too. We hope to see you there.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zvecTKM_-wk

For more information about HU check out www.HearHU.org. For information on other events being held throughout the state, visit www.eckankar-nj.org.


Every Second Wednesday,  7:30 – 8:30 pm

ECKANKAR Center
11 Park Street, Montclair, NJ
There is on-street parking and two municipal parking lots in the area. Please pay particular attention to meters and parking signs. (Metered parking is free evenings after 7pm and on Sundays.)

Presented by the Satsang Society of New Jersey, Inc., a Chartered Affiliate of ECKANKAR, Religion of the Light and Sound of God and hosted by the Center for Spiritual Living North Jersey.

Hi! I'm Aishling, a certified PiYo instructor. PiYo is a fun and dynamic blend of Pilates and Yoga. It combines the muscle-sculpting, core-firming benefits of Pilates with the strength and flexibility advantages of yoga. And, I crank up the speed to deliver a true fat-burning, low-impact workout that leaves your body looking long, lean, and incredibly defined.

I teach classes at The Aisling Irish Community Center on McLean Ave and I would love to have you join me. Classes are usually $10 pay as you go but I am offering your first class for free! Feel free to bring a friend too. You can reach out to me at [masked] or call/text me on (914)[masked] if you have any questions or if you want to chat.

Hope to see you there!
Aishling

results.description:
Whether you're completely new to meditation, fresh out of an MBSR class, or an advanced practitioner wanting to find a local sangha (supportive, like-minded individuals who help deepen your practice), this weekly meditation is open to all.

Insight Summit is a peer led group, facilitated by MBSR teacher-in-training, Jessica O'Neill. Our sangha is overseen by meditation teacher, Kerry Rasp, who will attend and lead our group, on occasion.

This week's group will include a guided sitting meditation in the Vipassana (Mindfulness) tradition, followed by discussion.

Chairs provided, though feel free to bring a yoga mat, blanket or cushions. No charge, but dana (a donation) will be gratefully accepted. (Suggested donation $10, but please give what is right for you.)

Enter the church on the side facing Waldron Ave. The double doors are locked, but the single door all the way to the right is open (you'll see a sign on it). We'll be meditating in the large room on the left. Please try to arrive 5 min early so you can get settled before we start promptly at 7:45pm. If you're running late, it's okay. Just enter quietly and take a seat.

There's a public parking lot located on DeForest (between Woodland and Maple). Or you can park on Springfield. All lots and meters are free after 6pm. (If other spaces are available, please try not to park on Waldron.) 


* You do not need to be a member of this (or any) church to attend. This is a completely independent meditation group.

* The Meetup RSVP list doesn't reflect actual attendance, since those from Insight Timer and other meditation groups also attend.
results.how_to_find_us: Church is on the corner of Springfield Ave and Waldron. Park on Springfield Ave, or there's a free parking lot on DeForest (between Woodland and Maple). Enter church through side door on Waldron and you'll see us in the room on the left.
results.name: Insight Summit- Mindfulness Meditation Drop-In Sit

group.name: Insight Summit- Weekly Drop-in Mindfulness Meditation Group

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
